The greatest strength of Naruto is its characters's stories. As a series with such a long runtime, Naruto has the chance to introduce and flesh out numerous characters, and because it is so long, I ended being quite attached to them. One of the strengths of this author is creating strong emotional backstories for his characters, and this was by far the best aspect of Shippuuden for me. The never-give-up attitude of Naruto is a staple of the shonen protagonist, but I feel Naruto owns and embodies this quality so well in a world filled with people who have given up in one way or
                  another that it becomes his own. 
The infamous talk-no jutsu, the tendency of fights in Naruto to include an actual argument between Naruto and his opponent, is in my eyes one of the strengths of the series, because it made all those conflicts more than power struggles; they were also ideological conflicts. I am not claiming that the ideological struggles in question were deep necessarily but it does give them more meaning. 
One thing that impressed me with Naruto in general and is reflected in Shippuuden is that even though the story went on for so long and in some ways it's clear more than one retcon happened over its run, the world it constructed was remarkably well-rounded and all the dots were connected. For me this was never more clear than during the double episode revealing the circumstances of Naruto's birth, which managed to explain everything we knew from the first series and link to everything we learned afterwards, even though I'm willing to bet it wasn't how Kishimoto had imagined it would have gone when he began this story.
There are some big weaknesses to Shipuuden. 
The most obvious one is the incredible amount of filler. While some arcs could be worth watching, overall they should be skipped. Some of them are so nonsensical that they can be fun to watch as basically a self-made parody of the show.
A sore spot that stands out for me is its female characters. I wouldn't say Sakura is as useless as the meme says, but it highlights how overall, the author has a really hard time giving them a story where they have agency, even if said female character is part of the main cast. There are still a few gems, mostly Tsunade.
Also the third arc is the weakest of them, despite having many epic moments and great characters, the way they are all bundled is pretty weak story-wise (notably a certain problem about masterminds in the shadows on repeat).
Nonetheless, when all is taken into account, this series is undoubtedly one of my all-time favorites. Its worldbuilding, fights and characters are just so memorable. It's not the best anime by any measure, superior entries exist in almost all regards. But Naruto has a way to make you care about its characters and get invested in their story that excuses all the filler in the world.

Despite the never-ending fillers and flashbacks, Naruto Shippuden has a very decent storyline... Perhaps the story gets well when told in many episodes... Honestly, I love watching the fillers too except the mechanaruto episodes... Well I don't like mecha thingy... 
About Naruto, I love him since the Naruto series... but in Shippuden, I didn't like him when he couldn't control his anger which consequently releases the nine-tailed fox power and unintentionally hurts his friends... 
My favourite part of the anime is the war... Everyone is united to fight the same enemy... but more importantly, there are so many surprises... Also, there are portrayals of qualities
                  such as high fighting spirit and strong comraderie... I really love them...
If I want to compare Naruto Shippuden and the Naruto series, Naruto Shippuden has more serious plot... Mostly because of the Akatsuki... Naruto Shippuden has more tragic scenes too... and of course the fighting scenes are all the higher level ones since all of the characters had developed their attitude, skills and power... Also, Naruto Shippuden is full of emotions... I cried so many times watching this series...
The OP and ED mostly are good... the background songs are very very good... they match the scenes... In fact, whenever I listen to certain songs, I would remember certain scenes...and I usually end up watching again...
For me, Naruto Shippuden is truly a masterpiece... Well, about the fillers, I do not mind at all since they somehow make me feel attached to the characters and to the canon... In fact, some fillers add more understanding of the canon... 
To those who want to try watching Naruto Shippuden, you must first watch the Naruto series... at least until Sasuke leave Konoha so that you could understand the bond between Naruto, Sasuke, Sakura and Kakashi... 😊

Before I begin, I notice this anime is one of those "love or hate" animes.  There's some people who say it's the shettiest anime ever, and some who say that it's the best anime ever.  The people who claim it's the best anime ever should watch some more anime and THEN re-rate, and the people who claim it's the shettiest anime ever... are just following the crowd because people like to bash on the popular anime.  This anime is seriously NOT OVER-rated given how many people hate this anime, and it's also not UNDER-rated given how many people love this anime. 
                  Done with my rant xD
Story - 7/10  It goes by arcs and the story isn't confusing (if you watched from the beginning) and several arcs are really sad and the plot was interesting to watch.  However, I feel like it's dragging on and on, and the comedy scenes aren't as funny as the first Naruto.  Another thing is the "I will bring back Sasuke!  Believe it!" and "He's a precious friend!"  is overused too much.  Is Sasuke the only thing Naruto thinks about?  (Then comes the SasuNaru fans, myself included)  I don't get how a traitor who betrayed his friends and village due to jealousy and vengeance is still a friend, but if Naruto thinks that, then it's fine I guess.
Art - 9/10  Clean and easy on the eye, nothing too special, but the art is pretty nice.
Sound - 10/10  
Character - 7/10  The characters each have their own personalities, and I don't see much Mary/Gary stus.... except for Naruto himself.  Not only can he train faster than anyone else (like when getting the rasengan and sage mode), he can also persuade a godly powerful dude (Pein).  Naruto, in the beginning was a knucklehead ninja that everyone hates, but toward the end, he became less of a knucklehead and people began to acknowledge him, which was good character developement.  Something about the characters annoy me, and that is how SO MANY characters have a emo sob story behind them.
Enjoyment - 9/10  I enjoyed it.
Overall - 7/10
The "motto" is like "If you work your butt off and have the will to do something, you will succeed" which is obviously not true.  I also dislike the fact how Naruto often touches his tummy and go like 'Oh the nine tailed fox is inside me"  It just looks wrong... and sounds wrong...  I can imagine Naruto giving birth to the Nine tailed fox lol....  Another thing I'd like to say has nothing to do with the review, but if the whole village treated me like shot shet and a jealous friend betrayed me, I wouldn't just put up with it... I'd probably bomb dat stupid village and give the friend a serious beating...

Story: The story of Naruto Shippuden is about Naruto Uzumaki he is one of the 9 jinchuriki. Naruto came back to the Leaf Villiage and god knows where he was. And this continues with Naruto continuing going after Sasuke Uchiha, his best friend. It's a nice story to be honest.
Art: The art in Naruto Shippuden is the same as the original just a bit upgraded. It's art is very good, compared to most anime I've seen.
Sound: The sound is great it's the same as the original Naruto, so there's not that much to it.
Character: The character in Naruto is good, it's just the development,
                  it's so slow, and you hardly see any development after any battles. Only with Naruto, you hardly see any other characters develop.
Enjoyment: I've enjoyed the series a lot, Naruto is one of my first animes I've ever watched it's a good anime, and it has a great story, very good art, and great sound.
Overall: I rate Naruto Shippuden an 8/10. The sequel to this series great, the art and sound are great, same with the story. It's just the character that stops this anime from getting a 9/10. I wish we get to see other characters learn new jutsus, this series is very good overall. I recommend it to people getting into anime.

It's a boring show and I couldn't even stand watching it anymore. I don't read the manga, so I won't be comparing it to the manga.
Up until the Pain arc ended the show was great (I would of gave a 8 overall) except for boring filler episodes, but once the Konoha past filler ended it went straight down hill. It started becoming some bad emotional drama. Every second a flashback would occur showing some scene involving Naruto and Sasuke playing the SAME song every time. I mean 2 non-filler episodes were literally 18 minutes of flashbacks showing the same flashbacks they played the last 10
                  episodes. 
I can't stand the silly plot anymore and if flashbacks are not happening it's the same thing reoccurring. All the Hokages 'WAR' let's go tell the feudal lords 'WAR' let's let all the people know 'WAR' that took 20 episodes LONG. There was no plot development what-so-ever. I plan to continue the show once the war actually begins.

An anime I was very fond of, which I could label myself a true FAN (which is rare to me) but that I unfortunately felt forced to drop.
The reason: Way too many many many fillers, plus the way that Sasuke guys suck lemons with his attitude and how Naruto won't just give up the prick just turned an anime I really liked into something un-watchable in only 95 episodes.
Plus, the story drags itself, the plot develops soooooo slowly that it makes me think Kishimoto should have been kidding his fans, to the point I felt it to be disrespectful to make an anime so mediocre
                  like Shipuuden.

To be honest.... this show was actually great... in essence, it could have been one of the most amazing and adventurous shows imaginable, with kick ass fighting scenes and heart felt emotions that are honestly pretty relate able. With its large and expansive world, having its own history to it, it's hard to imagine such a show being fucked up!!!.... Oh wait... -.- 
Now being serious, Naruto could have honestly been one of the greatest shows imagine able. You have this fleshed out story following this one kid who was looked down upon his entire life, and you see him rise and up and fulfill
                  his dream. What could be bad about that!? That already sounds awesome!! Then you add in some more kick ass characters like Kakashi and fighting scenes and an actual story and a goal and boom!! Sounds good right? R-right....?
Now... here's where in my personal taste, this potentially amazing story and show, goes skyrocketing the opposite direction it had the potential to go for. There is, so much, SO, MUCH, POINTLESS, TALKING...... in this show you will catch yourself watching 40% of the last season despite it being the next season and when I say this I mean the FLASHBACKS HOLY SHIT. The fillers in this show are even immense, most of the talking in this show is also very pointless.... and what's worse? The action is crap!! And no, I don't mean the action itself is crap, honestly it was pretty enjoyable, that 1 minute of fighting you saw for every 45 minutes of talking, you get why I think it's crap now? Even IN the middle of some fights when all the action is building up and the drama and intensity is rising, SOMEONE, SOMEWHERE, has to SOMETHING, that involves that..... or wait, even better... a flashback.... 
This show honestly had so much potential, it has such a wide spread world that is honestly pretty unique and creative. It has a very fleshed out story, explaining things from the VERY beginning (you rarely if ever see shows doing this) and an amazing adventure following this one admirable kid grow up with great and fleshed out characters near him. The fighting itself is honestly not boring and some of the dialogue is honestly pretty interesting, and heartfelt. But what totally and completely ruins this show for me is the fillers, the constant nonsensical talking, and the CONSTANT FLASHBACKS I CANNOT STRESS THIS, We just got done watching Naruto when he was a kid (first season) and we're onto the second season and you think we need to REWATCH what we already WATCHED!? And that's not including the fillers that INVOLVE flashbacks that have NOTHING to do with the show. Literally the most pointless thing imaginable, imagine it, right now, and Naruto will make a fucking filler out of it somehow. 
Mind you most of this is the show version, I heard a lot of the fillers and pointless talking is taken out of the manga, but honestly I wish they did a better job with the anime.... the sounds in this show are honestly quite nice and do a good job of impacting the show and making the scenes they provide more vibrant.....
With Narutos interesting and unique characters and setting, along with an admirable person following an ambitious dream leading us to various interesting and adventurous tales and awesome fight scenes, this show had so much potential..... I hope in the future they will do a rework on this could be great show.

If you haven't watched Naruto before Naruto shippuden you might still get the plot but the feeling will not be the same, so i highly recommend you to watch Naruto to get the full experience of the path to your ninja way.
Anyway, the story and most of the plot twists are extremely interesting but first you need to get through some occasional fillers that really did frustrate me though i think they were worth it as when the time came for the episode (non-filler) it gave me so much adrenaline all the way throughout the 20 minutes. I also liked that not all episodes were
                  serious and manged to give off a funny vibe to them making it quite enjoyable and making it possible for us to see a different side to the characters.
The animation was fantastic and you could see that they actually spent a lot of thought and time in making the fight scenes. I also personally very liked the character design as it wasn't too much so that all the attention is taken off the plot and just towards the character and not too little so that you can't work out who the main characters are... In addition, all the antagonists had a very decent back-story to why they became like that and this is why my favorite character is Uchiha Itachi (not going to give any spoilers on him so i'll just leave it at that)
Now the sound. The sound...what can i say... the sound and all the openings are defiantly something that i rarely skipped. But the very first opening of Naruto Shippuden is still something i sometimes listen to as i don't think i will ever binge watch this anime because it took me about two months, something i do not and never will regret.
I'm sorry but i didn't like this anime i thought the art was very disappointing i also thought that tv tokyo really let me down with it there a zero for over all sorry if u hate me

Regarded as one of the world’s most popular and long-standing animations, Naruto has undoubtedly crafted a shinobi universe that is intriguing for anime viewers. The styles of different clans, the movement of each jutsu, the history of each nations, all of them are well-choreographed and deserve a big applause. The foreshadowing is brilliant and what amazes me is that they always succeed in keeping the mystery going until the “real” truth is unveiled, such as the Itachi/Sasuke arc and Madara/Tobi arc. 
Why Naruto as a character Ruins it for me:
The downside is, while there is an amazing array of characters on the show (i.e. Rock
                  Lee, Gaara, Shino, Iruka), the show solely puts its spotlight on Naruto - which is a shame. The author made no effort to give other characters a chance to shine and that leaves the show rather dull and one-dimensional. Characters like Tenten, Ino and Kurenai are merely females to waste away in the background.
My least favourite part is Naruto Uzumaki, who has continued to be one of the most unconvincing and quite frankly, an annoying and obnoxious character. His positivity gradually becomes a massive turn-off in the show. When it progresses to a point where everyone just blindly praises whatever comes out of Naruto’s mouth, you just can’t help but roll your eyes. It’s so far-fetched that it’s just absolutely bonkers! There is a fine line between a motivational speaker that is full of utter gibberish and a good inspiring character that doesn’t overcompensate, and here is where Naruto fails to do for me. Everytime he speaks, I would just happily mute the thing. :)
One of the wasted potentials in the show is characters like Rock Lee, who works his way up against all odds and no ninjutsu talent. With his humble (and much more likable) attitude, I can see how this underdog could potentially turn the table at the end. Still, the show never shows mercy to any character other than Naruto. Most of the time, everyone is just there fighting until they are saved and rescued by the all-mighty Naruto and his “genuinity”. For once, I would just like to see other capable characters to shine in their own ninja way, instead of making the Naruto way the only way. 
Last but not least, the amount of filler and recap is frustrating. You spend 20 minutes watching a full episode and only ¼ of it is new. What a drag. As someone who started out as a huge fan watching, and having a completely different opinion towards the end, I am to say the least disappointed. On the other hand, I would recommend its two spin-offs, Uchiha Sasuke no Sharingan Den (manga) and Rock Lee and His Ninja Pals (anime and manga), which are very well-written and hit all the right notes if you’re down for some lovely wholesome humour.

Let me start this review by saying I've seen every episode that has been aired for both Naruto (completed) and Naruto Shippuden (currently) and yes that also includes fillers.
*Now I understand that not everyone is going to have the same opinion as me but the entire Naruto franchise will always have a dear place in my heart and here's why:
Story: The story line for Naruto Shippuden is a lot different from Naruto, but it is equally great. Once you get past the infinite amount of filler, or decide to skip them, it is clear that although Sasuke's retrieval makes up most of the adventures, there
                  is just SO MUCH MORE to follow along with. Naruto Shippuden can have you crying, laughing, stressed and angry all in the course of one episode. 
Characters: My oh my how they have changed. All of the characters have grown so much and even Kiba is likable haha.
Here are two examples:
Naruto came back a whole new person. Literally. His outfit is upgraded, his maturity has somewhat increased, and so has his height ;)
Sakura: one of my favorite characters is clearly no longer "useless". I love her but I have to admit, she did not have much to contribute to Part 1 but now... If you haven't caught up to at least episode 400, your in for a treat!
Overall Naruto and Naruto Shippuden, the movies, the manga, everything is 100% enjoyable and if you decide to stick with it to the end, you'll be in for a treat

The penultimate story of growth in a ninja. A story that took 15 years to tell on screen, 10 of which were in this series. A tale that spans exactly 500 episodes and leads to a feeling of satisfaction and completion. This is the legend of Naruto Uzumaki.
Story: 9/10
The story takes place following the events of "Naruto: The Series". Sasuke is gone. Naruto has gone to train with Master Jiraiya. Everyone else in Naruto's ninja class has some sort of training to do of their own. We come back from the 2 year time jump to Naruto's return to the Leaf Village. Time to start
                  the endless train of action, suspense, and detailed storytelling. Naruto must prevent the heinous Akatsuki group from stealing the power of the tailed beasts to start a massive war that spans across the world, all the while trying to find his lost friend and return him home. While some filler arcs take place here and there and some episodes are akin to Dragon Ball in that there's a whole lot of standing around and talking, the action and set-pieces are a joy to behold and you can't wait to see what happens next.
Art: 8/10
As soon as the first episodes airs, you can see a difference in quality and design in the animation department compared to the first series. Vivid colors and detailed expressions are abound in every scene. Fight sequences are expertly choreographed and have your eyes jumping around the screen. On rare instances, the animation turns to a swift, almost comedic style, especially during rapid fight sequences (Naruto vs Pain). However, these changes in quality are almost endearing and help express the action even better in my opinion.
Sound: 8/10
The music and voice acting that goes into this show are stellar. Sure, we get a lot of Naruto screaming and shouting, but the emotional and happy points in the story are all worth it in the end. Seeing character's emotions on full display through voice acting is genuinely an art on its own. The music tracks that play throughout the story help bolster scenes and the emotions that viewers should be feeling.
Character: 9/10
This is the driving force of a story. Character development and how they alter and mature through the course of a series is paramount to its enjoyment. Here, we see characters change their views on the world and its outlook just on the basis of a few words. The power of words can be very strong, especially when they're wielded by someone who never gives up. Nearly every character that we got to know in the first series has a moment to shine at some point, granted it's 500 episodes in its entirety.
Enjoyment: 10/10
Overall, I had a blast watching this series. I never read the manga, so I never knew what to expect during each episode. The occasional filler arc was a drag to have to wait through, but sometimes you get character development that you see further down the line due to what happened during filler arcs. Once the show came around the final corner and reached its end, I was both sad to see this show reach its end, but also happy with its conclusion. 
Then we got Boruto, which is a creature all on its own. You can read my review of that show to see what I mean.

Ever since I was a kid I have followed this, and it's always been my very favorite. But I think you need to watch Naruto before you start on Shippuuden as it carries a lot of backstory over. 
Shippuuden has a lot of fillers here and there but in the long run it's worth it for me. Some fillers are okay, they actually add story to a lot of characters, others are just horrid and pointless. In a sense it adds a lot of tension and build up to the main story. 
It will not shy away from death either in the characters, which is
                  personally one of my very favorite things about this show. I can't stand it when people survive miraculously by some freak-cause. 
Overall I highly recommend this anime. Maybe skip the fillers at most.

Best freaking show of all time hands down, no cap. This show changed my life in every way not even joking it has a perfect story full of development and amazing characters. I would highly highly highly recommend this show for many reasons. It taught me more about love, life and faith than anything else. I cannot say enough good about this show. Watch it and stick with it until the end the reward is insane even though it is long it is so worth it. Words don’t do it justice I love it so much. This show is filled with memorable moments and characters
                  that will give you chills and make you a better person at the end. The soundtrack is unbelievably good and will, stick with you forever. This show cuts deep and makes you cry laugh and everything in between. This may seem like a fluffy all good review but that’s because it is a perfect show I am not overdoing my love for this show.

This review is spoiler free.
Well then I have been waiting to be able to write a review about an anime that has been around for almost two decades and oh boy what a anime it was. I didn't just teach us that not everything goes as planned it also teached us that everything must come to an end. And unfortunally it did. It did end, but even so this sure was a anime. Anyway let's just start!
Story 9/10: The story, the story is just your standard Underdog Action/Adventure story, but done damn right. You have probably heard of it, but we follow a boy named
                  Naruto, a boy that wants to be the hokage, but because he has a monster named the Ninetails sealed inside him everybody in the Hidden Leaf Village (The village Naruto lives in) stays away from him because they know what the Ninetails is capable of doing. But even so Naruto doesn't stop and let his rage take over no! Instead he struggles his way to everything hoping to find a ray of light at the end of the hellish road he has to walk. Overall the story was again just your standard underdog story, but because the series gone on for so long we were able to see all the events in detail and that is what I personally couldn't get enough of. Seeing all the characters grow up and new characters getting just as much growth to them.
Art/Animation 8/10: The art, the art was something I never really liked nor hated. It was well standard, just your typical anime artstyle, but the reason I gave this an 8 is because of the animation. The animation was well overall barely passable, but what made it so it got an 8 then? Well it is actually quite simple It is because of the animation in some of its fights. Yeah the reason why most of the show has "bad" animation is for the sole reason to make a important fight stand out animation wise. And these amazingly animated fights are the reason that I got into Naruto, there is just something so satisfying seeing a fight with incredible animated choreography and a story that they are telling during the fights. It is just perfect, even though it only lasts for a couple of minutes it still drives you to watch more of it even if it is just to see another of those great animated fights.
Sound 8/10: The music of both Naruto and Naruto Shippuden aren't anything outlandish, no the opposite. It is just your upbeat songs but this time around it has a shinobilike vibe to it. And it fits perfectly. But there is none of them that really stands out to me like You Say You Run from Boku No Hero Academia for example. So overall Naruto just has some solid osts which I can enjoy even though I will forget them after the next episode anyway.
Characters 7/10: So the characters. Honestly Naruto has just your basic kind of characters, you have the main character that doesn't know when to give up, the rival of the main character who everybody likes but is depressed as **** and then you have the main waifu who is mostly there for "emotional" moments even though every time she is in an opening she cries. Anyway, even though Naruto has some of the most basic character tropes they are still different and that is because the show went on for so long the characters were able to develop their their feelings. And because of that you still manage to get attached to them.
Enjoyment 10/10: I'll keep this one rather short because there is not much to say. The enjoyment of this show was perfect. The anime managed to find a balance between serious fights and comedic episodes so that it never felt out of place. And because of that I could always enjoy the serious episodes but also the episodes where there are just solid jokes after jokes.
Overall 8/10: Overall the show was really good and truly it was a once in a lifetime anime expierence. I don't know yet if I will watch boruto but what I do know is that this anime now has a special place in my heart even though it is not in my personal top 10 favorite anime. 
Well then hopefully you liked this review. This one was rather short but I am satisfied with it. Well then see ya'll!

Overview: I like Naruto Shippuden’s special abilities, complex battle scenes, and rivalries. I think they are unique to the series and kept me invested throughout its run. However, the delivery of Naruto is the key to understanding why the show is so good. The unique philosophy each character abides by, the lack of a villain who is evil “just cause”, and the ongoing themes embedded throughout the series are what truly makes the show great. I’m writing this review because I enjoyed watching Naruto immensely, but also because I felt the show constantly shifted my outlooks on power, dignity, friendship, and isolation. To me, a
                  show that is both fun to watch and makes you think deeply about how your perspective compares to that of the show’s characters is the ultimate form of entertainment.
Story: 10
Naruto Shippuden has one of the most, if not the most, enticing story for a long-running anime. Yes (semi-spoiler), there were perhaps too many “he/she was just a puppet for a greater being” toward the end of the 4th Great Ninja War, but other than that, everything else flows smoothly. The transition from villain to villain and plot to plot is relatively clean, and I never felt any milestone or major feat within the series came either too soon or too late. The way in which Naruto Shippuden tells its story is unique in that we are always able to see both sides of the fight, instead of only that of our protagonist. I know that is more of a character analysis, but I felt it really helps the viewer understand the weight of each conflict. And don’t even get me started on the fights. From the brief, speechless fights where the tension is so thick you could cut it with a knife, to the drawn out, intelligent fights where characters use both their abilities and their wits to fight it out for hours, Naruto Shippuden’s fights rarely cease to amaze me.
Art: 8
The art in the fights is fluid and each frame could be considered a masterpiece given its context. However, not all of Naruto is fighting. In fact, as crazy as it may be, a majority of the time is not spent fighting. The characters talk, walk, and eat too. It’s crazy. For these sections, the art can lack compared to the fights. It never seems to be bad or even average animation, but Naruto definitely has some stronger attributes than its animation.
Sound: 10
Giving any show a 10 in sound is hard, probably because of shows like Naruto. The theme songs change every arc or so, yet I would say almost all the theme songs do a good job of expressing the emotion embedded within the arc. Some theme songs are also just straight up amazing hype songs, and to watch any theme song that gets you pumped up for the next 20 minutes worth of episode is always a delight. The most well known Naruto song, Sorrow and Sadness, perhaps epitomizes the greatness of Naruto’s sound. The original, upbeat Naruto theme song which played whenever a young Naruto triumphed over evil evolved into an emotion filled, moving classical symphony that reflects both the changes of Naruto and the show as a whole. No other show I’ve seen has done such unique, incredible music, and I think it’ll be like that for a very long time.
Character: 9
This is the hardest part of my rating. Personally, I love Deidara. He is a stagnant, narcissistic asshole who values his ideals above all else. Usually, this type of character would piss me off because of my ability to relate him solely depends on whether or not I agree with his ideals. He has little background, and never grows. This is the brilliance of such a character, however. By staying true to his ideals throughout the show, all of Deidara’s decisions can be tied back to the idea he represents. Because we cannot relate to Deidara, we view him not as a person but as a representative for his motives. He lives to create art, and he believes his form of art is superior to all. By constantly risking his life to prove this sole belief, we come to accept Deidara values this ideal above his own life. So when characters who do have backgrounds, who do develop, and who seem more human than Deidara arrive, their methods of interaction with him emphasize the charcter’s feeling toward the idea Deidara represents. Naruto Shippuden does this with many characters, as each character seems to have their own personal philosophy of how the world ought to be, and their own motives for changing the world as well. Naruto himself is annoying at first, but he gets better as he matures, and the events which cause his maturity are well-paced and dignified. Sakura sucks, but not as bad as everyone says she does. The Akatsuki are dope in general. Sasuke, well, he is two things. He is a mess of a character who’s actions can be quite baffling. While I feel I understood Sasuke personally, many of his actions don’t make sense unless you understand the mindset of a psychopath. At the same time, he is the perfect foil for Naruto in literally every way and makes the show 100x better.
Enjoyment: 10
I would recommend skipping almost all the fillers except for those toward the end, and binge watching Naruto can get hard. It’s best to usually watch one arc in a short amount of time than take a break for s few days to a week or so before picking it up again. This just prevents the show from losing its shine. Other than that, Naruto was a blast to watch and I have definitely rewatched the series a decent amount of times. It’s that good.
Overall: 10
(Spoilers) Naruto is a show that constantly asks the question “How do we make the world a better place?” Pain, Madara, Sasuke, Naruto, Kakashi, and many other charcters try to answer this question. Each character seems to have their own personal opinion on the answer to this question, and each character seems to have their own motive for trying to make their opinion a reality. The conflict of characters who all desire the same thing yet are inspired by different motives and different backgrounds creates an engaging story. Ultimately, Naruto Shippuden may not be the show for you if you purely enjoy watching a story that lacks mistakes and leaves you with a warm feeling In your stomach. But, if you like the idea of controlling powers beyond belief, villains who are real charcters and not just one dimensional antagonist, an intense story, a main character who constantly is growing, and a range of perspectives which make you question your personal beliefs, then Naruto Shippuden is the show for you.

Even though I marked some things as outstanding... I have to say that I think the writer and anime producers of this anime need to stop focusing so much on developing Sasuke. 
I'd like to see more of what Naruto can do then see Sasuke completely be the main focus when the anime and manga is called Naruto...I dislike it when writers focus more on one character instead of focusing on the whole reason they wrote the series called NARUTO.

I am completely overwhelmed with the slow pace of this show. This show is not what it used to be back then. The story is definitely good, the art is decent, sound...sure it's good, characters are definitely interesting, but I just cannot enjoy it because it is so slow. The fights are too long. At first it was fine, but it kept on nagging me. I'm just going to drop it. It was fun watching this anime series, but it just is not developing quickly enough.

Naruto Shippuden is 60% filler episodes and 40% story
Story: 
This is your basic gotta get to the next power level to beat Cell kind of story. they do try to throw in some emotional stuff but it falls very flat and the ending ends just how you expect it. The story is so attached to the main group of side characters the only 3 out of over 20+ actually die.
Art:
Even though the anime ran from 07' to 17' the art style more or less stayed in the 07' era thus the later animation is average quality
Sound: 
Many Many theme songs for some one or two
                  might be decent enough. However the Main characters voice is like nails on a chalkboard. The same song is used repeatedly(for dramatic effect) in many of the episodes thus nullifying any impact it once had.
Characters:
The One place where this anime shines and the reason this anime has the most fanfics of any anime. Let me be clear, Naruto the main character has a terrible voice, is pretty annoying and has a extremely ridiculous obsession with Sasuke. I hate Naruto, but There are so many other decently fleshed out characters you will find a few that you may like and most of these character get an episode or two where they are the main focus.
Enjoyment: 
The fact that every episode has a flashback of a previous episode or flash back of a flashback that we have already seen (which sometime take up more then half the episodes runtime) makes this anime extremely annoying to watch and has gained the nickname FlashBack Simulator. Then smack dab in the middle of a main story arc they put in filler arcs just to extend the series length and making so you have to burn through an arc that has nothing to do with the main story to get back to the main story. Even then some episode are nothing but slow talking with long pauses and by the time the episode ends not a lot has actually happened. Some fights are really really good while others they just stand there and talk a lot.
Overall:
 If You have LOTS of spare time and liked the original series you may like this or you could skip to the last 10 or so episodes and be like ok this is them 2-6 years later the end.

Story - If you managed to get through the first arc of this action anime Naruto, being 220 episodes whether you skipped the massive amounts of filler or not there is no reason to not watch this arc then since it is better in every way from before. Everything is more intense this time around and with less filler!...still some filler but in comparison to before it's less and more of the filler is actually interesting and enjoyable. Best overall story I have seen in any anime to date, so many twists and turns and surprises that I was always left wanting to watch more.
                  It only gets more intense the deeper you go so always more to look forward too till the very end.   
Characters - Since this arc takes place a few years after the previous all the characters have noticeable growth which is interesting to take notice too and in what areas. Just like the previous arc there are a great many characters to be interested in for different reasons with their own uniqueness that you can enjoy learning about many of their backstories and seeing how they are involved with the overall plot. This anime tries more this time around to write in romance as an aspect which is done better this time around...still dull and mostly annoying but it's mildly there and better at least. With hat said though the female characters do get an upgrade for sure and seem to become a much greater threat and aspect to the story this time around.
Quality - The action scenes are very fluid and amazing to watch with even more variety in the amount of abilities shown. With great visuals followed along with a great soundtrack and complex animation scenes it definitely makes for a great experience.
Overall - If you watched the previous arc of Naruto then there is absolutely no reason to not watch this arc because it is better in every way so if you enjoyed Naruto you will be amazed with this one. Naruto was my favorite anime but with this addition it solidified it to remain in that position. To much unique aspects to this anime in terms of action and story to not appreciate it fully for what it is...amazing!

Overall, the series had a good plot with twist and turns, though a bit cliché. The main thing that would turn people away is the length of the anime, the amount of filler, the amount of episodes dedicated to flashbacks that have already been shown.
The art style was pretty good for an anime so long, being simple but enough for viewers to be able to clearly differentiate characters. There are some things in the art style that did tick me off though, like the different types of eyes - they weren't very consistent in design (some had pupils, others didn't). Also, there was the questionable
                  hair colours.
The soundtrack was the best part of Naruto Shippuden or Naruto in general. The music was really good - opening songs and ending songs were upbeat and lively (most) and the music was really good at setting the mood for the scene. One thing I did not like was the fact some characters got more than one theme song while other 'still important' characters didn't get one.
Character development continued throughout the course of the plot unless they died or went away. Character development was mostly shown through flashbacks (one of the anime's favourite things to do) and interactions. Some characters even had a season dedicated to their life story. There was something I was sad about however - it was the fact a particular character was given a substantial amount of character development, and everyone had high hopes for them when suddenly, the creator kills them off for the sake of the next series "Boruto". Like 'bam' they died and an OTP was gone, all the character development was gone.
I did enjoy the series though with it's funny parts and serious parts, though during the series I felt like screaming because of the characters actions/stupidity/naivety.

In spite of its flaws I think Naruto is a masterpiece. 
I just want to preface this by saying Naruto is what got me into anime. And because of that I have strong emotions attached to the series. But even as I have watched many more anime, some of which I think are far better than Naruto, this series has always been something special to me. And that is not because of my emotional attachment, but the incredible writing which Kishimoto consistently displays.
………………..
Naruto Shippuden gets a lot of hate these days and it's somewhat understandable why. A poor final villain and a final arc which
                  dragged on, combined with a underwhelming sequel left a lot to be desired. But much of that hate comes from fundamental confusion about this complex series' themes, characters, and philosophies. Naruto Shippuden remains a great, often underrated, shounen, and a generally amazing anime overall, given you skip the filler. 
Story: The story starts off strong from the timeskip. The introduction of the akatsuki serves as a menacing and badass villain introduction. The first arc starts strong, building up tension to a climax, although it does struggle with it's pacing. The second arc is a satisfying and awesome way to reintroduce Sasuke as a character, and display his growth. Shippuden peaks in its writing from the Hidan and Kakuzu arc through the Five Kage Summit. Emotional character deaths, one of anime's best villains in Pain, and exceptional character development for the many characters serve as one of the most entertaining stretches in anime I have watched. Despite the initial quality, the 4th Great Shinobi War dips significantly in quality. The writing feels repetitive, and slow. I lost interest at some points and couldn't tell what was filler and not. Kaguya was one of the worst twists in any anime I have watched, but between that mess, there were still entertaining fights and moments. It did not ruin the series and is still solid overall.
Animation: The animation normally ranges from mediocre to ok, but during important fight scenes (Kakashi vs Kakuzu, Sakura vs Sasori, Naruto vs Pain, Kakashi Vs Obito, Madara vs Shinobi Alliance) it delivers some of the most memorable hand to  hand combat I have seen in anime. The animation alone often makes decent fights from the manga top tier. 
Sound: The music is one of my favorite soundtracks in any anime period. The sound effects also work well. Incredibly memorable, emotional, exciting, and intense.
Characters: Characters are perhaps Shippuden's strongest point. Kakashi, Gaara, Pain, and Itachi are characters people normally point to as their favorites. Even the often misunderstood female characters are well-written, especially Hinata, whose struggles with self-confidence I personally identify with.
 I’m going to focus on just one character as an example of how incredible the series is:
Sasuke Uchiha . People criticize him for flip-flopping on his goals. But Sasuke always has realistic, thematically relevant reasons to do so. He is a dynamic character, who falls into hatred and revenge only to discover his purpose and attempt to lead the world in his own direction. He is exploited and tormented by adults like Itachi and Obito, and struggles to find his purpose. He hates the world and its corruption, and contemplates destroying the very village he grew up in. He hates himself and his weakness, and experiences depression, ptsd, and survivors guilt. But upon reanimating the Hokage and realizing what a true shinobi is, he prepares to make the ultimate sacrifice, in a Lelouch V Brittania like fashion, and take the world's hatred onto himself. In the end, he realizes he only wanted people to understand him, and that he could never find peace through loneliness. And after going on a journey for redemption, he resolves to protect the very village he wanted to destroy with his life.
Here's why I personally find Naruto and Sasuke's rivalry/relationship so compelling: 
Even if you don't consider them rivals Naruto and Sasuke's relationship does a good job representing opposing real world philosophies, Sasuke's views could be compared to philosophers like Thomas Hobbes who believe that dictators are necessary to control humanity's evil nature, while Naruto represents a more optimistic outlook which argues for people's inherent goodness. It's a competition of ideals rather than just people
Regardless, it's more complex than who is stronger. Perhaps you could even argue their rivalry is w/ fate itself, with both of them needing to overcome the destiny that they would fight and die in order to shape their ideal of a future. They continually fought agains the destiny which wanted to drive them apart and cause conflict yet they ended up becoming bros. I do think their rivalry is flawed however, and I wish it concluded with both making concessions to each other's arguments
Enjoyment: 10. 
I waited until my birthday, October tenth, to watch the final fight which is also on that day, 10/10, which is Naruto’s birthday. 
This series’s strengths so overwhelmingly outweigh its flaws that just like Naruto and my birthdays it is a 10/10.

(This review may contain SPOILERS) Fillers... Fillers Everywhere...
Story 7
Leaving the fillers aside (because it would 1/10) Naruto Shippuuden has a giant world with fun and interesting ninja system, even making an interesting world the author left several plot holes and some very convenient things, like a mask that liberated the spirits Sealed of past Hokages by Shinigami Shiki Fujin, and a character who had a jutsu of resuscitation who were never cited before, why didn 't Danzo make his move after the third Hokage died? Villains with very weak motivations...
Art 7
Two Words = Studio Pierrot, As Naruto one of the bestsellers should have received special
                  care, several fights mainly Naruto x Pain had a low-level animation, which worsened even more in the Great Ninja War
Sound 8
Like Classic Naruto, We have several strong music, continuing with the typical Japanese instruments and sometimes a good guitar solo.
Characters 6
Naruto continues the same noisy Brat always trying to convince the opponent that he is wrong with a sermon, Sakura really grew but continues with that same stereotype annoying tsundere, Sai and Yamato made an 
interesting adhesion, were characters who knew we could Expect something,. Shikamaru, Guy and Kakashi still funny, Kiba, Rock Lee, Hinata (Naruto-kun, Naruto-kun, Kurosaki-kun,) And all other ninjas have had the potential wasted. Now the villains, isn't there some kind of Psichologist Ninja in this world? Most villains seem to do bad things because they are misunderstood or suffered trauma from the past "The girl i have a Crush who never gave me attention died what I do now? I know, I'm going to extinguish the human race." Really ????
Enjoyment 7
You can get bored with Naruto's obsession with Sasuke, or Naruto solving the problems with a conversation that his path is right and the opponent is wrong, he does it three or four times, the plot holes, but it is undeniably a great Shounen Show by the fights and interactions between some characters.

Disclaimer: I have read the manga and have spoilers are hard to avoid "ex. Boruto" so this review will include an "ending" review. 
Naruto Shippuden. I feel conflicted, I want to love Naruto but the amount of trash that I have to endure.. Is it worth it? I haven't really been to active in the anime community. Probably cause I don't enjoy that much anime anymore. I pick apart anime too much. I should just watch it for fun and not look deep into its construction... WRONG! 
Story: 5
Generic shounen. I mean this started as ninja and ended with omnipotent super powers. I remember someone
                  talking about how it used to be kunai's and shurikens being thrown but now its nuclear explosion level blasts everywhere. I remember when "ninja" was a term but this is not ninjas anymore this is some DBZ stuff. Another problem is the ending so "SPOLIERS" I guess...... Lets think about children how are they all the same age? Why are the combinations so random? I know Japan has some freaky sexual rituals but I mean how do explain this stuff ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) 
FILLERS OMG. I was able to endure the 5 episodes but those 5 episodes turned into 30. I dropped the anime at episode 375. Glad I did cause I hear they added a new filler arc right before the final battle lul.  
Art: 9
It one of the biggest anime all around the world. It would be too much if it didn't have good visuals. Didn't give it a 10/10 cause that Pain vs. Naruto fight was a pain to see ha ha ha.....
Sound: 8
Naruto's voice kind of annoys me both in the dub and sub raspy voice. Sakura just annoys me but I attribute that more me no liking her in general.  
Character: 2
Ok. So Naruto I boy who has attention problems. Yea Yea he lost his parents but he didn't really start caring until he actually "sees" them. Frankly, he put all that attention into ramen jokes. 
Sasuke the emo crybaby. Let me make up an excuse to hate everything and then contradict myself and make myself look even more stupid. 
Sakura oh boy. "I love the way you lie" - eminem and rihanna. Sums up Sakura's thoughts I think we all know how that music video ended with (The fire burned everything and everyone). So Sasuke ended up having a child with her after he tried killing her, leaving for 2 years, planning to kill and destroy everything and everyone she loved. Yea oh and after that he then leaves her to be a single mother. Good job kiddo. Oh did I mention she is also useless.
Overall: 6
While my review is only pointing out the flaws of this series I have to say I enjoyed my time with the Naruto series in general. Most of it is nostalgia cause Naruto was my gateway into more anime. Naruto is not a perfect anime. You can't give something a 10/10 if it has a flaw.  Naruto has many flaws but it doesn't mean I didn't enjoy it. We have to remember to actually set aside the nostalgia. Look at Boruto.. doesn't feel just like a quick cash. In conclusion I liked Naruto but as time went on it didn't hold up. 
Thanks for reading my review and have a Merry Christmas
-Love Santa   
P.S I don't proof read my reviews I find it cringey so a lot of grammer issues and spelling mitakes will be made. I do proof read my college essays though so don't judge me.

God I hated this whole series....
*spoilers ahead*
1.Bad Character development of girls especially.
2. No reason to hate Naruto bcoz he is a jinchuriki. Yes, he being hated for being mischievous is fine. But throwing stones at him and all was just too much. I would question the mindset of Leaf village of the people once lead by Hashirama.
3. No concrete reasons for Madara for doing what he does. Why does he want to make world better by putting everyone in The Matrix? (except Pain and Orochimaru their reasons were best).4. Plot holes and unexplained power ups at the end.
5. Fillers....sooo many horrible filers
And here my major reasons-
When you have created such a huge world it is important to explore that (especially 5 great nations). There was no proper exploring of the entire shinobi world, the various customs, history, etc.
Most important- why create the whole concept of Jinchuriki and Tailed beasts and show only two of them properly (Bee and Naruto, I am not even counting Gara). I wanted to know all Jinchuriki names, powers and back stories and most importantly see their all out fights with akatsuki and others. Also don’t each of the tailed beats have some special power that even their jinchuriki can use? (other thab TB bombs and chakra cloak).
Most important#2 Do all cool and badass clans live in Konoha? I wished to see other village clans and their keke genkais. But as i said there was no exploring. Deidara and kisame were only good other village ninjas for me.
Why make the 7 swordsmen of mist if not going to show each properly. Only Zabuza and Kisame are shown all cool. All of them should've been cool and shown in all out fight against protagonists and other characters and be in the story. 
Also, other than Kisame’s and Zabuza’s swords others were not that cool. Samehada was way too cool. All 7 should be equal badass swords.
Other villages top fighting forces should’ve been shown. Just like 7 Shinobi swordsmen.
Rock Lee was done bad, he had potential to be awesome! Might Guy should’ve died. His death would’ve been very impactful. Seems his life is just a pitiful drag on now on a wheel chair.
Orochimaru should’ve remained evil. Who doesn’t want an ultimate evil genius? He should’ve been one of the ultimate villains. And also if possible he should have been a major threat in Boruto too.
Uchiha clan became too Strong due to Sussano power. I wish it was a Rinnegan specific power.
Reanimation in the end was not following rules. Madara could do just whatever he wants. It seemed a bit like plot device.
The Otsutsuki clan should’ve been hyped from the start (of Naruto series) and a proper back story for origins of chakra and Ninjutsu should’ve been given- step by step. So when Kaguya finally makes her appearance it would look cool.
In all Naruto had all the potential to be the best anime ever. Awesome fight scenes and great animation but if you had the huge budget you should of hired better writers

watched naruto kai a direct to manga fan edit of the series so without any filler, padding and a lot of redundant flashbacks (even though there was still quite a few) and it was still a mid-affair, truly an unworthy successor to a truly great anime that was the original. While it does have it's moments, they are so brief and minute compared to the vastness of its glaring flaws. credit where credit is due hidan/jiraiya/pain arc were good and some sequences in the show are kinda goated due to it's distinct expressive artistic style which involves some fluid combat between characters which i liked.

Oh, indeed it's the ever so popular Naruto Shippuden. Ready to waste mindless hours watching yet another dragged on Shounen Anime? I sure am!
Story: It's Naruto! Of course the story is going to be pretty sappy looking. Ya'know with the Sasuke and bonds stuff. But the thing is it is executed well. So the anime in the nutshell is. Naruto has left Konoha for a period of 3 years with The Legendary Sennin Jiraiya. Within these 3 years he has been training for future endeavors. Aswell within these 3 years everyone seems to hit puberty and have a major growth spurt. The former chunnin ninja
                  have become adept, some of which have become jounin. After Naruto's fated return. His team is reunited with the classic bell retrieval test. Sakura and Naruto work together to steal the bells. They both demonstrate magnificent skill. Resulting in the reconsaince of Team Kakashi. However Kakashi is always missing or injured so Team Kakashi is lacking as a team. A mysterious new ninja and a Anbu member join the team. This is when the ultimate goal of Team Kakashi uncovers. To retrieve Sasuke and destroy Akatsuki. Seems Legit 8/10.
Art: The art has improved over the original resulting a much more enjoyable experience. However overuse of certain animations is a huge turn off. Seeing the same traveling animation is quite irritating. Character Models however are very well thought out and designed. 6/10
Sound: I'm a sucker for good OPs, and NS has a good amount. Specifically Sha La La. Aswell the voice actors did a magnificent job. They aged everyones voice quite well. This would be a perfect 10 if it did not lack in actual Sound Effects which would be reused to death. 8/10.
Characters: 8/10. They were good. Not quite sure how to say how without spoilers but whatever.
Enjoyment: It is so far a very exciting watch. A very good replacement for Bleach. 9/10

Naruto and consequently Naruto Shippuuden were the first set of anime I ever watched, and overall I am thankful for that. It helped give me a strong baseline for comparing other anime to.
Naruto Shippuuden is a continuation of the story of Naruto, a boy ninja in a world called Earth, split into 5 countries, each representing a different element, fire, water, etc. He has grown up a bit from the first Naruto series, after training with a legendary ninja of his Fire country in the interim, and is still interested in furthering his relationship with his brother-in-arms, Sasuke.
The story-line, outside of the fillers, is interesting
                  if not a bit predictable, the characters are varied and likable, the music is pretty good, and the creativity behind the various ninja skills is awesome. 
The problem with Naruto Shippuuden, as was the case with the first Naruto series, is that it is riddled with too many filler episodes, regaling exploits and side-stories of forgettable characters and events. Very few filler episodes are worth watching in my opinion.
Overall I'd say Shippudden is worth watching, but only if you have a filler list so that you may skip them.

As I just completed the 338 episode I just took my time to examine shippuden from the start. Like most animes shippuden has its ups and downs most fillers done by the studio to drain naruto for all its worth isn't what I call  'enjoyable', but if you take your time to watch it wthout the fillers its preety good. Other than some wierd animations here and there I don't see why shippuden isn't awesome... The characters are well created the background sounds are awesome story is great...  The fillers that I would recommend is the chikara arc... I was excited with the
                  way the war arc started panning out recently. Overall I give shippuden a 8...

Naruto, one of those legends in japanimation. No need to introduce it at this point... So for starters, I'll just say that this review will focus more on the anime aspect than on the story, which comes from the manga.
I personnally really liked the manga, at least until the Pain arc.
STORY
Long story short, it depends on the arc. This should be something obvious today : when making literally HUNDREDS of episodes, you can't hit a perfect score. There are some very good arcs and some much less interesting.
Main strong point : from all those long-shônen anime/manga, Naruto is the most consistent, telling a straight story
                  (from A to Z, without much detour).
Main weakness : the fillers. There are WAY TOO MUCH and some of them have to be watched as they contain bits of the canon story.
ART
This is what matters when making an anime adaptation of a manga. And I'll be blunt : the visuals were way too screwed up for me to enjoy Naruto.
- First, the drawings : they are way too simple. There are too few traits, and the colors are way too "unicolor".
- Then, the animation : this really depends on the episode. Some fights are simply amazing, but some of them are screwed up.
- Finally, there are no light effects (which is why it is all "unicolor").
Basically, the visuals are way too simple and irregular.
SOUND
Takanashi is a genius of music. The OST is great, although if I had to compare with Fairy Tail, I would prefer the latter because of the style. I'm not really fan of the "ninja music style" from Naruto...
As for the openings, there are so many...! Some of them are really good, some are not really memorable. I personnally really like the FLOW and Asian Kung-Fu Generation openings.
Overall it is really satisfying.
CHARACTER
Again, I won't really develop that point. Some of the characters are awesome, but I do feel like they could have done a better job with all those secondary characters. Naruto's friends aren't really interesting most of the time.
ENJOYMENT
Too many fillers, visuals too simple, and an overall resullt way too irregular. Because of those points, I really didn't enjoy the anime of Naruto. I do like some parts of the manga, and I was really expecting a lot from some arcs in the anime version, but wound up disappointed because the animation is sometimes awful.

Naruto Shipuuden is a bit overrated by most, and underrated by few, then there are people like me that'll tell you the truth.  Im going to be harsh in this review... im going to keep it as real as I can. Im TELLING YOU do not believe the 10s this show is getting... you'll love it at first... then realize the show is WAAAY over-stretched and rips of plenty of other shows, and that it isnt the best anime out there... especially for shounen. So watch it! I insist! but dont get your hopes up.
Naruto Shipuuden/Naruto (lets call it naruto) is known by many,
                  loved by many, and hated by many. I watched all of naruto and im currently waiting for these damn kakashi fillers to be done. Thats what stops this anime from being complete..... fillers...  And lets not forget how much ripoff this anime does to EVERYTHING else. but enough with ranting... lets get to the rating...
Story.(6) 
The story is ok, but kind of cliche  when you think about the basics.... Super hidden powers for some unknown reason (DBZ gohan/ssj in the first place) then we have the weird love traingle that pisses me, and i bet many others off...(do I even have to mention a specific anime? its everywhere) baby trauma (DBZ goku being brought to a new planet) etc. etc. Besides that its good. you know... striving to be the best (Pokemon Ash) and finally HE DOES THE SAME ARM BEHIND THE HEAD LIKE GOKU!!! EXACTLY THE SAME!!!! he even does the -_- eyes like brock does from pokemon. 
Art(7) simple but good. not much to say here.
Sound(7) again simple but good...
Character(5) i've already pointed out all the cliche stereotypes I can... poor characters that piss you off and it seems characters just come and go whenever the story needs them... where the hell is everyone unless you need them? "uhhh training?"
Enjoyment(6) I really cant give the show the benefit of the doubt when EVERYONE fanboys over it. I have to keep it as real as possible. Now Im not saying this isnt a good show to watch when your new to anime... but saying its your favorite, giving it a ten, etc.etc. just shows how noobie you are in the vast world of anime.
Overall(6)

Naruto Shippuuden is a very average anime considering it's vast popularity and will make you wonder why it is so popular. Most people who are watching this or is planning to watch this has seen the previous series. I will warn you now with the exception of Naruto chasing after Sasuke and the female characters still being completely useless please forget everything you think you know about Naruto because it is buried one way or another. 
Story 7: It manages to keep you in suspense, but sometimes becomes too dark for fans of the lighter  Naruto.
Art 6: The art
                  is still average. Nothing special.
Sound 5: Beware voice actors and tunes that don't fit with a scene.
Character 7: Some characters changed drastically, most stayed the same. Some characters are cliche.
Enjoyment 7: I'm still watching it so I like it overall.
        The series pick up from Naruto two years later and we see how much our heroes grown changing the mood to a darker more mature tone. Part of the reason people stay tuned to Naruto was because of the light and refreshing tone so for it to be almost completely gone puzzles me. It makes me miss the plot line of the old Naruto. 
          As for fillers, whether you like it or not fillers need to be use in long anime series so the mangaka can have time to write more. Still I guess the complaining of fans worked because there has been less filler use in the series. The problem is because there has been less filler use the pacing of the show has suffered. Some fights scenes are ridiculously long and constant repeat of the same flashback is the new norm.Even the camera shots are repetitive and unnecessary. For example in one episode with a reunion like air  every five seconds you see the face of a character. It gets infuriating at times.
         Naruto has always been average with their art and this time is no exception. Expect the same overall look with the occasional darker backgrounds to draw more suspense. Also the characters look mostly the same with just a change of their outfit. 
           Since this series is darker than the original Naruto so is the music. Even when it is supposed to be a funny moment sometimes the same dark melody will still play. The openings and endings are mostly mediocre, but if you want to check them out then do so! To me the dark tone of music sets the mood, but is overplayed to the point it does not stand out. Background music blends, but also makes the emotion of the scene stand out and Naruto Shippuuden falls to do that. Also it took me a while to get used to the voice actors. I know the characters have changed, but it's only been two years! Naruto's voice in the sub version sounds like a 30 year old man! When I watched Naruto I watched it in dub and I liked how their voices(even if it was annoying) matched the age of the character and was unique. Many characters in this series voice has the monotone base that never changes making the character boring.
     Now the moment most people have been waiting for in this review, the characters. "Do Hinta and Naruto get together?" "Who becomes the 6th hokage?" Well I'm sorry I won't be answering those questions, watch it for yourself. Naruto probably changed more than any other character in Naruto Shippuden. No longer is Naruto the repulsive ninja who acts before he thinks, no longer is he immature. The failure of getting Sasuke back and the training with Jiraya molded the Naruto we knew into a man. He is not even naive anymore. Sure chasing after a friend who doesn't want to be saved is naive in a way, but to me is shows his loyalty more. Sakura may have become a medical ninjia and strong like tsunade, but she is still useless like almost every girl in this series. As for Sasuke, if you still liked him after watching Naruto, well you won't now. Sasuke gets so annoying in this Naruto Shippuden it makes no sense. Sometimes you would wish anyone would kill him. Besides old time favorites you get a new set of characters plus a more detailed background of some minor ones like Kakashi. Still the characters are a little cliched.
          Overall I still enjoyed Naruto. It's funny considering at first I was totally against watching the new series, but life changes you sometimes. I would definitely recommend this to fans of the ninja genre! If this review was helpful I am glad I helped you and if it was not well I hope my next review helps you.

Original Naruto is probably my most beloved anime of all time. I would always go back and watch any arc and still find something that makes me watch 20-30 more episodes without feeling bored. Music is fantastic, animation is very good for the time being and plot for is very complex and yet simple to understand. 
I wish i could say same thing about Shippuuden. 
First 3-4 arcs kept the same pace and value to plot as original story. As i personally find Gaara arc not as great as later one i still can see meaning to be there. It introduced whole new enemy for
                  protagonists and served as jump for series to more mature climate which i was hoping to stay until the end. Orochimaru/Sasuke and Shikamaru arcs only proved that this direction was right and gave us fantastic and memorable moments. I was invested in every single character introduced to the series up till this point in the series and waited for new episode to come out with excitement and hype. 
Until of course infamous Pain arc that started with big impact and ended with probably most awful and mediocre way that became the solution for every single problem in the anime. That is of course Naruto being the messiah that turns every enemy into his friend and make everything meaningless that happens in the past. Akatsuki mystery and threat built for almost half of the Shippuuden was just scrapped and every following arc became predictable despite having lot of turning points and amazing fights. 
The War had some great fights and showcases of characters but who cared at this point, because it was so stretched and had probably most fillers in history of anime ever. And of course we had 3 switches of main antagonist
in like 2 years without ending a single battle. It became unwatchable and even animation started to look awful somewhere on the road. 
As much as i love Naruto franchise overall, i honestly can't give Shippuuden any score higher than 5. It showed potential at the beginning but it was butchered in the end. I find that just sad and i wish that show had more great storytelling and animation.

Who would have thought that probably the biggest anime franchise in existence would be one of the best? I came into Naruto at the recommendation (or rather pleading) of my brother. This was when I was 12 but I soon dropped it because I couldn't deal with all of the pain and heartbreak that our blond protagonist had to go through. Years passed and this show was always at the back of my mind, I knew I would have to watch it again all the way through this time. Completely by chance, I chose to start it very soon after the main story line ended,
                  i.e. the final (really final) battle between Naruto and Sasuke. As I watched the first series, I was a bit disappointed in the lack of epic battles that I had become accustomed to with shows like Bleach and Hunter x Hunter. But then came shippuden, and boy oh boy did that change. Not only did I get my wish of totally insane fights but I also got a much more emotionally mature series. To be sure, the original has a lot of pain, but they really explored it in shippuden. When all is said and all is done, Naruto really stands out as a series that gives hope for humanity and for yourself.
Note that what follows is solely based on the main story arc, I am not considering the story/art/sound/characters/enjoyment of fillers.
Story - 9: Really phenomenal. There are very few points where I feel like the story is forced, the reasons for the characters' actions are sound. Though the last bit with "who was /really/ behind the whole thing" seemed a little convoluted. The story is really driven by the characters, who are also phenomenal.
Art - 9: Naruto Shippuden takes a more modern approach to art than its predecessor did. This is to be expected as the whole series has been going on for about 15 years. The new art style fits the more solemn feel of the series, even though there are points of awkwardness. 
Sound - 9: The new series brings along a new and improved soundtrack. The new songs are great but aren't outstanding.
Characters - 8: They are truly amazing, though many of the women are a bit underdeveloped. It has certainly improved since the first series, but alas, you don't always get what you want. Despite this, the characters really drive the story forward with their lifelike traits.
Enjoyment - 10: It is truly an amazing show with truly amazing characters and storylines. Though there are flaws, they are overshadowed by the enormous amount of positivity this show produces. Really, this show will make you an optimist. 
Overall - 9: Naruto is really an iconic story which deserves recognition, sure, it probably reminds you of when you were a weeb. And yes there are a TON of fillers (but in this day and age, one quick google search can tell you which episodes are fillers, so just avoid them), but Naruto Shippuden (and more broadly the Naruto franchise) is among the best stories of all time.

I feel like the ONLY reason this show received so many lower ratings was cause of it's fillers. I don't really blame that entirely on the show with all the studio management, catching up with manga etc. etc.
I'm gonna rate this show at the core of it's story. And the Core story, is pretty much second to none. If you are willing to watch all the episodes of this series, which I know is alot, then it is damn worth it. The Story is So Grand, So Emotional, attacks the viewers in a deep and moral level, and so hype/exciting that I just can't get
                  enough of this story and I'll be sad the day this show ends for sure. Aside from the filler episodes, I love everything about this anime.

This anime is truly amazing.
first i will start off with the negatives about this anime. there are wayyyyy to many fillers and some parts you really just want to skip because it's slow. I myself stopped watching occasionally but was determined to finish. at first i wanted to watch every single episode but i couldn't do it tbh.
but overall, this anime is one of my favorites. it's such a good mixture and if you watch all of it out you will enjoy it so much. it's a literal emotional rollercoaster. you'll cry and you'll laugh and you'll be so happy and angry and sad all
                  at the same time. in my opinion, the main characters progress so much and it's really worth it to see them go through this whole process to get where they are in the anime rn.
so please watch it. you won't regret it.

My opinion:
story 10/10 It made me cry several times,he was funny whenever he needed to,with a beautiful story
