The beginning of this show starts off great, ill give it a 8 or 9 for the first few hundred episodes. However the show should of ended over a year ago. They had 3-6 episodes left to air as the manga was over and done with. Almost as if they are expecting the show to continue they have been adding fillers, For the most part its 1 drawn out episode then 4-10 filler episodes. The story is great, but the fillers are not, it has became a joke of several of the communities. I do recommend that you watch it, but follow the suggestions of
                  the communities on what episodes to skip. Good story and better artwork then the original, character development was a little bland but expected. Great sequel bad fillers.

I should mention that I binge-watched this show and skipped about 95% of the fillers. I will try to keep this review spoiler free. 
Naruto Shippuden takes place about 2.5 years after the events which transpired in the original Naruto series. Sasuke Uchiha deserted the Hidden Leaf Village and joined up with the sinister Orochimaru to gain more power in his quest to kill his brother and avenge his family. Naruto Uzumaki decided to train with Jiraiya in order to improve his skill so he could get Sasuke back to his side. Meanwhile the threat of the organization called Akatsuki drives ever closer, who are
                  out to capture Naruto.
The story is rarely the strong point of a shonen anime. It often comes down to a villain who is drunk on power and who wants to take control of the world. In that regard Naruto Shippuden is not that much different. At the start it’s simple, but effective. Without spoiling too much I found that the story did get a bit too convoluted at the end, but I imagine it can be difficult to try and wrap it all up. 
I will say however that almost each villain has his own unique reason for why they want to achieve world domination. In some cases, I found myself even sympathizing with the villains. The line between good and bad is blurry and often there are flashbacks which explain why a villain has had a change of heart and why he or she has those different ideologies. There are a lot of interesting and tragic themes such as pain, isolation and destiny. These different motivations bring more depth to the villains. 
This is why I found the characters to be the best part of the show. There is the typical shonen protagonist Naruto Uzumaki. He is a total goofball, yet very dependable at the same time. He works and trains the hardest and he has the ability to connect with other people. He’s a good main character and I found myself cheering for him throughout the whole show. Sasuke Uchiha at the other hand is the complete opposite of Naruto. He is “cool”, very talented, all the girls swoon over him, but he struggles with himself and mainly with his past. Even throughout the original Naruto show I found Sasuke to be a very polarizing character. At points I disliked him and at other points I sort of liked him. This trend continued for me in Naruto Shippuden. 
Then there are a lot of other characters, who all have their own powers and weaknesses. We of course have all the Hidden Leaf Ninjas. We get introduced to ninjas from other villages. Some characters from the past get more fleshed out. Finally, we have the villains. I already made mention of the them up above. Pain and Itachi are some of my favorite characters in any anime ever. So, all in all that leaves us with more than 50 important characters. All of them are unique and you’ll find yourself picking favorites for some of these characters. Some of them focus on long distance, while others are hand to hand combat specialists. If you watched the original Naruto you will know there is a big difference between a Shikamaru or a Rock Lee fight. 
The main problem with having so many characters however is that not every character gets developed or his/her time to shine. In the original Naruto show we saw minor characters having proper 1 on 1 fights during the Chunin Exams and during the Sasuke Recovery arcs. They got multiple episodes and often you saw flashbacks of their pasts. This way you got interested in some of those characters and you had your favorites. Because so many new characters get introduced during Shippuden – and since we do not have THAT many villains – some of these ninjas do not get any fights during the whole of Shippuden. This is a shame since I was invested in some of them and subsequently didn’t get to see if they learned new techniques or improved. Their characters in effect didn’t develop much / at all. 
In addition, there is also a bit too much powering up going on to my liking. The fighting, the techniques and the damage inflicted all get turned up a few scales. Some characters even get buffed/evolve multiple times during one fight, which makes them literally (demi) gods. Other characters meanwhile stay behind. I believe this is called power creep?
Another strong point of this show is the setting, the world of Naruto. How someone can come up with ideas and concepts like ninja villages, ninjutsu, genjutsu, kages, tailed beasts and how all that stuff is connected, is beyond me. It’s genius and it’s all carefully laid out and explained in this show. 
Just like in the original Naruto show, the soundtrack is amazing. There are some tracks which will pump you up for another great fight, and there are tracks which will hit you right in the feels. There are 20 different openings and 40 different endings. I’m sure you will find something you like and dislike. Personally, I liked the opening track called Silhouette by KANA-BOON the most. 
The animation is good. It can be a bit inconsistent and there is an obvious change of pace when high action episodes occur. I like the style of animation which gets used during those high actions episodes. It is more fluid, but I could understand if people didn’t like it. The fights and more specifically the hand to hand combat scenes are often amazing; even mesmerizing. I don’t like it though when the animation in openings already spoil upcoming events or matchups. This happened a couple of times.   
I feel like I also should mention something about the fillers. I binge-watched Naruto Shippuden and I skipped 95% of the fillers. I recommend you to do the same. I watched about 80 fillers of the original Naruto and they were mostly dreadful. 40% of the episodes are fillers so look on some website or in the forums here to find out which episodes are skippable. I recommend watching the Kakashi and Itachi focused fillers. They were enjoyable. 
The downside of binge-watching is that some of the repeated flashbacks are skippable as well. There are so many flashbacks in Naruto. It’s insane how often they for example showed Sasuke’s past with Itachi. I get that it’s really important, but they’ll show you the exact same scene about 5 times. If you watch 1 episode per week these flashbacks might be welcome (although I can imagine these kinds of viewers would rather want new and original content), but if you watch all the episodes in rapid succession then I’d say the repeated flashbacks are filler-esque too, unless you have a terrible memory.
Overall, I would say that I really enjoyed this anime. I binge-watched this at a high pace during a somewhat difficult time in my life. I was always curious to find out what was going to happen next. At some point I was thinking about giving this a 10/10, but I decided with a 9.5/10 because of some nitpicking during the final arc. A day after I watched the final episode I just had a bit of an empty feeling as a huge, fun part of my evening and night disappeared. I am sad it ended, but I really enjoyed the ride. Let’s hope Boruto will prove to be a worthy sequel.

I have to say, I dropped Naruto for a while and was ready to throw in the towel on the series. Then Shippuuden came along.
The first few episodes in this series show growth in Naruto, something I waited desperately for, but he actually partially regresses as time moves on. Also, there was nothing really interesting happening around him. In fact, the two most interesting story arcs in Shippuuden were all about other characters. And what happens to Naruto while we're given an in-depth character development of a character that we've never seen before, that's not important to the overall plot and that we know will
                  be defeated? Naruto jumps on logs. He jumps on logs chasing a guy whose power is to create clay birds. That's several episodes where all Naruto does is jump on logs, in a circle, trying to catch this clay guy. Yeah...
All in all, Naruto Shippuuden is much like Naruto. It has some great moments, but it's just not worth looking through all the crap between them. Shippuuden seems to have fewer filler episodes and more filler content and bad writing.
It's not the worst anime series out there, but to me it's just a big waste of time.

Many of you will maybe be surprised of why i gave Naruto: Shippuden a 10/10, and trust me, i don't understand 100% either...
 To be completely honest, I would never say this was the best anime of all time, my rating is more personally.
Anyways.. 
Story: The story in Naruto is good, and just amazing, no doubt about that. The story never really got boring for me, it kept becoming even better. I would say that it is one of the best stories in anime, and I really recommend watching it if you love good stories.
 Animation: The animation overall isn't bad at all, but
                  when it came to fight scenes it went a little off at times, and the reason for it was simply just for their choice of style in some fights (Which happens a lot in anime, not just Naruto). But most of the fights are amazingly animated, and I'll watch them again. 
Fillers: I know damn well that Naruto has many goddamn fillers, and many of them are below average.. But I really don't want to rate an anime for their fillers, and I don't understand why people trash talk it this much. If you don't like it, then most of them are 100% skippable. Personally I choose to just watch them. And no, I did not enjoy them, but a couple of them were fairly okay.
 Music and sound: The music in the original Naruto is good, but had some that were under decent. In Naruto: Shippuuden all opening are and just the music in the episodes are great. I really liked and enjoyed it all. 
Character: The characters in Naruto is outstanding, i would say it's at least in top 10 animes with the best characters, maybe top 5. All tho the villains and main characters are made greatly, there were some characters that they missed too much potential in, and that really annoys me. The character development is great, but it could have been much better. They really went carefully when choosing people to die, but to be honest, they didn't choose enough. And it could have made it even better. There were too many characters, and so you would have expected a lot of them to die, but apparently not.
Ending: I can't really say the ending was perfect, but i wouldn't say it wasn't good either. It became a little rushed at the end, but i think it worked out okay.
 Sub or Dub?: I watched it in Sub, and i also think Sub is the better choice. I didn't watch dub, but i watched a little of it, and i liked it. They were both made finely. 
Overall: I gave it a 10/10, which is very overrated, i know i know. 
But personally, i can't stop giving it 10. The Anime just hit me differently. 
But if i had to give it a rating outside that, I'll give it a 8/10. Maybe 7,5/10.
Also, the anime was also really carried by the story.
The best elements of the show are the music/sound, characters, story, and personally the plot too, even tho the plot can be basic at times.

I don't remember the exact last episode I watched, but this show is garbage and everyone should steer clear of it. I watched every episode of Naruto when they aired starting the year the show received an English dub. I stopped during the final arc of the show. I had highly enjoyed the show through much of it and I don't think I'd take those moments back. 
However, I cannot recommend this show whatsoever to anyone. The studio who made this show MILKED their FANS for money. The manga had been completed at the time the show decided to start running filler in the middle
                  of their final arc. I have spent 7 years watching this show as a loyal fan and I stopped during the final arc. It's because the filler they started doing in the middle of the final arc lasted for over 2.5 years. I waiting 2 years to let episodes build up so my father and I could watch roughly 120 episodes together and binge it hard. There were only 3 canon episodes released within those 2.5 years and the manga had been finished that whole time, meaning the studio was purposely writing 2.5 years of filler to make money from view counts. It's absolutely disgusting. 
Then to top it all off they made the damn Boruto movie before they even finished the Naruto Shippuuden anime. I am so mad and disappointed. I will never watch another anime from this garbage studio again. Save yourself the trouble and watch a different studio's show. They'll probably care more about their fans and give you an enjoyable show.

It's good, very good.
It's probably the anime that has inspired me the most after Dragon Ball Z. It's become one of the few happy memory of my childhood and teenage years. 
Story: 9 
Up until the 4th Ninja War the story was amazing, I don't hate the last arc but I don't think it's great.
Art: 7
Pierrot (aside from the movies) animates incredible battles from time to time but I wouldn't say it's flawless animation every episode.
Sound: 10Naruto AND Naruto Shippuden have objectively the best anime soundtrack ever made, period. 
...And the seiyuus are very good, as you would expect. 
Characters: 9
Really like most of the main ones. Gaara and Itachi are arguably one of the best Kishimoto's creations and are portrayed wonderfully in the anime.
Enjoyment: 10
Nothing to add. It's good.
Overall: 10
 Despite the horrible fillers this anime is one of my all time favourites.

Good : 
Interesting premise and world, magic system that allows for many enjoyable fights, interesting character designs, characters with relatable motives.
Bad :
-Characters
Naruto :  a)He started as a likeable kid with troubled life that could be overbearing at times but tried his best. He became annoying when he would spout the same things over and over again while never actuall achieving anything , diving head first into the enemy without thinking and getting his ass kicked.
  b)In Shippuden he shed that immaturity and became more bearable.
Unforutnately he still had his dumb moments that completely messed the tone in many instances. His immaturity also clashes with the tone and style of the rest of the series. Characters like Luffy are ok to be "dumb" because the whole world of the manga is kind of silly and ridiculous with over the top scenarios, locales and cahracters. Every character on his crew is a bit of a nut in their own way, and many characters in the rest of the series are too so it doesnt feel out of place. But it does in Naruto.
  c)Also he was still an almost useless fighter. Sasuke had managed half a dozen different Jutstus in the 2 year timeskip, Naruto not only learned nothing but he couldnt even do rasengan without a clone.
Apart from Pain he never had a decent fight with an equal oppoenent to show his skills and competence. After that he just uses the Fox which throws most ninja techniques out the window.
-Sakura :
Most annoying character and impossible to like.
Has an unhealthy obsession over Sasuke, even after all his crimes and attempts to kill her making her look like an unhinged ex-girlfirend with Battered Wife Synrome than an independent strong character.
The antics with Naruto where she gets angry and slaps him were never funny, just cringy and annoying making her look like a bitch.
-Sasuke
He started off interesting if a little emo.
He opened up, he made friends, but had to leave them for his own purposes. Ok so far.
Aftet the 2 year timeskip he goes full-on edgy emo and tries to kill them for no good reason. It made sense to abandon them in favor of training under Orochimaru, not kill them.
He puts on a permament poker face being unable to show any emotion at any time.
Plus after al the shit he did, he was forgiven way too easily.
-Hinata
Annoying too high pitched voice even after she became a teen, too timid even for a timid personality, too obsessed with Naruto, barely any good interaction between them.
-Karin
That was a big missed opportunity. After she as almost killed by Sasuke her dialogue made it sound like she realised the truth and would forget Sasuke coming to her senses. She observed Naruto and how he was so much "brighter" than Sasuke. Given how they were also form th same clan it was a ripe opportunity for interesting character development betweeen them.
Naruto could realise he was not alone, Karin the same. They could become close, bond over their troubled childhoods and support each other in the coming battles.
But her character was wasted and the very next scene with her, she just still craves Sasuke's dick for some reason.
-battles :
That was hit n' miss.
Some fights, especiallu the early ones were interesting with various strategies and techniques being used in creative ways to make dynamic battles.
While however some characters like Sasuke or Shikamaru were given interesting fights, the protagonist himself Naruto most of the time had lame ones. Others like Lee, had onnly brute force but ultilised it in the same way we see Chackie CHan and other artists use it in fulm so it was entertaining.
Naruto offered none of the 2 : neither brain fights nor strength fights
He usually just used brute force instead of his brain, even when the opponents were much stronger and it was obvious it wasnt working.
He never learned any elements to supplement his arsenal, he never improved upon them.
HE learned th wind elements which he used to create his super rasengan and then he totally forgot about it. he didnt create any new technique that was less dangerous than that.
He went from 0-100 with no in-between.
Towards the end, the ninja fitghts are almost gone and we just have gods playign with each other so...whatever.

First review so don't expect it to be super.
Naruto: Shippuden is set two and a half years after Naruto leaves the Leaf Village to train with Jiraiya and the overall story starts off from that after the main villain the Akatsuki were beginning to move out. This show gets a lot of hate mainly because of the ridiculous amount of fillers which is nearly half the show, some are enjoyable and give more depth to a character, others are completely pointless and totally random. But once you get past that the show is nothing short of excellent, amazing fights, beautiful soundtrack and a pretty great
                  story until the final act of the show which gets a little too out of hand. The art is nothing to write home about but it doesn't disappoint except for one episode, when you get there you'll know it. 
This shows main theme is bonds and how Naruto must overall protect his bonds and strengthen them to gain allies and become stronger. The characters are well fleshed out and all given clear motives for each one and excellent backstories are put into place here. The lore is also only enriched here and everything is more developed as all mysteries were explained and answered well and the best is yet to come.
Overall this anime is worth a watch as long as you've completed the first part and can either handle filler or just decide to skip it all together. That's not to say at the end it stumbles, I thoroughly enjoyed this anime as it was my gateway into all the anime I watch now and I still come back for some nostalgia.

Naruto is an amazing anime that everyone should enjoy.
The story is just amazing, they have such a great focus on all the character, you will definitely like every character, and not only the main people. Also they use the "set up pull off" technic very well, there are a lot of surprises along the way aswell whitch will definitely take you off guard. I have been emotianally toutched many times in this anime, which was not something that I thought i would be when I first started watching it.
The music is simply amazing, both the intro and outro songs, but also the random songs that
                  gets played. It is absolutely amazing and really helps the atmosphere.
As far as i know, this is one of the best anime that is out there and it is definitely worth watching
If I should point out some of the bad things (which there are) then it has to be that there are so many episodes that it is starting to look like it will never end. Also there are so many fillers in there, and it can get kind of enoying at times. 
I wil highly recommend Naruto and Naruto Shippuden to anyone

Story:
You can break the story of Naruto Shippuden down into one sentence.
Naruto's best friends Sasuke Uchiha did fall on the "dark side" and Naruto himself is a great bro so he does everything to bring him back without ever givin up.
Sounds pretty boring doesn't it? 
Well while the story progresses the whole thing gets a lot more complicated. Naruto and his friends would have to face several "bad guys", train a lot to be able to beat them and lose a lot of precious people (very emotional! :( ) and the great thing about it is that everything actually connencts.
Talking about the bad guys...they aren't
                  actual bad guys and this is something I liked a lot about Naruto. Usually they are just people who had a really rough live and therefore developed some "bad" but pretty logical philospohy.
For example one enemy believed that it is impossible to understand one another except if everyone understands one another's pain. And to understand pain you must experience pain so he became the bad guy to spread pain over the world. During Naruto's fight against that person they had quite an interesting philosophical conversation- something that the series does a lot. 
The only negative aspect about the sotry is that some of the so called filler episodes (episodes that don't really provide anything to the plot but are pretty important to have a deeper understanding for the character's development aka episodes that you won't find in the Manga) are really bad placed. 
For example during one of the most intence arcs of the show we got Fillers from OG Naruto- without any logical reason!!
My personal opinion is that you should still watch them but you can decide that for yourself (there are filler lists in the internet).
9/10
Art:
On one hand some of the greatest most memorable fights in Anime history and some really weird animations due to outsourcing of the animation studio but overall pretty solid. 8/10
Sound:
Let's be real on this one. Naruto Shippuden's OST is one  of the greatest of all time.
Just listen to these:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D-fXTFQlUhY (Sadness and Sorrow)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ikmSfQmtq20 (Orochimaru's theme)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qpi9YXaChHI (Sign)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dlFA0Zq1k2A (Silhouette)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AxNCOajIvEM&list=PL4C928EAF7AA5B906&index=3 (Homecoming)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qbXVmiFr4-8&list=PL4C928EAF7AA5B906&index=7 (Man of the world)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DWY1_Grk3VA (Akatsuki's theme)
Characters:
Even though there is a ton of characters in this anime you will know every single one after finishing it and that's a fact. 
Why you might ask?
Well simply because all of them are very interesting and most of them have quite a depth due to their past and their actions during the story. 
The characters will stick to you and if you actually think about them you might learn some valuable lessons about life.
Enjoyment:
I loved it and felt a vast emptiness after I finished the series and the movies.
Overall:
For me a 10/10. Simply because I am emotionally very attached to this Anime.

This review contains my biased opinion
Naruto for me is a classic
This is the anime that got me into all the anime's I watch now
Story is good, The fights are pretty cool, character design is alright 
Maybe some of the Arc's are drawn out, but I don't mind
I do wish the quality be slightly higher but maybe that's asking too much
I feel like the amount of episodes can be trimmed down slightly from removing the filler Story 8
Art 9
Sound 9 or 10
Character 8 maybe 10
Fights and regular enjoyment 10 
Overall a 9
Definitely recommend watching Naruto Shippuden if you haven't.

Naruto Shipppuuden has a spectacular story with well built characters. I am not only talking about the main characters, but also secondary characters and especially the villains.
Not to mention that it has the best fighting animations ever seen. Not only the animation at technical level but the own choreography and strategies of the fight according to each individual and its power.
The story has many ramifications and variants, which despite one and another plot hole (which is understandable because of the extended time of its development) every each character evolve and go through a growth and development of character.
Naruto is that character that we can understand
                  and we want to be like him. We see his growth, it is not a character of 2 dimensions, but of 3 or 4. The same happens with many others, and the most fascinating are the villains. Especially those from Akatsuki. For me, Pain is one of the best-built villains I've seen so far in anime and even in movies.
I quoted this anime on my master's thesis countless times, exactly because of its story and character construction, and also because of its animations and fight choreography.
Anyone who loves a good fight (choreographically and visually) will feel immense satisfaction in this anime. Just like anyone who likes a good story with good heroes and good villains, both quite human. They do not make the characters just the flawless hero or the inhuman villain. No. The characters have a reason that moves them, because of their life experiences.
I strongly advise.
My favorite anime, no doubt.

So, Shippuden which translates to hurricane legends or a wild tornado and some shit, and that is what this part of naruto is, a wild cyclone that makes Naruto's peaceful life of training with Jiraiya into a wild war after he came back to his hometown. 
In very short he comes back after his training with Jiraiya. He is welcomed by his friends and his wounds reopen after remembering how Sasuke has left the village and done what he has. We learn everything about Naruto's past, we learn all about Naruto's and everybody's past, we get to know the real people behind the crimes and
                  wrongdoings, in general, the plot advances, and well does Naruto become the damn hokage? watch to find out.
The story is that of a shounen's simple enough for a baby to understand but very fun and perhaps carries some emotions at times. 8/10 because the war arc really just took so many episodes and it was quite bad, I would give it a 7 as an arc and a 5 in comparison with other arcs, it was more concerned about action and commercial stuff instead of the story, basically characters fighting for 130 episodes and some drama, rest if very good.
The art style is just legendary and the quality quite good, it has not been too much time since Naruto Shippuden ended but the quality was on par with its times even when it started. 8/10
Sound is an 8, It had more good songs than the original Naruto but it just had so many songs that it was impossible for most not to be very bad. It had quite some good openings and some good endings but it also had many bad ones that balance it out. For example blood circulator, silhouette, blue bird, Diver, Sign, Distance, Lovers, Totsugeki Rock, Moshimo are just some of them, there are 2 times as many endings and out of all of them one I listen to commonly is ending 27 because it is a banger. Overall very good openings and some endings slap, some others are just quite average. 8.
The characters are a 9, legendary but if we take any nostalgia or motives away they are very bland and only some get much care. 
Overall Naruto Shippuden was the climax of the Naruto series it had so many good things but it also had some flaws, more than the original naruto. It was not too boring but it had some not that exciting parts as well. Overall good but also a bit bad, it just was incosistent, expected of a 500 episode anime but although it was overall great, it had some inconsistencies I can't exactly forgive that much, I think this is an 8.5 (9).

pls read to the end and everyone is intitled to their own opn but this just need to be said. There are two parts . one about the fans another on the show pls enjoy

"Naruto" gets soo much hype for no reason. I am going explain the good
                  and bad things about the show. The good are first, Naruto has amazing fights and also have one of my top 5 favorite villains (Pain).But the cons out weight the pros," Naruto" as a series has a hard time following all of the characters, and its a good thing to have a lot of side characters because you my relate to one but towards the middle and end of the show most are thrown to the side so Naruto and Sasuke. Review 20: Naruto Shippuden (Our favourite hero grew up?)???
Well, well, well he's returned to our screens once again. But did he mature??? 
No 
Is he smarter??? 
No Did his brightly coloured strange outfit change at all??? 
NO
Another fun loving Anime program following on from the original Naruto series. We see our favourite hero returning after 2 years training with his sensei.
He's still loud and annoying, but for once everyones happy to see the demon child that is Naruto. Unfortunetly for his long time freinds he still poses that pervy, hot naked chick move which still freaks me out on a mild level.
Well Sakuras still the same to!!! Apart from the fact she's turned into a mini Tsunade, once again creepy on a mild level. Turns out in the years Naruto was training he became a great healer just like Tsunade.We see in the early episodes of Naruto Shippuden that even Tsunade's training may not be enough for some forms of healing. Her appearence has changed ever so slightly,the clothes follow the same colour scheme and fashion from the previous episodes, but I thought she would start growing her hair again for Sasuke, but it seems the shorter look has stayed and will be there to stay for a while.
Apart from this she's literally the same person, a few slight alterations inher wardrobe have not altered the fact that whenever Naruto goes off of task... She's there to hit him. (Obviously)...
With enhanced graphics and a slightly older audience to watch this series of Naruto it seems perfectly normal to me to jump straight in like they have. You know, introducing new characters and meeting up with past members of the Naruto series.
I have to say, I did start to watch the original Naruto series but became bored as i'd already read it. So I thought to fit back into the crowd I would start watching the series again. Good decsion for once.
I do think this series is better than the original. I think the only reason I think its better is because, well they've grown up, so its as if people my age can relate to the characters that we love. It may seem weird but it is true. 
I know younger kids at my school who prefer the first series to Naruto Shippuden as they can relate to him and the situations he's in.
I don't think Naruto's personality has matured or grown up with him. I think its the appearence and the voice that make him seem older. I actually like this element of Naruto as I prefer his characters to be this way, the series wouldn't be the same if he was smart and sophisticated 24/7. I'm glad with te decsion to keep him as a wacky nut job instead of a stuck up tight wod.
I prefer the aged Naruto to the younger one who always wanged to become hokage. Therefore I prefer Naruto Shippuden to the original Naruto series. (Sorry to offend anyone)...
Sunday 10th Febuary 2013. 8:39 pm. ~AmyXxx

Oh, Naruto. An anime that you never thought would never end.
I've seen shonen anime like this where it's essentially a story about someone wanting to be something in their future, as well as something more compared to others who have tried.
Part 1 dealt with the whole idea of strategy vs talent. It made you feel inspired to go out into the world and essentially be who you want to be and not be limited by anything out there. The concept of it's possible no matter what anyone else says.
Shippuden aka Part 2 is different and in that, it's focus was more on the world of
                  Naruto rather than the actual character. Sure, Naruto Shippuden has interesting characters but the focus was obviously more on how they were (their backstories) rather than their present life. Sure, events transpire and they're still awesome to look at.. but when you look at it, it's like Naruto Shippuden became more interested in adding characters rather than actually developing them.  Sure, they did but it felt very slow. It's not something bad just something. Quantity over Quality even though Shippuden does have its moments. In fact, this whole idea of Shippuden being very different and somewhat lost what made it special reminds me of the shift from the first 3 Fast and Furious movies all the way to the "now" which are completely action with less racing.
The only outward thing I can say about Naruto Shippuden is that it's a lesson on how a writer can have problems when something they've created has become so huge that it's completely messy. Don't get me wrong, I like the characters as well as the overall story. But the way it was told was a little slow. Not only that, but this particular show is littered and cursed by filler. 
It's technically a meme that Naruto Shippuden is known mostly by its messy filler in between the stories that make it good and to be honest, that's what sad about it. Naruto has always been a story where you can pretty much feel emotion running through you especially since the writer/author is good at conveying emotion through his fights. However, because of Shonen Jump's harsh schedule, it ruined his draftsmanship and overall, ruined the anime. 
Nevertheless, Shippuden is undoubtedly a phenomenon. With iconic villains and characters as well as notable abilities and moments with amazing conclusions in its stories. This had a great finale to something so huge that it can be comparable to Harry Potter's Deathly Hallows and the MCU's Endgame. 
Every segment in Naruto is an event; An idea that Boruto or any anime might never, or might not be able to replicate ever again. It's an anime that meant to a lot of people and it will never be forgotten. However, like life itself; it had to end. And while it ends, you can feel the emotion through each final episode. And it shows that the writer, while he had his flaws, is truly a talented and amazing writer. Thank you, Masashi Kishimoto.

Look, I get saying the filler brings it down if you watched the show as it aired; however, I am blessed with watching it after the airing has completed. I skip all segments of filler and only watch ones that a well-liked. I think if the show is watched as I am watching it now, it is the single best anime ever created. It has fantastically deep and dimensional characters, the fights (while I see why others think differently) look gorgeous, and lastly, it truly puts the time into forming the plot and doesn't feel rushed. Lastly, I feel its incorrect top judge Naruto and
                  Shippuuden separately, if watched in a single stretch the events of Shippuuden feel perfectly written and well played out.

This has been a Journey. For everyone who complains about fillers what I suggest is that you watch them and then complain about the series having a lot of fillers because I too complained about fillers at first but most of them were funny af. Still had to say that amount of filler episodes and flashbacks were a lot. Though what I say is give it a try. His journey from a Baka to a less of a baka needs to be experienced XD .The one thing people say like The female characters of this show have been nerfed but I don't think so yeah
                  if a character is weak it is weak it has nothing to do with gender a lot of female characters have been empowered but I do agree but all of them were not used perfectly .I'm sure you'll like Naruto-kun's journey and feel like proud parents whenever he does something great or even cry sometimes. This was hell of a ride. "The tale of Naruto Uzumaki" has been wonderful in my opinion.

After an endless wasteland of anticlimactic resolutions, I would like to express the disgust I have towards this work. ''Naruto'' prequel laid the foundations for this story, which although they stood out in some sections, in others they seemed really questionable, and Naruto Shippuden resolved my doubts.
I will expand on 3 points.
1: How does the Ninja World rank system work?
They come out of the academy and are Genin, fine ("fine", since ordinary people hire them to do necessary jobs like mowing the lawn and doing chores), then they have an exam to be chunnin, fine ("fine", since really at no time are the genin given
                  time to learn shit and learning is left to the Jonin in charge, which proves to be inefficient because "muh one of them is my favorite and I'm going to train him, what fuck the rest").
After the chunin exam comes the jonnin exam... I guess, we're not shown how it diminishes since you're a chunin. And what the hell is up with the Hokage? It is already canon at this point that Naruto skips two ranks and becomes the president. Why? For being the messiah?
If you think about it further, the organization itself doesn't make any sense:
1- You are in the academy, you learn the basics
2- You graduate and you are a genin, you do not study and it is intuited that your education from here on is self-taught.
3- You want to be chunin, so you take the exam, and it is intuited that you must know at least some espionage technique or something similar, apart from several Jutsus and a decent fighting technique (are there even libraries where they can study more techniques?)
4- Magically you are Jonin, it is assumed that you are practically one step below the president, you are the standard military force of your village and yet they put you in charge of rookies so that these are your team in missions that due to your rank do not correspond to you (I suppose they will have missions on their own, but it is made clear that the team that was under his command will be with the jonin for a long time until they are promoted to jonin or become academy professors, then what the hell was Kakashi doing with Minato, Obito and Rin if he was already a Jonin at that age?)
5- You are an AMBU, a member of the village's tactical operations squad, basically Team 6 of the Konoha SEALS, or cannon fodder according to the anime. What the hell did the AMBU do if not die every time they appeared? They are a literal joke.
6- Finally you get to be Hokage, apparently here you only need the approval of the elders of the village to be. You don't have ministers or subordinates, it's just you taking care of all the paperwork and paperwork.
From smallest to largest:
- Why doesn't the Hokage have official subordinates to take care of the paperwork?
- Why leave the heart and the operating system of the village in charge of a single person?
- Why should he be the most powerful and capable man in the village, since in times of crisis he is the one he should protect?
- Why isn't the village in chaos? Clans are supposed to exist and they can wish well for their people, the head of each clan should be sucking the elders' vagina and the malnourished nepe to ensure a position as Hokage and safeguard his clan from power. Internal wars cannot be happening because of that stupid government model.
2. The characters; There are so many characters that were introduced, with so many, I mean TOO MANY, that it is impossible to focus on all of them or focus entirely on one among so many subplots and a contrast is created with the lost potential, by contrast the "Characters" that are it gives them a main focus they have their own reasons for doing what they do and who they are as a whole and that's what makes each character distinctive in their own way minus that some have really anticlimactic resolutions that hurt the writing of these, this mainly in the last arc "Fourth great ninja war" this last arc felt bland and insipid, constant changes of morale between different characters that felt forced, constant nerfs to characters that were initially excellent. Add to that, innumerable plot holes, the story is full of script holes, things that are left in the air never to be mentioned again, important fights resolved by deus ex machinas.
I can represent all this as a shooting star, the work started out great, but that brightness vanished in the blink of an eye
3. Technical section. This is usually precarious and inconsistent, with all this I mean the little use of visual narrative as a resource for exposing ideas, apart from all this, the technical values ​​never seemed remarkable to me, you usually have a fluid animation and an inconsistent drawing for later become inconsistent in these two sections, and that in those static shots, I could never understand what was meant by all this.
(I'm just a casual with a critical eye, I don't take my opinions to the extreme like others would. I don't pick on animation or subtle issues with technical values, I give more value and merit to the script, I look at the bigger picture. So, being that said, please note that this factor will show up in my review).
Critic's Rating: 5. It's a regular series with big spikes in quality mixed to mediocrity, I'm not a reductionist and appreciated the intention of the series to pretend to give us something ''Good''.
Después de un interminable páramo de resoluciones anticlimáticas, me gustaría expresar el disgusto que tengo hacia este trabajo. La precuela de 'Naruto' sentó las bases de esta historia, que si bien destacaba en algunos tramos, en otros parecía realmente cuestionable, y Naruto Shippuden resolvió mis dudas.
Me extenderé en 3 puntos.
¿Cómo funciona el sistema de rangos del mundo Ninja?
Salen de la academia y son Genin, bien ("bien", ya que la gente común los contrata para hacer trabajos innecesarias como cortar el pasto y hacer quehaceres), luego tienen un examen para ser chunnin, bien ("bien", ya que realmente en ningún momento se les da tiempo de aprender una mierda a los genin y el aprendizaje se lo dejan al Jonin a cargo, el cual se demuestra ser ineficiente porque "muh uno de ellos es mi favorito y lo voy a entrenar a él, que se joda el resto").
Luego del examen Chunin viene el examen Jonnin... Supongo, no se nos muestra como se asciende desde que eres chunin. ¿Y qué carajos pasa con el Hokage? Ya es canon para este punto que Naruto se salta dos rangos y se vuelve el presidente ¿Por qué? ¿Por ser el mesías?
Si lo piensas más a fondo la organización en sí no tiene sentido alguno:
1- Estas en la academia, aprendes lo básico
2- Te gradúas y eres genin, no estudias y se intuye que tu educación a partir de aquí es autodidacta.
3- Quieres ser chunin, así que tomas el examen, y se intuye que debes saber como mínimo alguna técnica de espionaje o algo similar, aparte de varios Jutsus y una técnica decente de pelea (¿hay bibliotecas siquiera donde puedan estudiar mas técnicas?)
4- Mágicamente eres Jonin, se supone que prácticamente estás un peldaño por debajo del presidente, eres la fuerza militar estandar de tu aldea y sin embargo te ponen a cargo de novatos para que estos sean tu equipo en misiones que por tu rango no te corresponden (supongo que tendrán misiones por su cuenta, pero se deja en claro que el equipo que estuvo a su mando estarán con el jonin un largo tiempo hasta que asciendan a jonin o se vuelvan profesores de academia, ¿entonces que carajos hacía Kakashi con Minato, Obito y Rin si él ya era un Jonin a esa edad?)
5- Eres un AMBU, miembro del escuadrón de operaciones tácticas de la aldea, básicamente el equipo 6 de los SEALS de Konoha, o carne de cañon según el anime. ¿Qué carajos hicieron los AMBU si no morir cada vez que aparecían? Son un literal chiste.
6- Por último llegas a ser Hokage, aparentemente aquí solo necesitas la aprobación de los ancianitos de la aldea para serlo. No tienes ministros o subordinados, eres solo tú encargándote de todas las gestiones y el papeleo.
De menor a mayor:
- ¿Por qué el Hokage no tiene subordinados oficiales para encargarse del papeleo?
- ¿Por qué dejan el corazón y el sistema operativo de la aldea a cargo de una sola persona?
- ¿Por qué debe ser el hombre mas poderoso y capaz de la aldea, siendo que en momentos de crisis es a él a quien deben proteger?
- ¿Por qué la aldea no es un caos? Se supone que existen los clanes y estos deberían desear el bien para su gente, el jefe de cada clan debería estar chupandole la vagina y el nepe desnutrido a los anciantos para asegurarse un puesto como Hokage y salvaguardar desde el poder a su clan. Guerras internas deberían estar ocurriendo por ese modelo de gobierno tan estúpido.
2. Los personajes; Son tantos los personajes que se introdujeron, con tantos, digo DEMASIADOS, que es imposible centrarse en todos o centrarse por completo en una entre tantas subtramas y se crea un contraste con el potencial perdido, por el contrario el Los "personajes" que son les da un enfoque principal, tienen sus propias razones para hacer lo que hacen y quiénes son en su conjunto y eso es lo que hace que cada personaje sea distintivo a su manera, excepto que algunos tienen resoluciones realmente anticlimáticas que dañan la escritura. de estos, esto principalmente en el último arco "Cuarta gran guerra ninja" este último arco se sintió soso e insípido, constantes cambios de moral entre diferentes personajes que se sentían forzados, constantes nerfeos a personajes que inicialmente eran excelentes. A eso se le suman innumerables agujeros en la trama, la historia está llena de agujeros en el guión, cosas que quedan en el aire para no volver a mencionarlas, peleas importantes resueltas por deus ex machinas.
Puedo representar todo esto como una estrella fugaz, el trabajo empezó muy bien, pero ese brillo se desvaneció en un abrir y cerrar de ojos.
3. Apartado técnico. Esta suele ser precaria e inconsistente, con todo esto me refería al poco uso de la narrativa visual como recurso para exponer ideas, aparte de todo esto, los valores técnicos nunca me parecieron sobresalientes, suele tener una animación fluida y un dibujo inconsistente para luego volverse inconsistente en estas dos secciones, y que ahí de esos planos estáticos?, nunca pude entender lo que se quería interpretar con esto.
(Solo soy un casual con una visión crítica, no llevo mis opiniones al extremo como lo harían los demás. No me meto con la animación o cuestiones sutiles con valores técnicos, le doy más valor y mérito al guión, Miro el panorama general. Entonces, dicho esto, tenga en cuenta que este factor se muestra en mi revisión).
Calificación de la crítica: 5. Es una serie regular con grandes picos mezclados con mediocridad, no soy reduccionista y aprecio la intención de la serie de pretender entregar algo ''Bueno''.

If the whole anime was like Pain's arc, it would score 9, but the first arcs are pretty boring to watch and Ninja War is easily one of the worst anime arcs around, and the anime simply abandoned all the good characters from the Classic to focus on the beast drama between Naruto and Sasuke, besides having introduced several interesting characters throughout the plot but that didn't do any good in the end, and even characters that were initially well written like Obito, were spoiled in the end with the classic Discourse no Jutsu. One thing that also bothers me is the fact that they
                  haven't explored almost anything in Naruto's universe apart from Konoha, and even in Konoha some things were left out like that political arc right after Itachi's death.

NB: Recommended to watch Naruto before Shippuden. Because this is a continuation if did not know :)
Naruto has been out for years for as long as I know but I never intended to watch it. Everywhere I go and talk with people about anime they will know about Naruto, both those who watches anime and those who dont. My thoughts were quite ignorant and I judged it for being overrated and being popular because its a long watching series, thats all. Until last summer where I binge-watched this B*cth within 2-3weeks. And I can swear to you, it was a beautiful journey where I felt
                  so sad that it ended. I regret somehow, and even wish I tried it earlier. No sugarcoating! Dont let the earlier episodes animation lure you to drop out because the quality is a little low, if you compare it to those high quality anime series NOW.  Ok enough rambling about how good it makes me feel :) 
The good:
Story 10:
The more you watch it the better and better it will be. No point in this series where the excitment, storyline, and pace drops down. Even at the begnning was already very good. I cant believe the author made this story where all the stuff connected to each other and gave meaning without being forced. I myself believe there is no plotholes, only amazing writing and how the characters interwines with the story so much.
Character 9:
Sooo many amazing character with deep and amazing background. You will get the feels and sadness for them, even though you have not seen much of them.  Cool, cute, amazing made characters in this series, where you will enjoy the good and bad characters. The reason for why I gave it a 9 instead of 10 is because when most of them are that amazing, those with a little less character or personality, with background will fall down the list very low. You might even dislike som of them cause they feel so useless compare to the others character you know or like.
Sound 10:
The voice acting here is top notch, all of them are suitable for their character. And I love the way whenever they call out for their jutsu. The music in here is legendary for me. From epic, emotional, sadness and sorrow to happiness or the feeling of nostaliga. Beautiful made and brings out the act of the very scene very well. You are gonna be a fan of the music even when you have not watch naruto yet. 
Art 9:
When I give the art 9/10 I am being a little bias here, cause sometimes you can notice the quality is not always top notch or even that good. Sometimes its amazing animation and quality. Other times you can notice the difference of this epiosde and that ep, thats the problem, when Im nitpicking. And the earlier episodes have not that great art if you compare it to the later episodes. Of couse it should be understandable since its older, so its a good thing that there is improvement.    
The bad:
Nothing is perfect and I tell even my most favorite anime is not. Naruto has it flaws and that is the the bad thing. Lets call out for those jutsus 
1. Filler jutsu, as fans calls it. Naruto its quite well known for being the king of it.  And the amount of it is massive, thats a whopping 44% filler, if I have not recalled it wrong. Some of it was nice to have, but sometimes its downright cruel  when you are in the middle of something big and they take you on for a 30 eps journey of filler. Good thiing its finished so you can just skip over those, I recommend to watch some of it though, if you are a hardcore fan.
2. Flashback jutsu. The use of flashback in here sometimes brings out tears of sadness and feels that hits you right in the face. But on other occasions when they show you the flashback of something so many times, it will lose it purpose. I think that was the shame of it on smaller occasions. Other times when flashback is used because the producers are perhaps scared that the viewers have forgotten scenes that they have watched for some episodes back or the ones you JUST WATCHED. And they show you the characters remembering the memories, the bad thing in this is that it has happened before where the character uses A WHOLE EP for that purpose. Thats enough complaining.
Overall 10:
 I mean overall this was a wonderful anime, and I want to share this happiness and joy to as many as I could. I recommend this to be watched in your lfetime, and its strongly recommended by a very picky person.  Pardon me if there are some grammar mistakes :) Do take me serious though :D

Resting after surgery to prevent amputation of the left foot was an experience of agony and suffering.
 Away from work, friends, and the desire to continue to exist due to melancholic crises engulfing my states of mind, body and mind, I found in Naruto the peace therapy I needed. Watching 40 episodes a day, it was the drug that anesthetized my pain and entertained my loneliness.
Sometimes I felt like Rock Lee, a boy who due to a genetic disease is unable to be a normal ninja, but even so through absolute effort and dedication to training, he keeps his dream active through a will to
                  win. Or like Neji, who as a member of the warrior part of the Hyuuga clan is destined to serve the noblest part. Becoming someone indifferent to fate, until a punch to the chin changes his perspective.
Much empathy for the villains, who are often just children abandoned by their parents and adopted by their nations, as instruments of war due to their exceptional abilities.
 Kishimoto - author of the work - through his characters assumes the positions of father, grandfather, brother and or teacher. Naruto is a great deep motivational speech about how hard life is, and people need to have the strength to overcome it, which I needed at that time.
In Naruto and Naruto Shippuden, the ninja world is a constant war between humans and their traumatic lives. Orchestrated by battles of jutsu, kunais, shurikens, swordsmen, clashes of giant animals, colossal demons inhabiting the bodies of young people and a lot of flashback, while the soundtrack makes a point of tearing every tear from your eyelid or stretching every inch of your lip through smiles in moments of happiness.
The exaggeration in praising the relationship between Naruto and Sasuke with constant reruns and memories, good characters becoming extras, the inconstant animation and the exaggerated fillers weaken the brightness of their journey.
But it would be impossible, not to be grateful for the story and appreciate its great deeds and characters that welcomed me when I needed it most.
Thanks to my experience with Naruto in 2017, the 2020 quarantine is a simple Tentei compared to the great Maito Guy.
SINCE I WATCHED THE SHOW AS A ONE, ITS THE SAME REVIEW FOR BOTH ANIMES.

As someone who watched the original Naruto anime growing up, I found myself enjoying Naruto shippuuden a lot.  I recently got back into anime, and decided to finish one that I never got around to from my middle school years.  As I watched the show, I slowly went from an overcritical skeptic, to a cautious optimist, to a Naruto fanboy.  Like so many characters of the show, Naruto had won me to his side, for a variety of reasons.  
The strongest part of the show has to be its music, in my opinion.  It had many great openings, ending, and
                  a fantastic soundtrack.  Some of my favorites would be OP 3 - blue bird, OP 16 - silhouette, and Hyouhaku just to name a few.  The OST would almost always perfectly complement what was happening on screen and add to the emotional impact in a meaningful way.  My only gripe with the  OST is that with 500 episodes, it gets tiring hearing the same thing over and over, even if the songs are excellent.  
Naruto shippuuden's art is very interesting.  For the most part, each episode has the same aesthetic, but, every once in while, the viewer sees an incredible, bad ass, brutal fight.  Shippuuden has many great fight scenes, that shine on a technical level. 
The story is fairly straightforward, Naruto is on a quest to save his friend Sasuke, but life throws a few curveballs at both Naruto and Sasuke.  Without giving too much away, the story is better than most, but shippuuden has a bad habit of lagging.  What I mean by that is that, it takes time for the plot to progress.  I should also mention the filler.  The amount of filler in shippuuden is very high, but seeing as the show is now over, I highly recommend to the reader, that they skip the filler.  In the beginning we could expect the filler only in between major arcs, but towards the end, the anime gets a bit heavy on filler, and it ends up obstructing the action and displacing all tension from earlier.  You are only doing yourself a favor if you skip the filler.  
The characters of Naruto shippuuden were a big part of why I enjoyed the anime as much as I did.  I was already attached to the cast from Naruto, but shippuuden did good job of furthering development of some of my favorites characters.  Not just Naruto, but seeing Shikamaru, Jiraiya, the nine tails, Sasuke, and Itachi grow was something I really enjoyed seeing.  Unfortunately, shippuuden also neglected some original characters as well, such as Sakura, Lee, Ten Ten, Neji, Kiba, and Asuma.  Nevertheless, I always found myself invested in someone on screen.  But, the FINAL villain, was really stupid, I did not care for that person, but the fight was enjoyable to watch at least.  
I mentioned earlier that Shippuuden won me over, and that is very accurate.  I laughed, I cried, I cheered for my boys as they fought the good fight, I was floored by the badassery that occurred on screen, and there were times when I cursed out villains and their schemes.  I think that Naruto and Naruto shippuuden are shows worth watching, and that despite their flaws, continued to be a great source of enjoyment for me.

This is my first time writing a review but i will try my best.
Well so first what i wanna say that since everyone tastes are different so some people might not agree with me. But its okay. Naruto is a good anime. Many people hates it and many people loves some people think that this anime is average. But i actually like it. I talk about two things here that's the negatives and the positives and at the end of the review a final verdict for it. First a quick summary. I will try my best not to give any spoilers.
[size=90]summary[/size] :- The main character
                  is Naruto Uzumaki. And the story is simple he wants to be the leader of his village means hokage because he wants the villagers to recognise him. Everyone in his village thinks he is a monster and see him as nothing but a brat.
Story:- Well Naruto is an overall good anime. For me its one of my top anime i ever watched. It was my first anime too. I already wrote the quick summary of it so you now have a bit of knowledge for it. The best thing i found about Naruto was the enjoyment. The enjoyment it gave me no other anime entertained me that much. It has its own positives and negatives i can't deny that. I found the story of it quite simple but it was enjoyable. I wouldn't say that it has the best storytelling but its still good many other anime does this better. Some people complain about the flashbacks well True but i think flashbacks are necessary here. The story is connected with their flashbacks there are character who has their own tragic backstory and if you want to understand them you have to watch the flashbacks it goes for villains too and why the villains became villain you need to know their backstory and than you will understand the story that's how the story was created theres a villain (antagonist) behind a villain. And that villain is the one who made the other villain a villain well it cofuse right but that's what it is you will know that when you watch the anime. I found almost every flashbacks good my favourite are [spoiler]Itachi's and sasuke's [/spoiler] story. Other flashbacks were also good but i felt a bit bored in [spoiler] obito's[/spoiler] backstory but it was still good because he was one of the villains. You might say what connection does the main story have  with flashbacks like i said before if you want to understand the maim Story you need to watch the backstory. Every backstory connects with the main story the same goes for the main character he has a backstory too.
Character:- Well characters are not great but still they are good there is a lot of characters but all of them doesn't get enough screen time and one of the main secondary characters is pretty useless and was almost the whole series but became a bit useful at the end of the story the same goes for others all of them has decent character development. But i didn't focus on the secondary characters that much because i didn't think that was necessary if i know the main story and female characters many people says the female character were annoying maybe some of them but i didn't find them annoying or entertaining they just weren't boring. But when it comes to the main characters they were great and entertaining 
Sounds:- Sounds were decent except for some OST's and OP, ED some of them are my all time favourites.
Animation:- The animation was good. I won't say that it was great and top tier. Because Naruto never fucused on animation it was action anime so the fight were absolutely one of the best in all of anime.
Positive:- The positives are its fighting. And the overall enjoyment. Its doesn't have the best animation or the best sounds well hear me out first its sounds aren't the best but they great. But it did good at what it should its fighting the fightings are easily top tier nobody can deny. The characters are overall good and i think you will enjoy almost every main secondary characters except one because she was useless almost the entire story. But others are great and their personality too. 
Negatives:- Well it has a decent amount of negatives too. Its fillers and its flashbacks also the amount of time the other characters get. It has good amount of fillers but if you don't wanna watch it than just skip them if you are like me who only cares about the main story than you can skip it. Now the flashbacks well yeah as i said before you won't quite understand the main story if you skip the flashbacks more importantly the antagonists. Almost every antagonists have their flashbacks and the flashbacks shows why the turned villain. And the flashbacks are connected to the main story. If you skip the flashbacks than at the end of the story you might think why did this villain did this and you might won't understand some of parts of the main story. It has some plot holes too but if i talk about it than i have to give spoilers so that's entirely a different thing. And for the characters just don't care about them.
Final Verdict:- After reading all of this you might say that why did i rated it as 10/10. Well true. But that's because enjoyment. I never watched any anime that gave me as much enjoyment as Naruto. I watched Hunter x Hunter and Fullmetal alchemist brotherhood. Hunter x Hunter has better power system than Naruto and a better storytelling too. Fullmetal alchemist brotherhood has a better storytelling than naruto. But all of them are nothing compared to Naruto when i think of enjoyments. Maybe im being biased here. Since Naruto was the first anime ever watched so its nostalgic. But im a person who cares about personal enjoyment over anything else. Because of the enjoyment i never noticed all of the other negatives and mistakes. Some people also compare about the fact that sometimes Naruto talks with antagonists, tell them that what they are doing is bad the shouldn't do it and nicknamed this as talk no jutsu. I didn't care about this actually because i don't care about such if it was entertaining 😅. If you are someone like me who only cares about the main story then skip the fillers. Some people might not have same opinions and tastes as mine but that's okay. That was all i had to say. Hope you enjoyed stay frosty.
For alternative recommendation:- Watch bleach, Hunter x Hunter.
So that was all i had to say guys. It might be a bit big. But i had to make it big to tell you the reason's why i like this show. It was my first review so i hope you enjoyed this. If you read the full thing than thank you very much.
(Sry for my bad English.😋)

This anime is very emotional and can get both women & men to shed tears routinely.  It has some of the best music of any anime.  The fighting is masterful involving different types including physical - taijutsu, mental - genjutsu and supernatural - ninjutsu all beautifully choreographed.  It has some of the best fights ever in anime like the mystery coffin man vs the Shinobi Alliance.  But the best part is this anime has some of the best plot twists in anime history.  At times you will feel like this anime lied to you for the longest time but you
                  will eventually love it when the truth is revealed.
Everything about this anime is top notch from the story telling to the music to character development of both minor and major characters.  Just be sure to look up which episodes are fillers and skip them altogether to best experience this anime.

The story of Naruto Shippuden continues where part 1 ended, the main plot of the series consists of Naruto trying to bring his friend Sasuke back to the village and aspiring to become the next Hokage. While the story may seem basic you truly feel attached to the characters and the story and want to know how the story will conclude, this could be due to how many episodes the show has. The show has some very high points for art and it has some pretty low points but when the show wants to it can look phenomenal. Honestly, I believe this show has one
                  of the best soundtracks to any anime, all the songs can either make you feel insanely hyped up for a fight or even make you severely depressed (i.e. Sadness and Sorrow). I might be biased for enjoying the characters as much as I did, simply because I started watching Naruto when I was 7 years old and seeing him grow up at the same rate that I did really create a sense of relatability and overall made me more invested in his journey to become Hokage. It is clear by the end of the show that most characters are pushed to the back and Naruto and Sasuke really take center stage, but even so, every character still felt real to some degree. Personally, Naruto is one of my favorite animes despite its flaws and I would highly recommend watching the show!

This Review Contains Spoilers, read at your own discretion:
Ah, Naruto Shippuuden, what could have been a great sequel to the amazing show that was the original Naruto. Now don't get me wrong, Shippuuden was fantastic up until Post-Pain. The writing was fantastic, several plot points had been tied up and closed, and the Akatsuki were essentially reduced to nothingness. But in that lies the problem. After the Pain arc, not eliminating the Akatsuki by leaving Obito alive dragged the story for the next 260 episodes, with a near infinite amount of filler in between.  And when we finally get to the meat of its
                  climax during the War Arc, Madara is suddenly trashed as a character, betraying Obito, ruining a Madara vs Hashirama matchup, to symbolize the passing of the torch to Naruto, who should have fought Obito alone, as Obito is essentially Naruto if he failed at his life. To make matters even worse for Shippuudens writing and enjoyment, the notion of a character we had no foreshadowing of in Kaguya emerges. Kaguya or the Otsutsuki clan were not described until the SOSP had bestowed Naruto and Sasuke his power, detracting from the severity of the situation. And the wrapping on top, Neji. Oh, Neji. Why did you have to die? There was no reason for it in the story. The only reason one could think of is to kill a character the audience was attached to in order to bring interest back into the arc, when in fact it did quite the opposite. Ultimately, Naruto Shippuuden is like a cake. One that was prepared well in its prequel of Naruto, only to be left at too high of a temperature for too long in the oven. A total wreck.

So, this was the amazing Naruto: Shippuden huh? What a ride...I watched Naruto when I was little and I finally had the opportunity to watch Shippuden. The first Naruto was amazing, the Zabuza arc, Chunnin exams arc, Orochimaru invasion arc and Tsunade’s search arc where totally amazing. Those were awesome and well constructed arcs showing very good character development, story and epic moments. But, was Shippuden’s arcs the same? 
——————-
Story: 8/10
——————-
The Bad: 
1. Fillers
Yes, the fillers are also telling stories. Maybe is not cannon but this is the anime, not the manga. The thing is that easily, Shippuden would had only 375 eps instead of
                  those 750+ were the half was just fillers. Pierrot wanted money huh? Don’t get me wrong, there are some fillers that are really enjoyable, but the most were horrendous and stupid.
2. Pacing Issues
This anime in some moments suffers of some slow pacing moments that may confuse the spectator of how fast or how slow the story is. Well, also considering that has 750+ episodes.
3. The Final
Sadly, Shippuden has an awful ending and maybe one of the worst finals and arcs I have ever seen in my life watching anime and reading manga. The last arc was just so painful, to the point were Kishimoto was lazy or wanted to rush the final. Because the last arc ruined the message of the series and also a good villain. Additionally, there are a lot of power ups and null character development. Also ruined a lot of characters progression and overused some characters to the point were they were broken.
The Good:
1. Arcs
Yep, Shippuden’s story is pretty good, showing us more content of Naruto’s journey to become a Hokage. Showing us outstanding arcs like the Pain’s arc, were the character development, story, evolution, construction, villain phylosophy, fights, sad moments, epic moments were just incredible. There are more arcs that also are really impressive, but the most brilliant one is Pain’s. 
2. Characters that move the plot 
There are some characters (not everyone) that controls the plot and move it to the direction they want. And this is an awesome thing. It reminds me of Hisoka Morow from Hunter X Hunter, who also directions the plot to everywhere he wants. Well, the exact same thing happens in this series. 
3. Themes, ideology and philosophy
I have to say that the themes, ideologies and philosophies of the characters/villains are just historical. I have never seen a show with such themes. In the first “Naruto” animation, the main theme was loneliness and how it destroys you. But in “Naruto: Shippuden”, there’s more themes and also well constructed. In philosophy, the philosophy of certain villain makes him one of the best villains I have ever seen in a shounen. My favorite villain is Meruem from Hunter X Hunter, but this certain villain is also as good as Meruem’s philosophy. The ideology of all the villains are splendid, they all have different ideologies that makes them historical and remarkable.
4. Fights
As a shounen anime, Shippuden is one of the best in terms of fights. The animation was not that good, but we see ideological fights and well constructed fights. All the fights make sense. But there’s one issue with one of the main character that makes one fight with: “How did he didn’t win?!” or “How is he not dead?!!”
——————-
Art: 7/10
——————-
Studio Pierrot is characterized as an studio that has just a “decent” animation. I totally agree with that. There are some parts in the anime were the characters doesn’t even blink and they keep standing there if like nothing has happened. While there are some parts/fights were the studio think: “Yes, I’m gonna put effort in this one”.
——————-
Sound: 9/10
——————-
The music in this anime is just amazing. There are a lot of themes that are just so damn good and if you hear it another time, you will definitely recognize it. Why I’m not giving it 10/10? Because sometimes the music repeats himself until the scene finishes, and it’s a little tedious. 
——————-
Character: 6/10
——————-
This is the part where I know almost everyone known that there are a LOT of wasted characters. While in the first “Naruto” animation the characters were well constructed and with bases, like Neji and Lee for example, in Shippuden, they ruin it. Just the protagonists and some secondary characters have development. The reason that this is not lower is because every character is different from the other. They are all unique, but it doesn’t mean it has good development. There are a lot that are completely wasted. 
——————-
Enjoyment: 9/10
——————-
Even thought Shippuden has a lot of issues with characters, animation and some arcs, the enjoyment was really high. It will keep you watching this until the very night and maybe almost without sleeping.
——————-
Overall: 7.8/10
——————-
I still think that “Naruto” is better than “Naruto: Shippuden” but is still a great shounen series. It’s a pretty good shounen that deserves to be one of the “Big 3” in the anime (Alongside with One Piece and Dragon Ball). My favourite shounen of all time is Hunter X Hunter, but still Naruto: Shippuden is still a great series recommended for everyone.

Overall it was an enjoyable ang nostalgic anime.
Hence they shouldn't have ruined it's legacy by making a crap boruto.
