I'm not one for long lengthily reviews, so I'll be brief. The complexity of the storyline weaved in Naruto Shippuden is a great advancement in depth and seriousness. A change reflective of the growth in the characters as well as the viewing audience. Darker, more extensive backstories are revealed with many a plot twist in addition to breath-taking advancements from the prequel. Once you begin watching this (assuming you've watched and enjoyed the first) you'll be engrossed. The only reason I wouldn't score the anime perfectly would be due to the frequency of less interesting fillers in the middle of arcs as well as the
                  slow start before the real intensity and emotional depth takes hold in the plot.

Naruto is a classic anime people should watch. Everyone will enjoy and be drawn to this. The storyline is very interesting (although it might have some fillers). The main protagonist is someone I can relate to. He never gives up, he draws people to him, be them friend or foe, and can kick butt in so many ways. His rival Sasuke can be a bit annoying, but he does have some redeeming qualities. Sakura can be unbearable at times but gets better during the last stages. Naruto is one character that kids can watch and even look up to. He can be a good role
                  model for kids everywhere.

Disclaimer: My review is purely based on the cannon episodes of Shippuden. I did not watch the filler.
Naruto Shippuden is a very emotional character-driven story, and that's why I love it. Sure, it has an out-of-this-world story, with some pretty insane powers (though I do think that this is part of the anime's charm), but it's mainly the characters that carry the show. They are some of the most memorable, well-designed, iconic, and interesting characters in anime history if you ask me. 
Shippuden is also great from a technical standpoint. My mind is blown at how consistently fantastic, beautiful, and effective the music is. The
                  soundtrack has its own personality, and never fails in setting the mood for any given scene. The OPs and most of the EDs are also pretty unforgettable. While Shippuden certainly has many instances of subpar animation and art, there are also many instances of absolutely phenomenal art and fight choreography that are well worth the wait.
My only real issue is with one of the last arcs of the anime. I won't get into spoilers, but I thought it was, hands-down, the worst written cannon arc in all of Shippuden. This fact made the victory of that arc feel less deserved and a little hollow. That being said, the anime does end on a beautiful high note. As a whole, this anime is profoundly memorable. Because of that, I can forgive the aforementioned poorly written arc. This was a wonderful anime, and deciding to watch it from the beginning was one of the best decisions I've ever made.

Both series of Naruto were in my opinion unenjoyable, at its worst the anime is inconsistent with animation, plethora of poorly written characters and poor pacing with things like 6 mins of recap footage, cutaways to backstories and flashbacks not necessary to whats going on, and actual interesting characters in the original series that I liked ended up becoming background characters being replaced for even worse written characters. With the 700 episodes of Naruto you could better spend ur time watching 30 smaller 12 episode anime. At its best Naruto is full of unique design, amazing fight scenes and creative fighting styles and techniques, and
                  interesting character dynamics developing one of the most iconic rivalries in anime history. Although I did not take the time to watch all 700 episodes I would not recommend anyone this anime

Apart from the war arc and ending this is a great anime. Unfortunately the series ended up being milked at the end for money. Masashi Kishimoto's brother Seishi's o-parts hunter also had a war arc but it was done a lot better than what's in naruto. Yes the war arc has some exciting moments but it lacked a distinct purpose (and there are other parts that have you scratching your head wondering "does that make sense"). It's pretty disappointing that kishi dropped the ball on the end because i think naruto could have continued developing characters. The fights going from more hand to hand to
                  dragon ball level attacks didn't feel natural

Naruto Shippuden, in my opinion, is one of the best animes I watched here is why.
First of lost character development from every character in the series.
The art was perfect in my opinion it could have been a bit better but I still think the art was great.
The sound was one of the best parts the endings and openings were amazing no disappointment at all.
The story and plot were both amazing and I didn't even mind the fillers but the flashbacks were annoying which is one of the naruto weaknesses.
My personal favorite was the pain arc but the war arc was a bit dragged but it
                  ended up being worth it at the end.
Overall 10/10 Amazing anime.

King of retcons. Queen of killing continuity. I thought this was some hype shit; at least for a shonen. But my dumbass was like 10 at the time and looking back it was mediocre at best and I don’t understand how people older than me can see it as otherwise. When the series first started, the show was about strategy and mastery of stealth, jutsu, and planning. Now what? Who can explode more shit? Who has the biggest ghost monster. A betrayal of nostalgia. If you want to watch/read a shonen, go read One Piece (don’t watch pacing is shit). 2/10.

Here we have a world that holds quite an immersive story which not only advances over time, but even events of the world's past end up building up the events that took place in the story's present era.
As for the characters (ignoring filler characters) we saw a lot of them grow up over time (especially due to the use of the time skip) as well as see just how corrupting a tale of revenge can be. Though of course we'll always have our complaints on some things ('Useless' Sakura and Sasuke only paying an arm for his actions), but they don't really do much damage
                  to the series overall.
So great series overall...but the only real downside in my opinion would be the sheer amount of fillers in this and its predecessor (Naruto). Such is the fate of the 2000s era mainstream anime.

I will waste no time here to layout the story, you all should already know it by the time you get to this review. So instead I'll answer the elephant in the room questions about this series; "IS IT WORTH THE TIME TO WATCH A SERIES THIS LONG? IS THE FILLER THAT BAD?" The first answer is yes with a but. Yes it's good, and when it’s at it's best, it’s great! BUT, when it's not good it's past bad to downright insulting. I understand recaps are for those who may be joining the adventure late, but the series does it so often that it
                  negates what comes before. So is it worth the watch, yes, but be prepared to skip some episodes like I did. 
The second question’s answer is yes, with a maybe. Yes it is. I mentioned I skipped chunks of this series, maybe if you love the series and/or characters you'll find motivation to watch the filler. The show has a large cast with a wide array of characters, some you’ll like more than others. That may be more motivation to watch the filler arcs than I had. I watched some of it, but not all. The six out of ten stems from the fact that when the show is at it’s best it’s a ten, and when it’s at it’s worst it’s a 1 average those together it’s 5.5. It’s just entertaining enough to round up to a six.

I'll try to keep this short:
If you skip most of the fillers (not all), the anime is pretty good. 
It's one of those animes that grow on you over time, and it's all worth it when you watch the final episodes as if you went on the journey with Naruto, watched him grow from a nobody to one of the strongest people to exist in the universe.
The music is really good and well used. It never changes from the original and it's used perfectly.
Naruto has the best Anime plot I've ever watched.
There are many characters and you will definitely find one to relate too. Most
                  of the female characters are hard to like and some don't get enough screentime.
If you're willing to take the journey, I assure you you won't regret it.

The best anime after naruto is naruto shippuden. Yes as it tells u about betrayals like who  betrayed konohagakure no sato (Hidden leaf village) it also shows about itachi and sasuke(i am not giving spoilers) it gives the secrets as if u know in the prequel naruto and doesn't know his parents. It even shows about gaara and naruto which i like absolutely. So i give it a full 100/100. It even shows things which are nice. The only thing i dont like is why did the makers make naruto almost bald in later episodes he dosent look nice. I would prefer his hairstyle
                  like minato which looks so much nice and if he would get uzumaki strength with namizaki also if would be nice. So bye

After the original Naruto series the quality of the story diminishes greatly. Mostly because Naruto's popularity made the corporate control over the series much more involved, thus skewing the story to fit polling, and also the narrative got really convoluted just in terms of enemies and power ups and this and that. I'd still recommend watching this just because some parts of the story are worth knowing! If you've seen the og Naruto, seeing Naruto pursue Sasuke, and Sasuke's bid for power and search for the truth are something you want to see unravel. Lot's of really cool fights in this series. Can get really
                  monotonous though, especially if you watch fillers. Not to spoil anything, but if you are excited for character development, expect to see the opposite in some cases, you will probably be disappointed if you are really looking into the show. If not, then enjoy it for what it is!

Well, can't say I didn't enjoy such anime, but the plot was going on for too long with it's fair share of fillers happening. But the one in manga however, proves me wrong. The main point here is like one of those in the previous naruto seasons where the bloody epic battle between sasuke and naruto were totally outstanding.
 I think what kept this anime going is the sort of predicted events that are going to come from the main plot, but at the same time, some unexpected turn of events from the sidelines. overall, it's a worthwhile anime.

I was so sad when I came to know that Naruto Shippuden has come to end but its great, all well when the ends well. They should have made some wedding scenes too but I think they must be working on the 'Boruto' series, after all its going to be aired on 5th of April. I hope to see some old characters in Boruto. It was disappointing that they haven't mention a single scene of Jiraya, he was the one teach Naruto the "Ransengan" and taught him about the "Sage mode".
Overall, the last episode made me cry like others too, I love the show and
                  hope Boruto bring back the old Naruto days. 
Believe it!

About Naruto: OMG this is one of the trash and overrated Anime I've ever seen. 
Plot? Cliche, cheap emotional scenes
What about Characters? They're suck, Kishimoto is a bad writer he literally can't draw women characters, no character development.
What about art? Inconsistent. Especially the Naruto vs Pain and I actually laughed at the Anime while the Anime isn't really emotional. 
What about Sound? Cheap and overrated soundtracks, I rather hear Yugioh soundtracks instead, Yugioh soundtracks although underrated but it's absolutely Better than Naruto soundtrack and can easily fit with other animes like God Anger, Battle of God,...
Tons of fillers and flashbacks. 
This isn't your shonen Anime.
                  Watch something like DBZ One Piece HXH instead.

As much as i loved both naruto(Young and older) I'm just going to say that i enjoyed the fact, that i got to play the games reading the manga and watching the anime since they're all good they follow up the story ...not much to say really besides my disappointed reviews on some errors within this series. . .
>Sakura not dying. . . .
>Neji's death wasn't really needed,
>Boruto still ninja or Advanced Technology..?
I would agree not all animes could normally get in my feelings but this anime gave characters actual hearts which connected and was able to hit mine indeed i was in a hurry
                  to wipe years off my face when naruto was talking to his father(edo form) about telling him he was doing well and to give the message to his mother but if you all had this same feeling be sure to let me know.. i'm sure you too could use a shoulder~ :P

Naruto fans need to calm down. 
This show needs 80 episodes MAXIMUM. 
The long awaited ending was completely BAD.
If you have time to watch this UNNECESSARY LONG SHOW, skip the fillers and most episodes and you will still feel bored a bit.
Every 50-100 episodes you will feel some kind of excitement, and then, LOOK AT THAT, MORE FILLERS.
I was completely hyped for this show, myself and from other people, and I expected so much from it, but it is a really poor and long show all in all. 
Tastes are different, but there is no need to waste time on such an anime (where most
                  episodes aren't even connected to the manga itself).

Story: 9
I really love the story, and -spoiler- the storyline gets exponentially more complicated and I really like that. The mediocre 'me = best ninja and my friend ran away, I must get him back' changed to some masterminds with mindf*ck plans that actually make sense! If you're a kid, you won't get what happened after the first arc with Sai.
Art: 1
It's not exactly the art, it's the animation. It's like they don't care if the animation is any good. They slagged off with the starting of shippuden and I really can't give a higher grade than an 1
Sound: 5
It had some great OP and
                  ED's, especially bacchoi!! I really like most of the voices. Some of them are anoying, like sakura, but in general it's quite good.
Character: 6
I dislike a lot of them. A lot of them are just annoying, like sakura, but there are some characters who are just epic wins! I would like to praise Itachi, Deidara, Jiraiya, Pain, Shikamaru, Hinata and Kiba.
Enjoyment: 7
Despite the lack of good animation and annoying voices and characters, this anime has a lot of great jokes and some characters just make you laugh, no matter what. 
Overall: 7
I would give it 8 if the animation was ANY good

How in the world can people claim this to be the greatest anime they've seen? *Deep sigh*
This show had 40 episodes worth of content and like 20 good episodes and even in those good episodes there was like 8 minutes of content.
The art was super inconsistent, you clearly saw when the studio ran out of money and started drawing like little children.
There was no Character development.
It was overall a dreadful experience and it wasn't enjoyable at all.
People hyped this show to be life altering and the greatest thing a man can see.
If you ever want to start this show, I'd suggest rather hitting your head
                  through the wall and then going skinny dipping at the fountain in the middle of your city. getting arrested for that offers more enjoyment than any of the episodes in this show.

QUICK REVIEW, MINOR SPOILERS.
so.. I finally watched Naruto, dubbed as one of the three great big shounen, and I have so many mixed feelings about it.. so let's start!
Story 7/10: the story... was not one of its strongest points. It's good, but does it drag on unnecessarily with plot Twists that make no sense at times? 100%. A prime example of this is orochimaru switching sides randomly and with no real explanation  other than 'the wind'. This is a character who's literally committed genocide. That said, I do think the mangaka does an insanely well done job with highlighting certain themes from beginning to
                  end, such as perseverance and friendship. The repetitiveness of the constant love/hate  between sasuke/naruto, the idea of the 3 in a team representing history & idea of hate and love itself throughout history is what truly brought forward emotions for myself and really carried the plot. That said, pain arc was a masterpiece, and all the other arcs in shippuden pale in comparison. Furthermore, it concluded the huge series really nicely with the wedding... makes me wonder if boruto was needed...
Art 4/10: disgusting, and the reason is in this section im including the outright bad fillers and flashbacks. Okay  some fillers mightve been good , but when you're in the middle of a war and suddenly have a filler of happy konohamaru..no, just no. People use the excuse of 'were binge watching it now but at the time fillers were good' - let me tell you, no they weren't. Why? Because one piece has less fillers than naruto, running since 1997+ and being double the length . There's other ways to go around lengthening/ delaying the show, and having 20 episode arc long fillers in the middle of scene is a no no. And the flashbacks... you get flashbacks from the episode before. I truly wonder how much better naruto would've been without the fillers and unnecessary flashbacks.
Sound 9/10: beautiful, the themes that play during a certain group, truly resonates their character. Openings and endings were solid. No complaints at all.
Character 10/10: This is what carried the show. This. When you talk to someone about naruto, they don't say I wanna be naruto, the say I wanna be madara,  or itachi  or daedara. The villains were so well designed and have so much personality it truly is what made naruto into a masterpiece in my opinion. Naruto didn't carry the show, the villains did. The character development was top notch, seeing narutos growth throughout the entire anime was really solid to watch as well, same with sasuke. Even sakura to a certain extent. Also special shootout to kakashi, easily one of the most liked characters in the entire show,  tbh all the characters were above average with design. Then there's the most significant characters,  naruto and sasuke. The love/hate between them is so beautiful and eloquent, that it draws out a multitude of emotions from the watcher, who's awaiting them to meet. I've never seen such love portrayed as the way naruto did for sasuke in any anime really.
Enjoyment 8/10: Naruto is truly unique. It's an anime I can see why so many people admire it. But let's be honest here, if the villains weren't as cool as they are , I don't think it would've been a show to remember.

Most of us will probably review Naruto base on nostalgic more then logic. I too remember when I first saw Naruto, because it was one of the earlier anime I watched and being a ninja was the coolest thing. You can do all these hand signs and focus your chakra and the most random running style ever. But looking back at Naruto, those were long gone once Shippuuden hits. Basically toss all that out the door, world building and power scaling, what's that? 
Remember how Madara name sent chill down everyone's back and how a whole war started just because of that name alone. Well
                  guess what, he's just a pawn and who the heck is Kaguya? Where is the setup.. oh we'll explain some plot that it's all been there without really building up to it and you'll just have to accept it. 
I can go on and complain a lot about Naruto, because I loved Naruto when it first came out. Well until we got fillers and talking Ninjutsu. Honestly I was never a fan of Naruto lol... since I thought he was the most trash Ninja... Since in my head, a ninja is crafty and silent, Naruto is like totally everything opposite. He had his moments in the earlier arc... but I got annoyed by him more and more as it went on. 
The power scaling is just dumb as ever too... remember how they said Naruto can't use that one technique a lot... then he goes only spam it the rest of the time... yeah... when power scaling was a thing. Good times good times... 
Well no point of commenting or messaging me, I don't really care if you want to defend Naruto or whatever. I once too loved it, but I ain't looking back at it with nostalgic eyes, because if I did, I would say I loved it... but upon watching more anime, I remember why I couldn't finish it. 
But hey I will admit, Guy vs Madara was probably one of the coolest fight scene in Shippuuden... seriously though, I love him but he should've died. And wtf is up with Neji death seriously? I didn't feel sad, more like that's just poor writing.

Story:(8) The need to get stronger continues from where Naruto was in the hostipal asking Jaraiya to personally train him to save a friend (Original Naruto). 2 years and a half have passed when he returns to Konoha. The need to save a friend is it worth?, or forget about this rogue ninja?. The decision is on Naruto throughout the story. Pain Arc (-1) a resurrection is so wasted when characters already displayed their feelings of ones death. War Arc (-1) this one is contentiously adding fillers when you know the content of fillers since it was already explained this was a nuisance when you
                  make it from this nuisance you will enjoy it later on. (Personal Opinion) The new Naruto generation is not interesting to me, and it should of ended with Shippuden after Naruto ,and Sasuke last fight at the Valley. That episode of it's epilogue is where it truly ends for me.
Art(7) The continuously consistently not up to par animation is so frequent during this anime (-2). It really disappointed me since the (Original Naruto) have better animation this is embarrassing. (-1)
Sound(9) The soundtrack is worthy for the ear to listen, and for the fitting right moments it makes sense to have it there to add excitement, or personal moments. It's original counterpart had a better list to continuously use throughout the anime while Shippuden have less. (-1)
Character(10) Character build up is prevalent in the time skip, and it questioned you how much they changed since the skip. Once more they are enjoyable characters compared to its original counterpart.
Enjoyment(8) From these ratings it leaves me with a 7 pushing to a 8 since the characters are so worth the wait to watch build up in their character development.
Overall(7)

One of the most popular animes of all time..
Writing seems to have gotten better than its original series. The episodes where they showcase the past were probably the best episodes in the whole series other than the fights. The story was good but had bad pacing at times especially during the fights, some flaws, and also the sub par stories of some of the episodes because almost half of them were fillers. Character development was good also. The characters were alright, there are very few that are likable or interesting.
Some of the openings and endings of this anime are legendary and are definitely in the
                  anime hall of fame. The music was amazing. Animation looked pretty good but quite inconsistent at times. It had a similar vibe to the previous series.
Overall it was an enjoyable series, it was well rounded and the only thing that really sticked out was the lore and history of this fictional world.
Memorable: No.. Rewatchable: Maybe..

Alguns personagens não foram de todo muito bem aproveitados, senti falta de um aprofundamento na história dos outros jinchuurikis. As outras vilas também não foram muito bem aproveitadas, acho que o universo da névoa, da nuvem e da pedra poderiam entrar mais cedo no enredo. 
Em algumas partes as novels passam a ser melhores que o canon original... 
O final do anime também não me agradou tanto, creio que o autor tinha de fato um grande desafio ao tentar explicar a origem dos poderes oculares e dos bijuus, mas ele poderia ter feito melhor.
A minha nota se justifica por gostar do canon até saga Pain
                  e pelo fato do universo de Naruto ser o meu favorito.

Naruto Shippuden : The first 300 episodes are clearly nothing compaired to the rest. The last 200 are what made Naruto so good, they are the reason why everyone love Naruto. The sound, the animation, the story, everything is awesome. But there is one thing that bothers me. The ending. It could've been 1000 times better... In my opinion, it should have stopped when Sasuke and Naruto are lying on the ground after the final fight. After that, everything feels like non canon episode. All the hype was gone, and Naruto didn't even become the hokage. Also, the art and animation was batched. Other than
                  that, I am glad that I watched this anime, it really affected me.

I have watched Naruto/Naruto Shippuuden as a child and loved the action, now that I am older an have been watching anime for many many years (17) out of the hundreds of shonen anime, Naruto takes the first place prize! you can watch Naruto simply for the action, but you can dig much much deeper into the characters past and see their development, as well as see the wonderful meaning behind the story, the depth of some characters truly amazes me, and the mystery is not lacking either! You truly feel like your there experiencing these characters emotions as well as the story first hand!
                  This is a great first anime especially! I cannot tell you how many people have gone from hating anime to loving it because I recommended Naruto series to them. I consider my self a seasoned veteran when it comes to shonen anime, and I am pretty picky about what I consider 10/10, but Naruto hits the ball out of the park!! Even the 3rd time I watched the series all the way through, there was STILL things that I did not even think about and mystery to uncover. IF you have not watched Naruto I suggest you do, stick with it and really look at the whole show (depth, story, characters, plot, theme) or just stick around for the fights, up to you either way you will not be disappointed! The last thing I will leave you with is, if you really do not like filler, skip the Naruto fillers and go back and watch them at a later time. A  lot of them are really funny, JUST MAKE SURE THEY ARE ACTUALLY FILLER! some episodes are cannon/filler mix!

This series was a disaster. Right from the start I was already annoyed when Naruto was screaming SASUKE but I never realized that would basically sum up the Story of Shippuden. The series started getting dull because of the characters, the animation and the story also, I'm not saying that this series didn't have AWESOME moments but unfortunately, there are more bad moments than good ones. The few Naruto fans that I know, told me that they stopped watching Shippuden out of frustration and honestly I don't blame them BUT by the end, the show redeems itself and I would say that aside from the
                  little flaws that annoy me, the end is pretty satisfying.  
If you watched Naruto, you have to watch Shippuden in order to get some closure so my advice is avoid the filler and prepare to be surprised and for a few disappointing moments.

I actually grew up with Naruto. I was around eight and use to wait for him to come on adult swim. Enough corny backstory let`s get into Naruto: Shippuuden. I really like this show. The fact that he was able to beat all odds when the world wanted to see him fail or to become mediocre its a good lesson for people of all ages. Not only that every episode had a lesson attached to it. 
OK Let`s get into the cons. Those D*MN filler episodes towards the end. I don`t know if he was trying to continue this anime like the infinite tsukuyomi or
                  what. I understand the creators need to stretch out this legendary and famous anime but come on dude. Also the graphic animation of fights of the last few seasons of the anime were a bit ..odd? Like you couldnt see legs or their faces were contorted so weirdly lol. Maybe they were trying to stress the magnitude of power each character held? I don`t know but it was funny looking. The anime finished when both Naruto and I was seventeen and I was in SHAMBLES. I cried for one minute.

Before I start, yes Naruto was one of my first anime and I did grow up with it and I may be blinded by its nostalgia by just a tiny bit. I'll try to be as unbiased as possible by talking about what I liked and what I didn't like in this show.
I'll start by saying that Naruto has one of the best cast of characters from any Shonen anime I've seen. You can say whatever you want about Naruto's story and all the plot holes and inconsistencies it has, but you can't deny Kishimoto's character writing for the most part is amazing. There's a
                  reason why these characters are so iconic and why many other writers have taken inspiration from them. There are so many characters I love in this show, but there are just too many of them so I just gonna talk about my top favorite ones.
Naruto is one of my favorite shonen protagonists. I love the way he's written and how he first appears in the story. We first see him as this annoying brat that likes to make a mess of things, but then we learn about his past and what happened to his parents. We also learn that the nine tails is sealed inside of him and that's the reason why the village treats him like an outcast. So obviously Naruto dreams to be Hokage so he can be acknowledged by everyone in the village and seeing him grow as a person and as a character throughout the OG show and Shippuden is really satisfying. What I also like about him is his personality, he's always being really goofy but he isn't stupid, during a dire situation he knows that he must get serious and fight like a man. I don't really have much more to say about him, while he isn't my favorite character in this show, he's still amazing and while people like to meme the whole Sasuke and Naruto thing, I actually thought it was a good dynamic between the two.
Now I'm gonna talk about my favorite character in this whole series and who is also one of my favorites of all time, and that is Itachi. Itachi is probably one of the most well-written characters from any shonen series. After learning his entire backstory and his motivations, he instantly became my favorite character, his past is one of the best parts of this show and he stole the moment in pretty much every scene he was in. I think I said this in my Bleach review for Ichimaru, but I really love characters that hide their true motivations from the audience and then later reveal what they really were. Itachi alongside Ulquiorra 100% deserves to be part of the black air force round table.
Now I'll talk about Kakashi who is my second favorite character and is also one of the most fun badass characters in this entire show. I just love seeing tragic characters hiding their dark past and emotions behind their fun personalities. His Anbu backstory is one of the best arcs in Shippuden. Although It's filler I would say It's one of the most well-written arcs in this show because it really dives into his depressing past and what his life was like after losing Rin and Obito. Also, I would say It's pretty obvious that a lot of writers have taken inspiration from Kakashi's character. You can deny it as much as you want but come on now, you easily can tell that Gojo was influenced by Kakashi. I'm not throwing shade at Gojo or anything but his design, personality, power, status, are very similar. I mean come on just look at the two. I think If there was a Shonen Jump crossover these two would get along quite well.
Lastly, I'll keep this brief but Naruto probably has one of the best and most iconic villains in all of anime. Just like Aizen if you search up the top ten best anime villains, nine times out of then you'll see a Naruto villain there. Pain is one of the most badass drippy characters in this entire show, his whole character, every scene he's in, and his entire cycle of hatred speech is just so awesome and well written. In fact, the entire Akatsuki was badass. Madara probably had one of the most badass introductions in a Shonen anime. He fights an entire army as a warm-up match and later continues trash-talking, he's was honestly one of the better parts of the Fourth Great Ninja War arc until he was ruined by the ending but I'll talk more about in the things I didn't like.
There are so many other things I love in Naruto that I haven't mentioned yet, mainly because I don't want to make this review too long, so I'll just put it all here. The ost is amazing. The Pain arc is one of my favorite arcs of all time. Other characters I loved in this show are, Gaara, Rock Lee, Neji, Guy, Jiraya, Hinata, Orochimaru, Obito (for the most part), Minato, Shikamaru, and Shisui although I'm sure I'm forgetting a few of them. The animation is also really good, granted some of the animation can get choppy but when it wants to get good, it gets good. Naruto's fights at the time were like nothing else, no other Shonen series could even compete against it. Granted a lot of newer anime have better animation but honestly prefer the old fully hand-drawn animation. 
Just like Bleach my biggest issue with this show is THE F%#KING FILLER AND THE EXTREME PADDING THAT STUDIO PIERROT HAD DONE! But this time my experience was much worse because unlike Bleach where I actually skipped all the filler, I was watching Naruto as it was airing so I wouldn't know when a filler episode would come crashing down from hell. The filler was atrocious because you would watch a canon episode, and then you would get hit by filler non-stop. You had to wait for so many months just to watch a canon episode only to get hit by garbage filler again. This was one of the many reasons why the Fourth-Great-Ninja-War arc is considered the worst (apart from a few dumb story decisions). Because this was the time when the fillers wouldn't stop coming. Another thing myself and many people hate are the female characters in this show. Kishimoto doesn't know how to write female characters because most of them are so forgettable. Sakura is considered one of the worst characters in Shonen history, if you take her out of the story, it changes essentially nothing. Honestly, if you take most of the female characters out of Naruto, it changes nothing. Granted that doesn't mean that all the female characters are bad. I really like Hinata, and Tsunade and Anko are pretty decent, but for the most the female characters suck. Another major issue was Madara's defeat and the introduction of Kaguya. Her introduction and backstory alone created more plot holes than anything else in Naruto. Kishimoto literally admitted that he made Madara too powerful and that he didn't know how to kill him off, so he shoe-horned Kaguya an even more overpowered villain into the story. Another thing that I didn't like was that a lot of the supporting characters from OG Naruto got side-lined in Shippuden, granted they have their moments here and there, but for the most part, they didn't really do anything.
Naruto is one of my favorite anime of all time, it isn't my actual favorite or anything because of all these issues that I had, but It's still really good. If I'm being fair and unbiased, I would still think that this is the best shonen anime I've seen. My score for this would probably be an 8.6/10 or an 8.7/10. But I'm putting my nostalgic biased glasses on and I'm giving it a 9/10. Also just like Bleach, be wary of the toxic ass fans, because Naruto has one of the most annoying fandoms out there, although the toxicity has gone down by a lot. Another thing I hate aren't the fans or anything in the anime, It's the people who haven't watched it, for some reason people will bash on you if you like Naruto even if they haven't watched it. I cannot tell you how many times people have said this to me on site, It's one of the most annoying this ever. Anyway, Naruto is really good, stop hating on it for the dumbest reasons and go watch it.

Naruto Uzumaki is a young ninja who bears a great power hidden inside him, a power that has isolated him from the rest of his village. As such, his only dream is to become the Hokage - the most powerful ninja, and leader of the village; but first he needs to graduate! With his inability to perform even the most basic ninja techniques, it seems that all Naruto has going for him is his determination to succeed no matter what. Teamed up with the genius Sasuke, book-smart Sakura, and their team leader Kakashi, Naruto embarks on his quest to become the Hokage. But with
                  outside forces posing a threat to the entire Hidden Leaf village, Naruto discovers that he must become much stronger if he ever wants to realize his dream and protect the friendships he's forged .
This series is long but if you start watching it you won't quit. First some episodes is boring but later it becomes interesting . You can skip fillers .There are total 720 Episodes and Some Movies . Movies are kind of fillers , you can skip . But I prefer you to watch Naruto Shippuden : Road to Ninja . The characters of this series are amazing . The music of this series are amazing .
Every anime lover should watch it . It shows us true friendship and love . It shows how the life is without parents .

I finished Naruto on Saturday 4/2/2022 1:02AM, but I couldn't comment, so I am writing my review now.
Naruto is my favorite anime and there is no other to compare it to. I still didn't gave it a 10/10, because it was a bit spoiled for my by Tiktok and other social medias (but not a lot, just that there will be wedding at the end of the series, that Itachi will die, about Rin too), it also had a lot of filler, but all of the fillers build up some kind of relationship with every character, so I was able to feel at least a
                  bit of pain (compared to the actual characters) in every death, a bit joy, laughter and other emotions.
For me the saddest episode was 474 (Congratulations), because Naruto lost his father again (R.I.P.) and the whole talk to Minato was just depressing and I was crying like a baby that night.
The death that hit me the most was Jiraiya's (my favorite side character). It didn't hit me when He died, but the episodes where Naruto found out about it killed me inside and the flashbacks to memories of him.
Not a lot to say about this show, because it left me speechless, but I need to give a shout out time my man Itachi for being a hero we didn't deserve....
Best villains:
1.Itachi (not a real villain, but everybody in the anime thinks like that, so ye...)
2.Pain or Nagato (He wanted true peace, but in the wrong way)
3.Obito (a strong shinobi and I give him my respect for what he has done. All He really wanted was a world with Rin in it)
4.Madara (the God of the shinobi, but all he wanted was power and that was the thing that killed him)
5.Orochimaru (at the end He became a good guy, but he still killed the 3rd Hokage)
That pretty much sums up my review. Could be writing about the whole show, but even this was a drag to write (I'm kind of like Shikamaru :D ).
Want to say hi to my cousin who started watching Naruto 3 years ago. When I started watching it he was about 100-200 episodes away from the end, but I still caught up to him and surpassed (He is about 50 episodes away from the end of it, but can't really be watching, because He is studying hard in the university). Don't really know if he is using this site, but he still is the guy who got me into anime, so i really appreciate that.
I will most definitely will be re-watching this in like a year or a bit more.
Thanks to the staff for creating this masterpiece <3
DATTEBAYO

Look, this show was pretty great, and is a dang classic. Love the setting, themes, and everything about it! As a weekly series though, the filler is absolutely a detriment.
I'd give this a 8-9 star if you could cut all the flashbacks from it. It gets to a point where you will watch a scene, a flashback will play of that scene, and then they will talk about it for 5 minutes mid- battle before flashing back to the talk they just had. It doesn't respect your time and I almost dropped the show because I was so put off by this. Quantity over quality
                  was very much a theme for about half of Shippuden.
If you're willing to follow a list of the "cannon" happenings and forego context of the episodes, that might be your fastest route through Shippuden. I got through most of these 500 eps by CONSTANTLY hitting 'forward 10s' on my media player, and found that 60-80% of each episode didn't have any new content, just rehashing. This will literally happen, up to and in the final episode.
Good show. Filler makes me afraid to watch Boruto.

500 episodes ------- 7.9 / 10
Hailed as a classic, hated as never before: Naruto Shippuden. It clearly suffers from its overuse of fillers. Even so, it still maintains an interesting narrative bringing action, comedy and drama together until its conclusion. Definitely a classic that has affected world culture and will continue to affect it over the years. Watching after the hype I must say: It is a decent and very fun anime.
The good:
-It has a good world building.
-well developed in terms of characters.
- Animation doesn't bother so much.
- Good sound design and soundtrack.The bad:
-  Fillers kill the pacing, especially at the final arc.
- Animation mistakes happen often.
-  Sound is worse than in comparasion with the classic version
Overvall a fun show to watch after the hype.

Hmmm what can I say about Naruto?
Well, for having a total of 500 epsidoes 204 of these are fillers (This is 41% of the anime).  This is a bit annoying because it did drag out some of the scenes, which I found a bit unnecessary.  I think filler episodes break up the flow of the anime and makes me confused about what's happening when they finally end and go back to the main story.  
However, the anime was really fun to watch.  The anime had the right amount of comedy and angst when needed.  
Overall, the anime displayed good character
                  development (for some of the characters at least), I just wished that it had less filler episodes, but it's to be expected with an anime this big.

Shippuden is literal fillers to the characters past. But incase you're skipping all the fillers,it's an enjoyable series. Plenty of likeable characters even though Naruto is still cringy to watch :/. I remember so many of the OP's in Naruto because it's just that good. The character development is tolerable,I suppose. The story feels rather slow at times,but it's alright for a shonen anime. In my personal opinion,the Pain arc is the best. Nothing can top that. The action is nice but not that amazing. Naruto:Shippuden is an alright anime at it's core but it can be enjoyable if you're into this kind of stuff.
                  Just don't go expecting great character development or an amazing story cause this anime doesn't have it.

Oh boy, this is going to be a long one. I put Naruto Shippuden on Hiatus way back when in 2012 or so, when I caught up to the manga. At that time, Bee was first being introduced as a new character. 8 or so years later, I finally, over the stretch of a month, finally finished the entire show. There will be some spoilers in this review. It's been like 7 years since this show has been released, so I highly doubt you haven't watched this show, or plan on doing so anytime soon.
In all honesty, Naruto: Shippuuden can be said to contain many
                  flaws, some including ridiculous plot armor, plot holes, and questionable character development. Let's go over them. When talking about the plot in Naruto, one also has to include characters. Characters become a major plot point in many of the most important arcs in Naruto, and so they have to be discussed side by side. And what else but starting with the Main Character himself, Uzumaki Naruto? 
Naruto can't be considered a terrible shounen main character, and he certainly fills the role quite well. The problem is that much of his character could have been developed in a much greater way than what actually ended up ensuing in his self reflecting and confrontational arcs. His  beginning arcs were probably one of the best I've ever seen in a show: gradually transforming from a loner to an identity as a member of team seven. Iruka was the first person to acknowledge Naruto, and this gradual dynamic between Sasuke and Naruto begin to begin. Naruto is able to get acknowledgement and satisfaction from the bonds that he painstakingly forms, and Sasuke doesn't even want to form them in the first place, and thus begins the whole entire setup for their rivalry down the path. However, somewhere along the line, Naruto begins to stagnate as a character. He's extremely immature throughout the entire show, and despite this childish nature, still manages to mature in different ways. This is confusing to say the least. When it comes to his goals, which he eventually finds out with his interactions with Jiraiya and Pain, he's able to easily find his determination and objectives. which of course, can be summed up in: peace. Yet, at the same time, he's idealistic and lacks any sort of concrete plan that allows him to follow up on that objective, and this continues until the very end of the series, where he still has this immature idealistic world view. Neji's death might have been a wake up call for himself, and in some ways, it is. He realizes that in conflict, not everyone can be saved, yet he shouldn't wallow in that despairing emotion, but make sure that the ideals that the person died for wasn't for naught. Perhaps Itachi's talk about how not every burden can be shouldered on his own could also suffice as a rare form of maturing. However, this is where his maturation as a character seems to end, and these moments are few and far between, not to mention, extremely short. There are so many characters and story arcs that focus on Naruto persevering and reinforcing his determination for his goal, but there seems to an extreme lack in any sort of maturing or learning of how he's able to complete such a task. 
Instead of learning from his own mistakes, he instead gets convenient plot armor in the form of who knows what all scattered throughout the entire series, and this makes him bypass any sort of realization that his actions have consequences. Over and over again, you see Naruto charging into battle, determined to follow through his ideals, and stubborn enough to not ever budge. This is alright, but in the end, he gets beat up, but bailed out by whatever plot devices the author wants to throw at him. Maybe, if someone got extremely hurt, someone died for his mistakes, this would have been a key to his character development. Neji's death occurred in the rare moments that Naruto's actions were completely logical and were not made in a hot blooded attempt to stop the enemy. There is no arc where he undergoes the consequences of his actions, nor is there any arc that helps him understand the reality of his dream. What exactly is it that he can do to make hate disappear from the world? This self searching arc never began. I think it would have been immensely helpful to the depth of Naruto if there was just a single arc where he sees how conflict happens and faces the reality that there isn't just a single "good" side and "bad" side. Naruto obviously understands this theme very well, but it was always through the flashbacks of other people that he watches as a bystander, and never as a personal experience, and as a result, he never truly matures as a character as intended. The fourth ninja war could have been a great example of this happening, if not for the fact that that entire arc was pretty dumb. It clearly marks the shinobi world as "the good guys" and Madara and his gang, "the bad guys." Is it really a shinobi war if it's essentially Madara versus the entire world? It's ridiculous how such a great potential arc became a "good" vs "bad" guy arc. If there was a split in nations supporting and going against Madara, this could not only have been a great way to express how conflict isn't always black and white, but also great fights. Instead, we see lame fights between reanimated people, rather than real ones with real motivations. There is such a distinction that the author wants to make that "these guys are bad and mind controlled by jutsu" that it was hard to sit through. In fact, instead of having people side with Madara, in the end, everyone that used to support him goes against him, truly making it so that there is as little need for any distinction between good and bad at all. The entire war arc feels like a "side character" arc and doesn't feel like there was any sort of real engagement or conflict of interests in place, since again, everyone on the enemy side was mind controlled or copies of Zetsu.
Sasuke, on the other hand, manages to be a much better character in this aspect. Broiled in revenge, he kills his older brother, only to find out the undertones and plots that are hidden in the village. He sets his eyes on the sole reason why Itachi had to kill his own clan: the clan itself. However hot blooded revenge is stopped short by meeting with his brother once again through edo tensei. This arc of revenge to redemption is a clear turning point in Sasuke's character, and is the reason why his goals go from a revenger to a desire to be a savior. This decision to become a savior was also only after he came face to face with the previous hokage, which again, further reinforce the fact that not everything is light and dark. He also cements his perfect idea of what it is to achieve his goal as a savior.
What Naruto and Sasuke both have in common are their idealistic hot blooded pursuits in their goals, yet Sasuke manages to comprehend, through his self reflection, on how to achieve his goals, however silly they might have been. And despite the fact that  there is such a focus on Naruto's character the entire series, there fails to be any sort of progression as a character in Naruto for the most part, only reinforcing his idealistic dreams, while Sasuke is able to become a more well rounded character with much less screen time and focus. In the end, Naruto's and Sasuke's goals are both idealisitc, but Sasuke matures more as a character, and even determines his next course of action without much difficulty, while Naruto is merely led along the plot of "defeating the bad guys" for essentially, the entire series. This does make Naruto progress as a character, but stops short of actually trying to make his abstract goals tangible through his own way of thinking.
Plot armor is also a pretty big issue for Naruto, but it is such for all shounen series in general, but the more pressing issue is power progression. Naruto is considered to be a pretty untalented person, yet he still manages to become the strongest shinobi in the world. How did that happen? Power progression in Naruto Shippuuden is one of the most inconsistent things. People get crazy powers throughout the entire show, and not only is this method fast and instantaneous, it also happens so often. There are so many times in the show where a huge fight is tilting greatly in one side's favor, but due to a crazy powerup reversal, the other side has a great advantage. Both the "good side" and "bad side" do this constantly near the end of the arcs. Not only is this pretty stupid, it doesn't make a lot of sense plot wise. There were many times where some people were so overpowering the other side that the fight was declared over, yet somehow, they don't finish them off and allow them to power up. This power progression is also reserved for a select few, so essentially Sasuke and Naruto become the only relevant characters, power wise at the end of the story. This brings more consequences other than poor plot. It completely destroys and semblance of need for any side characters, and this is my biggest problem with the series.
Naruto has one of the best cast of characters in the entire series. Lee, Tenten, Gaara, Neji, Guy, Iruka, Ino, etc etc. There are definitely quite a cast of arcs dedicated to a lot of side characters in Naruto, and it is one of the best points in Naruto. These characters have great personalities and contributed to the plot greatly, earlier in the story, yet fade to obscurity as the story goes on, and when Sasuke and Naruto become overpowering and leave everyone behind to the point where they don't become any sort of meaningful support. Arcs without Naruto in it tend to be pretty damn good. My favorite arc in Shippuuden was definitely Shikamaru and Asuma's arc. The fights were great, Shikamaru's development was great, and the enemy was interesting to watch. In the end, it goes to show that it was definitely possible for there to be a lot more potential arcs concerning the rest of the cast of characters, but it was never explored, but rather just wasted on Naruto. Fights were flashy for sure, but when the same message of "wow you're just like me, I was lonely and sad too," and "bad guys are bad, I want peace" gets repeated over and over again, you wonder what could have happened if these characters got more love. Not only are characters shoved aside because power level wise, they were completely obsolete, but it also got rid of any sort of interesting fights involving ninjutsu. Shikamaru's arc, again, is an excellent example of this. His shadow binding jutsu was used in unique and different ways, and so were the enemy's jutsu as well. He couldn't afford to get injured because the enemy was able to reflect injuries right back at you. There was a lot of strategy and matchups that were used, but in later fights, this doesn't happen. It's just more like "I'm going to bash you in with my OP power, you don't stand a chance," and for the most part, this is basically what happens. No unique techniques get introduced, no interesting strategies, but just straight up broken and OP powers get brute forced into defeating the enemy. Elemental weaknesses and strengths essentially don't get mentioned ever again at some point. It really sucks. Power creep in Naruto not only demolish characters, but it also got rid of the interesting ninjutsu's that people were employing in fights. This is most apparent in one single ability: Edo tensei. A completely busted and overpowered ability that has so much impact on the ninja war, yet apparently becomes super weak in the later arcs. What happened to invincibility? What happened to unlimited chakra? Edo tensei manages to become one the most busted jutsu's in the show, but becomes practically useless by the end of it, and it also highlights the lack of consistency. Edo tensei not only becomes obsolete because of power creep, but more importantly, it actually gets weaker for no reason at all. It goes from an invincible form  that can't be stopped other than sealing. Regardless of element type, sage chakra, or OP abilities, they will regenerate. Regardless of how much chakra is used, they can regenerate. These features become disabled right after the ninja war arc, and it's never explained. What a bunch of bull.
I talk about characters in Naruto as if there were no bad ones. Far from the truth. Sakura and Kuruma are the worst characters, by far, in the series. I always knew the meme about Sakura being useless was a thing, but I thought it was an exaggeration , if anything. It really wasn't. Sakura is a piece of emotional baggage that had literally no influence on the plot other than the fact that Naruto liked her. Liked. her. It was pretty clear that Naruto liked Sakura in the beginning of the series, but as time went on, Naruto accepted that Sakura didn't have the eyes for him, and Naruto even matures so great that he calls her out on his fake confession. This shows how much as a character Naruto grew in this department at the very least. If this were in the beginning, Naruto would have accepted it no doubt. Sakura, on the other hand, can't make up her mind. Time and time again, she can't make her own decisions, and it's clear that her only role in the series is to make us pissed at her. She can't make a decision on Sasuke. Or on killing Obito. or on her resolve to fight. She is such a static character, as she never truly progresses or matures throughout the entire series, and is babied the entire way by all the people around her, especially Naruto. She too, suffers from power creep immensely, and never manages to catch up to, even after her line of "I've caught up to them, Tsunade" quote. What a joke. She's unironically also a simp. Loves Sasuke from beginning to the end, despite Sasuke only berating her, trying to kill her, and not making a bond with her to the end. Even after all the crap Sasuke does to her, she is irrevocably in love with him. Holy. Crap. Naruto moves on with his love eventually, yet Sakura manages to never do such a thing. Without reason, no matter what Sasuke does, Sakura loves him anyway. She didn't do a single thing for Sasuke, in the end either. As Sasuke said, the only bond he had was with Naruto, not Sakura. Naruto was his only friend. Naruto is the one that Sasuke acknowledges, not Sakura. Overall, not an impactful character. She hogs a bunch of screentime only because she was on team seven in the past with Naruto and Sasuke. 
Kuruma's definitely a much better character than Sakura, but he's still a pretty bad one. He just randomly transitions from an amalgamation of evil to "good guy" within the span of a few minutes in a single episode. I think we all knew that Naruto was going to bond with Kuruma and that Kuruma was going to eventually befriend Naruto, but what a lame and anticlimatic bonding that was! Sure, there were many arcs regarding the evil nature and uncooperativeness of Kuruma, and the his tug of war with Naruto, but there really wasn't much of a bonding arc, and this was much needed. In the end, he gets defeated by Naruto, and acknowledges him as a result. You might be thinking that Sasuke's bonding with Naruto was essentially the same thing, but Sasuke wasn't actually "defeated" by Naruto physically, but philosophically. and this gets explained a lot more. Kuruma's arc felt like subdued=good guy. Not only was it short, it didn't make a lot of sense.
That concludes the main points I wanted to share. There was a lot more to cover, but these were the major points that I wanted to cover.
Side note: I had the benefit of being able to watch both the anime and read the manga long after the series had ended, and as a result, I was able to navigate any and all fillers by combining my reading through any chapters that were mixed/filler, and skipped all the episodes that were filler. As a result, I had the unadulterated canon viewing experience, and in my opinion, the best way to experience the show. I can't say I would have enjoyed the series as much if I didn't have this opportunity, and can't blame other people for disliking the show because they had to sit through all the filler content. But hear me out. I get it, the filler is bad, but unlike one piece's way of introducing filler, in Naruto, pacing is still alright. There's just filler in the form of entire filler arcs and flashbacks. This can easily be skipped. One piece's filler was "unskippable." The show was just at a constant snails pace, which led me to adopt only the manga as a result. Given I could skip the filler, I still rate the anime decently, comparable to the manga.

anyone would know this anime. This anime already has many fans in the world. the Naruto Shippuden series is a continuation of Little Naruto. Many changes appear in Naruto Shippuden, namely improved graphics, storylines that turn out to be more exciting, new jutsu jutsu that appear, and the appearance of Akatsuki that makes the story more interesting and exciting. In Naruto Shippuden there are also many epic moments and exciting and exciting battles. character building is also getting stronger, especially the main character, Uzumaki Naruto. In this anime, the role of Uchiha Sasuke is also getting cooler and more epic. the added value of Naruto
                  Shippuden is the backsound of each scene is very appropriate to the moment, especially sad scenes, very touching. moreover, plus an exciting fight with a long duration is very interesting to watch. the biggest shortcoming of this anime is too many FILLERS. again the filler problem occurs again in the anime Naruto Shippuden, after the previous series there were also many fillers. many fillers are not important in Naruto Shippuden. but there are also interesting filler episodes that still connect to the main story. Naruto is my favorite action anime and will not be replaced by other anime, because this anime has become a legend for me. especially Naruto Shippuden whose storyline changes dramatically, becoming more exciting. I am a big fan of Naruto anime and Naruto Shippuden anime, and also Boruto anime. maybe if Naruto Shippuden has a little filler, then this anime rating will definitely be high, even in my opinion it can be up to 9, because this anime is very popular in the world and has many fans, and has a very exciting story.

Maybe my review is too positive about Naruto because it was thanks to him that I started to watch anime and have the passion for Japanese works as I have today so for me, despite the flaws (which are not few) Naruto is easily in the my top 3 favorite anime. As it's been a while since I saw the anime, maybe I'm not specifying and detailing a lot since I don't remember everything.
   Of the defects that I remember the most striking are the fillers, animation and script holes. Starting with the fillers, the bad part: for those who followed the time
                  when the episodes were released weekly, you know how frustrating it was for you to wait a whole week to see the anime's plot unfold and I found myself a noda filler in the middle of the fight telling things random; the good part: there were some very but very funny fillers man, as an example there is that filler that shows the dream of someone who is in tsukuyomi and in Kankuro's dream it is him controlling a giant robot lol.
   The animation: good most of the time it is average to good however in the arc of the 4th ninja war it was shit after shit in terms of animation as an example has the scene of Obito turning around after absorbing the Juubi (that was horrible) . I didn't mention the Pain VS Naruto fight because I think it was a stroke style done that way on purpose, like in the Gaara VS Rock Lee fight in the classic. I would like to mention some parts that the animation surpassed itself: Kakashi VS Obito inside Kamui, Madara VS Guy with the 8 gates and Naruto VS Sasuke in the valley of the end (there are several others but then I would spend all day talking about that).
 Now comes the worst part of the entire anime, the plot holes, starting with the questions that no one knows how to answer, how did Hashirama die? How did Minato master dead Kurama's cloak? Why didn't Hiruzen raise Naruto as a son? Why didn't Jiraiya come back even once in 10 years to help Naruto? Well, these are questions that we will probably never know the answer to, maybe in Boruto we can get an answer but for now we don't have anything.
   Ah, I wanted to talk about Naruto's charisma, I sincerely wish I had a friend like him, the guy just puts you up in conversation brother, besides we follow all his evolution both physically and emotionally, it's like I saw a son succeeding in life. Naruto really inspired my life even if the characters are not real and I know the work is far from perfect but it is definitely the work that marked my life and that's why it will always be in my heart.
   This is my humble review about Naruto, I didn't cover all the points that a review should have, I just talked about the points I'm interested in. 
Portuguese Version:
   Talvez a minha review seja positiva demais sobre Naruto pois foi graças a ele que eu comecei a ver animes e ter a paixão por obras japonesas como eu tenho hoje por isso para mim, apesar dos defeitos (que não são poucos) Naruto é está facilmente no meu top 3 animes favoritos. Como já faz tempo que vi o anime talvez eu não esteja especificando e detalhando muito já que não me recordo de tudo.
Dos defeitos que eu me lembro os mais marcantes são os fillers, a animação e os furos de roteiro. Começando com os fillers, a parte ruim: para quem acompanhou na época que lançava os episódios semanalmente sabe o quão frustrante era você esperar uma semana inteira para ver o desenrolar da trama do anime e me vim um filler do noda no meio da luta contando coisas aleatórias; a parte boa: tinha uns fillers muito mas muito engraçados cara, como exemplo tem aquele filler que o mostra o sonho de quem ta no tsukuyomi e no sonho do Kankuro é ele controlando um robô gigante kkkkkkk.
   A animação: bom em sua maior parte do tempo ela é mediana para boa entretanto no arco da 4º guerra ninja foi cagada átras de cagada em quesito de animação como exemplo tem a cena do Obito se virando depois de absorver a Juubi (aquilo foi horrível). Não citei a luta do Pain VS Naruto pois eu acho que foi um estilo de traço feito daquele jeito de proposito, como na luta do Gaara VS Rock Lee no clássico. Gostaria de citar algumas partes que a animação se superou: Kakashi VS Obito dentro do Kamui, Madara VS Guy com os 8 portões e Naruto VS Sasuke no vale do fim (tem varias outras mas ai eu ia passar o dia todo falando só disso).
Agora vem a pior parte de de todo o anime, os furos de roteiro, começando com as perguntas que ninguém sabe responder, como Hashirama morreu? Como que o Minato dominou o manto da Kurama morto? Porque o Hiruzen não criou o Naruto como filho? Porque o Jiraiya não voltou uma vez sequer em 10 anos para ajudar o Naruto? Bom, essas são perguntas que provavelmente nunca saberemos a resposta, talvez em Boruto a gente consigo alguma resposta mas por enquanto não temos nada.
   Ah, eu queria falar sobre o carisma do Naruto, eu sinceramente queria ter um amigo como ele, o cara te poem para cima só na conversa irmão, além de a gente acompanhar toda a evolução dele tanto física como emocional, é como se eu visse um filho tendo sucesso na vida. Naruto realmente inspirou minha vida mesmo que os personagens não sejam reais e eu sei que a obra ta longe de ser perfeita mas definitivamente é a obra que marcou a minha vida e por isso ela sempre vai estar em meu coração.
   Esta é a minha humilde review sobre Naruto, não abordei todos os pontos que uma review deveria ter, apenas falei dos pontos aos quais eu me interesso.

- TALKING ABOUT BOTH SERIES - NARUTO AND SHIPPUDEN
When you first look at this you think wow, this is very long. Nah, over 70% of it are fillers and just don't matter. 
Beside the absurd amount of fillers, the plot is pretty amazing, even though character development doesn't actually happen until half way between shippuden and doesn't happen at all in the original series. So basically you have to wait 700 episodes for Sakura to be less annoying, Sasuke to be less useless and a character who is 'there' to make Naruto's adventure somewhat meaningful. At least Kakashi stayed the best character throughout and wasn't
                  killed off like most of the other few great characters.
It may sound like I'm talking bad about this, but I really did love it even though a lot of the time it was frustrating to watch.

Shippuuden  (non filler) 
Story 9: pretty solid story I'd say but didn't get the end goal. Naruto did not become hakage(training to be one). Great story of friendships and working as a team. Growing together. 
Art 9: great art during fights, some of the animation is not the best in the background (character wise) never the least animation is great for it's time. 
Sound 8: few OP stuck with me, none of the ED stuck with me. Dub cast was on point too, I liked that some of the characters had different VA as time went on since they were getting older. 
Character 8:
                  great character development, almost all characters from Naruto played a big role in Shippuuden. I didn't end up liking Sasuke(I really don't see why people like him). If itachi didn't exist Sasuke would of been the worse character IMO.
Enjoyment 9: honestly fights scenes are incredible and the characters you meet you will fall in love with. 
Total: 8.6

I liked Naruto Shippuden a lot because (for the first half of the show) the plot was great but in the second half of the show the plot was kinda all over the place with lots of battles here and there.
Sure, it’s good that there’s a lot of action in it because that is what it’s meant to be like but half of the fights are filled with flashbacks which makes them last way longer than they should.
Do I think this is better than the original Naruto? Kinda. Some arcs of the show are just plain bad because sometimes you don't even know whats going
                  on in the fight.
The show does a good job censoring things like blood by making the person being hurt into just a black silhouette.
There is WAY TOO MUCH filler in this show. 45% of it is filler so it may seem there’s 500 episodes but if you’re watching without filler you only get to watch about 300. Also (I can’t confirm this considering I haven’t watched the filler) the filler is absolute dog poop.
The show has some good characters with interesting backstory and I think you’ll have a fun time learning about the characters.
This show is also a (mostly) family friendly show with not very much gore, blood or violence.

Naruto is a tricky one for me. I absolutely adore the manga, I'm still reading it and I was really excited when I heard that the Naruto Shippuden was coming! The first 30-40 episodes were alright...not great, but they weren't terrible. After that, there were just too many fillers, strayed quite a bit from the manga and I just dropped it. Also, I believe the anime just kind of got cheesy and the art wasn't as great either. So, overall, I give Naruto Shippuden a 8/10 because of the manga. The art is great, story is great, no fillers...but the Naruto Shippuden anime just gave
                  Naruto a bad name in my opinion. My recommendation: if you want to start reading Naruto or gave up on it, don't watch the anime! Read the manga, you won't be disappointed :) .

"Naruto Shippuuden" gets me nostalgic AF. It's the one anime that you can't stop thinking about for weeks after completion.The story and the plot is pretty awesome. Action scenes were also nice. Sometimes the animation sucked, but the story took care of it. For example, the pain arc .It has some plot holes, like deidora could use self explosion repeatedly in edo form. But the only thing that keeps me away from rating it a 10 is its "FILLERS". The first impression of 500 episodes scares the shit out of people .Still, overall it is a pretty decent one .I would highly recommend anyone who
                  has patience and guts to watch it. And skip the fillers if you want. You won't miss anything by doing so.

I keep my reviews short, simple, and to the point for those of you who don’t want to read the rest of these essays. If you liked Naruto, you will like naruto shippuden, it is absolutely worth your time. Do not watch shippuden unless you have already seen the 2002 naruto. This is a continuation of naruto. The fights are hype, the new villains are awesome, and there’s a huge improvement in characters. The world is expanded on even further, the story picks up and is fast paced. The powers get even cooler. We are blessed with some awesome  music/openings. It gets surprisingly emotional
                  at times, which you would not expect of this show. There are some must see fight scenes with legendary animation and build up. It has a problem with too many repetitive flashbacks, but you can skip through them so it isn’t unbearable. It sets up nicely for Boruto, which is the next continuation, while leaving you with a satisfying and conclusive end even if you are never to watch boruto. There are filler episodes like in the 2002 naruto and as I said in that review you can skip them and not miss out on the story, however if you have the time I would still go ahead and check them out if you are a fan. You can also just go back and watch them after you finish the main show. They are enjoyable and I do not regret sitting through them. If you are still hungry for more naruto after you finish, check out the movies.

Again, I skipped the filler in this show.  Say what you want about the rating and the payoffs and the pitfalls but let me tell you guys this show made me cry (you all know what specific character death I'm talking about here) laugh, rage and everything in-between.  You come to care for character's you never thought you would more than you ever thought you would.  You're invested in their lives and in the plot and despite all it's flaws I can't help but say the hate is not deserved.  Shippuden is really great, even better than the original imo, and
                  you can come to your own conclusion upon finishing it (believe me I have qualms myself) but please do give it a try.

After 1 week after the end of Naruto a new series Began named Naruto Shippuden, it s the sequel of the previous anime named Naruto, that takes place after 2 years of naruto training with Jirayia

honestly a 7 overall, but the reason I'm giving it an 8 is because of the way it ended. Ending shows is rly hard, and this one really stuck the landing. The final naruto and sasuke fight was perfect in terms of explaining their respective ideologies and how they clashed, and the way they reconciled was epic too. The actual fight itself was really nicely shown, and the symbolism and details throughout was top notch. The aftermath and the wedding was very nicely done as well, so props for that.
The middle of it though was really tough. From the end of the pain arc to
                  when Madara gets the ten tails, it felt really dull and monotonous honestly, except for some parts like the truth about Itachi. The early part of the war especially felt very boring and dull, the reanimations just didnt feel emotional when fighting, probably cos they weren't real, and that whole arc felt like a proper drag. If that middle part had honestly been cut in half, it would have made the whole thing way more enjoyable. I didnt even watch most of the filler episodes too, I can iamgine if I chose to do that, it would have turned out to be even more long and dull. 
Best advice to enjoy it, skip almost all fillers (search online for the few that are worth), and watch most of the war arc at x1.5 speed, cos its very repetitive and boring until Madara arises.

Anime with the best ninja story concept ever. I watched Naruto anime since I was in junior high school. This anime is very popular in Indonesia. All anime lovers in Indonesia, must know about Naruto.
An anime about epic ninja fights, and entertaining ninja adventures, as well as a harsh ninja world.
An anime that tells about Uzumaki Natuto, who wants to become Hokage, and become a great ninja, who is relied on by many people.
This anime is good, but there are things I don't like. Too many non-canon filler stories, and too many flashbacks, which doesn't really matter.

I'd be hard pressed to admit that Naruto: Shippuuden was entirely bad, but amidst all the action and story and characters, there's something the show sorely had too much of: Filler. 500 episodes and almost half of it (a quick google search shows you that it's 202 episodes exactly) doesn't develop the story. I haven't finished the anime but I know the whole story as I had just played the video games, and they're much better at conveying the long overarching story of this ninja epic. It highlights a glaring problem for me and possible newcomers to the series, that half of what you're watching
                  doesn't actually matter. I've only seen the show up until the end of the Five Kage arc and I'd be lying if I said that all the filler was bad, but that doesn't excuse the 90% of bad filler. The show would probably be a solid 8 for me but filler, filler, filler brings it down to a measly 6. Just play the videogames if you can, they're much more fun :)

I enjoyed watching this anime from the beginning when he was younger trying to prove himself and also when he came back as an adult. The only problem was that now the story seems like it is slowing down. It is taking them 2 months just to show 1 fight scene. Other than that I love this anime.

Naruto
1% action, 99% flashbacks
I love this anime and yet I hate the anime. It’s all about ninjas. The ideas are great but the story isn’t told well. 
So Naruto has a demon sealed inside him. A demon with nine tails, it’s one of nine tailed demons from the One Tail to the Nine Tails.
Because of this Naruto is hated by the villagers because this demon attacked their village a few years back. Naruto’s dream is to become leader of the village, the Hokage. This is the basic plot so far.
Now my main problem with this anime is that it’s suppose to be an action anime
                  but there isn’t that much action, just a bunch of talking, Naruto constantly makes a speech about how he wants to be Hokaga, Hokage, Hokage. When you think you’re gonna get a cool action sequence they interrupt it with a flashback. And they reuse the same flashbacks over and over and over…
It’s like Dragonball Z, now this is an anime that I love and hate. DBZ’s problem is that they’re always standing around staring at each other, charging their power, etc. But DBZ is better, better action, more interesting villains, etc.
You might enjoy this anime if you watch it online, but back then I didn’t have internet and was forced to watch 1 episode a week, so I didn’t have time to waste with flashbacks. 
Not much to say about Shippudden, Naruto hasn’t changed that much, he still uses the same techniques, the show got more serious but it’s still 1%action 99%flashbacks.
My favorite characters are Mito Guy and Rock Lee, these are I think the only two who actually use martial arts whereas everybody else is using ninjutsu and genjutsu (“magic” techniques)
