Naruto Shippuden is definitely one of those series where if you truly understand it, it becomes very memorable  whereas if you don't then you see it as mediocre.
in it's most basic form Naruto: Shippuden is a series where about a boy named Naruto who just wanted to fit in with people, become respected and acknowledged by everyone including his best friend and rival Uchiha Sasuke.  Naruto just represents the unacknowledged youth of today who are ignored by society and left all alone in to rot away.
now let's get down to my real review of Naruto: Shippuden
Naruto's story is fairly decent enough it doesn't
                  have the best writing of a Shonen anime but it's not bad either it's fairly good. many a times it's about how society can fck you up and make you purposeless that you start to hate society itself, but again this theme seems to be repetitive used amongst some of the major antagonists throughout the series, the plot seems fairly predictable but not as predictable as Mid Ball Z lol Shippuden also has some retcons which were never addressed by Masashi Kishimoto I won't point it out here cuz I don't wanna spoil anybody reading this review. but Naruto is definitely one of the best anime when it comes to plot-twists of the show but hpwever these twists can come off with 0 foreshadowing at all but that IMO does little to make the series look bad, Naruto has very deep real life philosophy and emphasis with characters like Itachi, Obito, Sasuke, Pain , Madara, Hashirama , Hagoromo and Naruto himself. these characters more or less have been through very tight circumstances and in each case they developed different ideologies which are very similar at the same time that they follow. these characters with do or die life situations seem to be  well written, when it comes to side characters who aren't villains or anti-heroes or dudes who didnt die a long time ago Naruto does fall short for example the females Naruto seriously are some of the most laglustre in popular the only who ones who even contribute a little are Sakura, Tsunade and Konan, and even then Sakura and Konan mostly serve as supportive beta females to their male counterparts while there is also Kaguya Otsutsuki who seems interesting as a character but the way she gets introduced is very unappealing oh I almost forgot to mention that Naruto:Shippuden also has one of  if not the worst written female character in anime Hinata Hyuga, a creep with no individuality who makes me sick just by appearing on screen like everytime she appears i feel like fast-forwarding. Naruto still has some good compelling side characters like Might Guy, Kakashi, Shikamaru, Choji and Sai.
Naruto definitely has Immaculate art and fight scenes, Naruto's fight scenes are one of the best in anime and it's mostly thanks to chakra for being a incredible power system throughout the series even from the days of the OG Naruto, Naruto fights such as Naruto vs Pain, Kakashi vs Obito, Might Guy vs Madara will always be remembered by Anime fans for generations to come, Baruti had very good comedy too especially with the adult jokes sprinkled in between.
when it comes to music Naruto: Shippuden has incredible masterpiece openings like Silhouette and Blue Bird and endings too, their music is so addicting that I think Naruto: Shippuden is the very reason why I stopped my habit of skipping the openings
Overall Naruto is a series that I would recommend if you have the time to go through an anime with 100s of episodes

In my opinion, Shippūden surpasses the original Naruto in some ways. Both are amazing shows, so what you favor more is up to you. Whether you decide on that or not, it is undeniable that Naruto Shippuden is a very successful and strong follow up to Naruto. It further explores the depth of many characters old and new. My favorite thing about this show is how each antagonist hardly feels like a villain. I was touched by their philosophies and how each compared to Naruto, the classic “bring peace to the world” guy. My only complaints with the show were the dragging out of the
                  Great Ninja War. This show, for me, was a 10/10 until the War. It was a good arc, BUT I found myself struggling to get through it towards the end. All in all, Naruto Shippuden was a fun watch!

A very reasonable title, cut with filler and flashbacks to the point of being barely watchable much of the time.  When in doubt, jump to a flashback.  If in doubt about a flashback, put a flashback in your flashback.  Are we at the climax of the series?  Better bump it up to 90% flashback content.  Can't remember what's going on because of all the flashbacks?  Better recap — with a flashback.
The producers of the Naruto Shippuden anime milked what I assume was a pretty good manga for easily three to four times its value by turning exceptionally bad hack
                  writers loose on the story between installments of the manga, and by... well, it's like that time...
 When in doubt, jump to a flashback.  If in doubt about a flashback, put a flashback in your flashback.  Are we at the climax of the series?  Better bump it up to 90% flashback content.
And then there was that other time...
...Cut with filler and flashbacks to the point of being barely watchable much of the time.
...Better recap — with a flashback.
...Are we at the climax of the series?
Well, I'm sure you get the gist of why this should have been a much, MUCH shorter series.
That, and the Yota mini-arc.  Seriously, **** that guy.

I hate the way the female characters are written and designed. Why should kunoichi, female NINJA who are ACTIVE and shit, wear HEELS (ahem Sakura and Konan)??? That shit hurts your feet, and in many places of the world (ahem Japan)  women are still forced to wear high heels because misogyny. And yet it is being glorified by this show.
Why won't any of the main female characters stop moaning and groaning about some man? The male characters never sacrifice so much of their time and energy for a woman. 
"But Kishimoto said he can't write women" that's so fucking misogynistic. You write women
                  like you would write any other character. It's like you're saying you're bad at writing black people. Why treat us as some completely different species?
If you are going to treat women this way, then there is no point of having them as main characters and fighters in the first place, since they usually just get sidelined and protected by the men anyway.
For some reason i watched every single filler episode so my judgement of the actual story line is really clouded, but I loved the major fights and they made sense to me.
Spoilers ahead of this point!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Sasuke's motivations however make no sense to me. Poorly written edgelord. Wanting to kill Konoha even though Itachi died for the sake of konoha. The only romantic relationship that made sense by the end of Shippuden was Temari and Shikamaru's. They had good chemistry.
Sasuke almost killing Sakura like 2 times and Sakura still pining for Sasuke for no other reason than him being attractive is terrible. Naruto still having a crush on Sakura for no reason and not having feelings for Hinata until the very end is shit writing. I mean, he even ignored her trying to cheer him up after Neji's death and her putting her hand on his face and them holding hands. And then he had the audacity to say to Minato "yeah Sakura is my gf lol" like bruh. Could've had him thinking after the fact "hmmm Hinata is very nice, Sakura never treated me like that, I think I wanna go talk to her more." But noooo. Instead he ignores her until the fucking shit movie that established their relationship.
Overall I just think the characters are poorly written and illogical.

The story is absolutely beautiful. You have epic fights combined with deep emotions and unpredictable story changes that will blow your mind.
Marvelous. There are dozens of different characters and every one is unique. Even the side characters have distinguishable features, and the main characters show a character depth that many Hollywood movies could learn from nowadays.
Let's take the villain Orochimaru for example. He is easily the most well-designed antagonist I have seen in any motion picture, even in all the books I read I can't find a character like him. Pure evil. Cunning, bizarre, and frightening. On top of his unpredictable actions and twisted motives,
                  the music appearing together with him just rounds up the presentation of this character, and to me, makes it unforgettable.
I have a full review here http://bit.ly/3phZ9LI

Naruto is a series that a lot of people enjoy, my self-included at one point. That opinion changed however upon a second view of the series as a whole. While the many flaws that exist within this show could be repeated, they are ultimately mute as the real problems that exist in this show are most prevalent in it's story/character direction and its predictability. Naruto is a story that set itself up from the very beginning as a tale about a nobody coming from nothing and struggling to become the greatest so as to earn the respect and acknowledgement of his peers and those in
                  his community. It is a decent plot, one that has been unfortunately been beaten like a dead horse throughout shonen for the past several decades. As many know upon the completion of Shippuden however, that idea went out the window. Naruto is revealed to have been the reincarnation of the Christ analog of his universe as he and the rest of the main cast of heroes and villains are ushered into the levels of godhood that no other ninja regardless of effort could hope to replicate. Many state that this is where Naruto lost sight of its identity but I argue something more introspective. It never had one. Naruto has always had the Nine-Tails inside of him since episode one,  a mass of chakra with whom there are no contenders. Naruto uses the Nine-Tails to overcome every fight in the series in some way, shape, or form with one (arguably two) exceptions. Unfortunately, that isn't rising from nothing. That's taking the worlds greatest advantage and using it like a crutch instead of bettering yourself but then passing it off as of own efforts born of sweat, blood, and tears. If you took the Nine-Tails away from Naruto or created a situation where he couldn't bulldoze his way through a fight with virtually unlimited power, I can guarantee you that Naruto would lose and his opponent would be uninjured. All of his efforts only amount to him getting beat up on screen for ten minutes until he decides to end his fights with his signature technique, the Nine-Tails, or a combination of the two. You could watch all the fights that transpired with Naruto and 99.8 of them end this way. It gets to the point where fans of the series already know in the back of their mind how a fight is going to end before it even starts. Beyond that, the cast suffers from Bleach syndrome, in that the series has way too many side characters and jutsu and doesn't develop a majority of them beyond the surface level. The main cast is okay. I don't dislike Sakura and though she can be infuriating at times, I regard her as just another shonen woman who is doing her best to contribute to a series that primarily doesn't need her. I found Sasuke interesting, even for rival archetypes as his role is primarily undefined by Naruto which is good. Barring some moments where he acted out of character through the later half of the series, I was at least invested in his story. Kakashi is a great character with whom I probably never would have gotten through Naruto if he was not there. His role as the group mentor however was not the best as he is quickly abandoned by all three main characters midway through the series and is then out right replaced during a particular arc only to note upon his return that his students have surpassed him and don't need him anymore when they arguably have never needed him. The series also falls victim to key events that are ultimately made contrived to the point of insanity for the sake of preserving continuity and plot holes so gaping, I'm surprised they haven't imploded the series into several, conjoining black holes. I don't hate Naruto, as it is a series that does it's job in entertaining viewers (to an extent) but I can't help but feel as though it failed to tell the story it wanted to tell. Even part of the end goal is not even addressed until another (less popular) spin-off which cheapens the adventure that viewers invested their time in to see. While I would not recommend this series to anyone curious, I will not deter them from doing so as Naruto is an undeniably an experience but one that may leave you feeling disappointed and cheated.

This series has disappointed me greatly in multiple ways, the main cases being how it destroys the core aspects of the series themes and how most of the loved side characters were handled poorly in execution and many established characters ended forgettable. There are other things such as the pacing being off in some arcs and inconsistent world building however, I would like to finish this review on a positive note and say that the actual production quality in regards to art and audio was generally done well.
In conclusion:
Shippuden hasn't succeeded in surpassing the original
Has glaring problems that are overlooked 
Is overall a 6/10

ok so I've seen like 69+ series and I will have to say that this is most pathetic series. I watched up to shippuden 40. I am telling you nothing interesting happens, and like 90% of the series is filler anyway.

                  all the fan girls swoon over while he talks about how much he resents his brother and must AVENGE HIS CLAN! get over it already and last you have your naturally talented good girl who has a crush on the bad boy, even though its obvious he hates her and that the other guy would kill to have her. Okay this is going to be long so please bear with me. Prior to me many have written reviews on this so, you may not find many new points. So I will not write about separately about story, art etc instead I will try to provide my view objectively. Now coming to Naruto Shippuden, I believe it has received so much positivity majorly due to its nostalgia factor. It may not be as bad as I make it to be for some people but let me explain you in detail.
First let us discuss the main protagonists of the show:
The main problem I had with this
                  is the main trio. We can simply state them in three words ie, dumb,dumber,dumbest. Yes, they are so dumb. Naruto, the protagonist of the series never ever grows up. He is same as he was in Naruto(prequel) except for a few changes. And the people who used to dislike him come to like him for his same dumb antics. Even the characters who had rarely interacted with him believe in him and give *If its Naruto then it can be possible* vibes. They are the same people who hated him before.
The dumber part of the show goes to sakura. She is there to make us believe that she is equally strong and determined in the team #7. Her love(only if you can call it that) towards Sasuke is so unreasonable and forced. She is so clingy and is there just to make life of naruto difficult. She, like naruto never stops the "sasuke sasuke" thing which is annoying as hell. Kishimoto tries so hard to make us think she has become better. She has always been useless, only occasionally used to make us believe even she is strong. At other parts of the show ahe is just there to occupy space.
Now comes the dumbest part of the show. Yes, you guessed it right. It is none other than Sasuke. He is one of the main characters of the show but is absent for nearly half of the show. He gets ready to follow some stranger for the sake of power and ends up abandoning his comrades. To speak it was due to his jealousy towards naruto that made him to become strong. His motives are so messed up and they fluctuate tad bit too much to sympathize for his losses. Even till the end he is as hopeless as a person can get. I am trying to not spoil much but his sense of thinking is so messed up in the later part of the series.
This is not all, our main protagonist is so righteous that he goes on and on about friendship that he ends up putting all of his friends into risk in order to save one selfish, arrogant idiot. He gives so lengthy speeches to the antagonists that it makes me sick. He never stops ranting. He is just too loud and annoying for a protagonist. His attitude isn't any better as he does some pretty nonsensical shit during missions that would definitely make you question his maturity even after these many years. 
Yes, 2 years later, Naruto became 15 years old, and his personality is still the same. He is still unable to refrain from himself from doing something stupid that would fuck up his whole team. What irritates me are the techniques. For some reason, everything is an upgraded version of his previous techniques; Rasengan to Odama Rasengan to Rasenshuriken. 5 Clones to 100 Clones, then went to 1000 Clones.
Flashbacks are normal in many animes. However, Naruto is an exemption. The flashback last so long and most of the scenes are being repeated. Flashbacks in Naruto do not bear much significance in the story and yet I do not see the reason in dragging the flashbacks.
The fight scenes in this show are all talk and no battle. The fight scenes bores me to death. Fight scenes are very predictable. All characters spend most of their time just standing an telling lame stories rather than fighting. This is how the fights go- Naruto uses Kagebunshin. The enemy beats all of them, beats Naruto to pulp, then Naruto teaches the enemy about life and friendship and at last Naruto hits the enemy with a rasengan and the fight ends.
The backstories every antagonist is almost the same. Almost all were good but a single situation fucked up their lives and they end up on the bad side. This is not to say that there are no good characters. They are there but they take the back seat in the show.
It took Naruto heck lot of episodes to just get a single power up. There is nothing wrong with it but in the final few arcs he literally becomes god which makes all his hard work seem pointless.
The final arcs:
Ah! These are the worst part of the the show. It involves the great shinobi war which is dragged to death. It is very poorly written and the antagonist at the end of the show makes this show a joke. There is no build up for it. Yes it is the kaguya part. The war part almost makes naruto and his precious friend sasuke gods. They become gods to defeat gods and naruto is now even capable of healing. The final arcs make all the established rules and world building look stupid. Logic goes for a toss in most parts.
The good parts like a few arcs and characters are highly overshadowed by the terrible pacing, whole lot of filler and dumb main trio. The pacing is so terrible that there are so many pauses and others efforts put in to drag the show which make me feel nothing even after a bunch of episodes, as they cover very little progression. Don't even get me started on fillers. They just dragged the anime to make some 700 episodes which is not very enjoyable.
Finally there are good aspects which others mentioned so I chose not to as I feel they are so overshadowed by the fillers, pacing and the terrible main cast. I don't know how many people liked naruto but to me he seems too dumb and immature. So I mainly believe that this show rides on nostalgic factor. It has many notable inspirations taken from famous shonen series like HunterxHunter and Dragon Ball. 
In the end all I want to say that there are better shonen series like HunterxHunter and it is not worth the time you put into this series. Believe me when I say you won't miss a single part of story even if you watch it in 2x speed. By the way this is my first anime review. Anyway it doesn't really matter as I have rather made this review pretty late I guess.
I beg your pardon for any grammatical mistakes.
Thank you for your patience. Signing off...

Ignoring the filler and focusing on the main story, it is a pretty decent anime. The writing on the villains was compelling but pretty much every moral struggle that any of them had was exactly the same, the talk no jutsu meme. The characters are generally interesting and likable but non of them have any character development. Most characters are exactly the same when the show ends as when the show starts, just with slightly more context. It quite literally takes to the last canon episode for Sasuke to stop being a douche, which is saying a lot. The fight choreography was really good for
                  important fights but lackluster for anything in between, so good on average. The show for me was a good gateway into anime but after rewatching it recently, I found that it isn't as good as I remembered and is definitely overhyped. I compare it to Star Wars where most of the content is mediocre but it creates a universe and deep lore that is very interesting and worth keeping up with.

[this review may contain spoilers!!!]

I have been sa watcher of Naruto for over three years now, and I must say, it has changed A LOT! Allow me to explain. 
Story:
The Story overall is kind of good. I like the whole original idea of Ninjas being the supreme beings in the world and like to kick each others asses just to show off their powerful swirling balls of air. In fact, sometimes it was SO original, that I couldn't even keep up with the huge cluster fuck of plot twists and new characters that were popping up in between canon and filler arcs. Since I made I to that part,
                  let's talk abouit the fillers. YAAAAAYYY! We all luv um. I lied, I hate them actually. And Naruto's fillers are SOO BAD that I, at one point, dropped the anime for a year, came back a year later, and they have only advanced 20 episodes of Canon. The gap between canon and filler is so small now. There is  new BORING filler arc every month. It is PATHETIC!!! 
Art:
The art for the anime was pretty good at the beginning of the series. The character design was complex and different, but as the series progressed, the art became lazier and lazier. Did you see the art for the Pein Arc? Holy Shit, what a fucking mess. And its only been worse from there. I'm scared that its going to turn into fucking Lucky Star five years from now. And we all know its going to last that long too, so shut up.
Sound:
All of the openings are also lazily done including the transitional music. They all sound the fucking same! The first Naruto series before Shippuden was pretty gifted in its music. Sadness and Sorrow was a really good song. One of my favorites, but it all went downhill from there.
Character:
There are s many characters, and surprisingly, I've managed to memorize all of their names. It's pretty amazing, . But seriously, thatsd the problem. Theres just too many. And the ones that are superfluous are just a waste of animation! They are fricking annoying and can't fight for themselves! All of his friends are pretty stupid. 
Enjoyment:
Meh
Overall:
6.5

I will keep this short:
Manga 10/10
Games 10/10 (they are much better then even manga)
Anime 4/10
Once again the filler percentage is around 41% with ethe same problems as the Naruto Part 1 anime. Fillers don't give us nothing new to overall story, and exist only to overstretch the anime livespan. When anime adapts the story from the manga it's really perfect, but when the filler arrives it simply downgrades.I did even put a higher score because this show started to adapt some of light novels, but if you're watching this anime weekly it was impossible to tell the difference back then. For the manga it's really
                  a shonen classic at this point of time. The Storm games did even surpass the manga with the showcase of the final bosses fights (Naruto Shippuden opening 8 reference is the best example).

This may be a hot take but I do not find Naruto to be a very well written character. He has no character growth throughout the show and you always know what he will do. It makes the show agonizingly predictable. Also many main cast characters such as Sakura are also very poorly written. Its also a shame because Naruto has some of the most well written characters in all of anime, but they are surprisingly under covered in the story. Secondly the show does a great job making a very interesting story between Sasuke and Naruto (although I think its a bit under-covered). Also
                  the story behind Itachi is truly a written masterpiece. Overall the main thing the story has going for it is that the writers did a great job of making lovable characters. You are hooked to the anime to see if the characters will succeed. And in the end they do. But now... yall know I was going to talk about this...
Fillers... Okay so... If I take away the fillers I would rate naruto probably a 8 or 9. But the sheer antagonizing fillers brings this show all the way to a 5. If you calculate. 47% of this entire show is filler. Let that sink it. Even if you have a filler guide, near the end the fillers all have some vital info so you need to watch SMH.

There's a reason why Naruto Shippuden is at the mantle of the Big 3, and why it righteously holds a solid reputation.
When people regard Shippuden in a negative light the main point is typically filler, now obviously it's a fair complaint but easily avoidable and in some cases unavoidable for the animators. At least they made filler for those who enjoy it, opposed to not making anything at all.
In my opinion the peak of the anime was the pain arc, I have a hunch that Mishimoto had originally intended for the story to wrap up there but the franchise had just too much money potential.
                  
While the following arcs were great, I think that it almost dragged out the eventual ending of it and for someone to watch the series through, it could derive them from the original enjoyment and feelings that were conveyed. 
Overall, a great anime for anyone starting out. And even for those who want to develop a liking to the action genre as well.

I love the Naruto franchise... and Shippuden Just solidified that fact for me!!!
Naruto is a challenging exploration of themes such as the cycle of hatred, war, comradery, and peace. Through its expressive and varied cast of characters, it paints a vivid picture of the world in which they inhabit. This rich world is further brought to life by the gorgeous sound design and visuals. Shippuden truly is a sensory treat.
And I haven't even started on the characters. Kishimoto works best in creating memorable and fresh character dynamics that keep you drawn to the screen. In particular the dynamic between Naruto and Pain is a masterclass
                  in storytelling, not only being highly enjoyable, but also deeply tying into the show's themes...

Thank you for reading my review.
Glopglup, signing off...

This anime is by far my favorite, and I don't think there'll be anything that will surpass it. Though, I will admit it isn't overall perfect, but what anime is. All that matters that in my eyes I believe it to be the best and that's my opinion.
Story- 9/10
The story in Shippuden, while not extremely complex like some anime, it still contains underlying tones and messages in its arcs that make you think. It starts off immediately into an entertaining arc that once it starts the series never looks back. There wasn't an arc that I can say I didn't enjoy (excluding filler), some are
                  even my favorite arcs in all of anime, and while they mainly dealt with Naruto and Sasuke, the arcs also gave other characters development and growth that you don't see in a lot of series. The results of each arc are felt and have lasting effects on the characters and me as a viewer. Some arcs made me cry, some cheer, and some even caused me to reflect on life. Character deaths are meaningful and aren't something that are just brushed past, they are talked about and impact the series the rest of the show. The world is expanded upon and so is the lore that makes a somewhat smaller world larger and enhances it in the process. 
Art- 8.5/10
The animation in this show is its weakest point, but I wouldn't call it a negative. There are moments where you can see the flaws in certain scenes, where characters are making weird faces. Other than that the animation is good and the fight scenes are very well done with the visuals looking extremely good and the characters animated well. The fight scenes especially are amazing, with the attacks looking great, and the choreography of the fights can be among the best.
Sound- 10/10
The ost for Shippuden is among the best with emotional scenes being enhances by the background music, the fights feeling more intense because of it, and the comedic scenes better. So, the soundtrack does what it's supposed to do, enhances the overall anime. It is also, so good that I listen to a lot of them in my free time outside of watching the anime.
Characters- 10/10
Now we are on the strongest point of Shippuden, the cast of characters. Naruto and Sasuke are my favorite characters in anime, along with a couple of the supporting characters being in my top 20. Naruto and Sasuke are very well layered characters that change with what they experience around them, making them feel very human. Their bond is also something to love because they are the best pair of characters in anime, with how they interact with each other. Then, there's the supporting cast like; Kakashi, Shikamaru, Might Guy, Jiraiya, etc. Most get developed, some more than others, but it helps make you care more about these characters and what they go through in the story. Lastly there's the villains, which are also extremely strong characters, who have their own backstories and reasons for what they do. It makes you understand them, sympathize with them, and even agree with some of the points that they make. So, overall the characters are one of the major reasons that I enjoyed Shippuden. 
Enjoyment- 10/10
If you couldn't tell based off of what I wrote before this, I enjoy Shippuden to the fullest degree. Enough that I re-watched it twice and still got the same enjoyment out of it that I had the first time I watched it. 
Overall- 10/10 
So, overall I think that this is the best anime out there. Obviously this is my opinion and everyone has a right to their own. However, I request that you give it a chance if you haven't already, and I hope you get the same enjoyment out of it as I did.

Naruto is a masterpiece buttttttttt jjba part seven steel ball run is ranked second so TAKE THAT NARUTO STANS.But if im being for real naruto is a masterpiece and in my opinion its a starting anime there are so many genres but naruto is just a average shounen jump normal power system and very well boring at times.Out of 500 episodes 210 are fillers thats 40 episodes away from being half FORTY.Almost half of naruto is just fillers and straight up boring.Comparing it to jjba is in my opinion pretty rude so I wont.Now that we got past the bad part the good parts well
                  its probably just the memorys and friends i made.Naruto was the first anime I have ever watched (other than pokemon) so it will always hold a place in my heart.

strong points
+ best thing about naruto has got to be the characters. naruto, itachi, jiraiya, these are just some of the few examples of profoundly impactful characters that have etched a deep impression onto its viewers and caused viewers to be extremely emotionally attached to them and whatever they may experience throughout the story
+ although not particularly sophisticated and intellectual to the likes of Death Note and Code Geass, naruto's story and universe in general are still very comprehensive and feel very immersive for the viewer
+ the use of music is very focused and adds heavily onto the atmosphere as and when appropriate, changing the
                  mood and tone as it goes along.
+ many of the fight scenes that happen are very well thought out where characters do interesting things to try to outsmart their opponents or work together effectively to form a better strategy, generally applies for most fights
weak points
- of course the major criticism naruto gets is the insane amount of filler material/flashbacks present (almost 40% of the 500 episodes) and while this definitely prevents naruto from being a straight 9/10 due to the repetitiveness and loss of impact from overusing fillers, there is a filler guide available people use it as necessary
- naturally, naruto's art and animations are not particularly the best. some character's faces and fight scenes in general are poorly animated (e.g. naruto vs pain) although generally they are good enough to go buy most of the time. don't expect anything close to violet evergarden or anything like that
- naruto's pacing can be questionable at times, although this applies more exclusively for earlier seasons. from less important events being explored heavily to extremely draggy fight scenes, these are some of the issues with pacing. once again however, not a very big issue for the most part of naruto especially if you follow the filler guide
at the end of the day, naruto is still one of the best big-ticket mainstream animes out there with a really comprehensive universe and some of the most impactful characters out there.

The story, once again follows this orphan boy who's now a trained ninja in this never ending war. Even if they say the fillers are ended, i don't have the trust in watching anymore, simply had to many downers on naruto. 
i don't wanna enjoy 5 episode's and then another bunch of shitty fillers.
I maybe would have enjoyed the fillers more if the where
                  before the war, or just in some more OVA's those happen during the war, My naruto rate dropped from 9 to 6.

The anime is good, I liked it, but there are points where they went wrong. Poorly used characters (that could be fucking harnessed), I also did not like the fact that they used the Edo Tensei just to have the war. And one point I did not like too, is that, from the moment Naruto went into the war, only a single day passed. Also has the fact of the doujutsus, in Naruto Classic, all had the knowledge of two doujutsus, that are respectively, Sharingan and Byakugan. They fucking enjoyed the Sharingan, until Magekyo appeared in the classic and taus, but nothing said that they
                  could summon a megazord. I know these things are secret and blablabla, but, do you really think they were thinking about these things when they created the Sharingan? (In this case Kishimoto). But, like I said, I liked the anime, the anime story until it was good ... Until the war started, that sucked. I also liked the fights, the important moments and the appearance of the Akatsuki, the Plot. So my grade is 6 for that.

So this is not going to be a long review. Naruto is one of the most beloved manga, and it is noy hard to understand why. The setting is unique and the characters are very intresting. 
But in Shippuden all the elements that made part 1 unique are lost after a certain point. The fillers are too many making about 40 % of the series and the final arc is boring and full of plotholes. Now it might have stumbed a bit in the final arc but the ending is where it truly failed. Extremely important plotpoints are left unresolved and brushed aside and the
                  characters lose their essence. It basically feels like you are watching strangers, which can be painful especially if you have come to love the characters and mainly the protagonist Naruto Uzumaki who loses all of the qualities that made him lovable among the audiences.
